2762  }
2763  }
2764 }
2765 
2766 static void stb__insert_alloc(stb__alloc *src, stb__alloc *s)
2767 {
2768  s->prevn = &src->child;
2769  s->next = src->child;
2770  src->child = s+1;
2771  if (s->next)
2772  *stb__prevn(s->next) = &s->next;
2773 }
2774 
2775 static void stb__insert_nochild(stb__alloc *src, stb__nochildren *s)
2776 {
2777  s->prevn = &src->child;
2778  s->next = src->child;
2779  src->child = s+1;
2780  if (s->next)
2781  *stb__prevn(s->next) = &s->next;
2782 }
2783 
2784 static void * malloc_base(void *context, size_t size, stb__alloc_type t, int align)
2785 {
2786  void *p;
2787 
2788  stb__alloc *src = stb__get_context(context);
2789 
2790  if (align <= 0) {
2791  // compute worst-case C packed alignment
2792  // e.g. a 24-byte struct is 8-aligned
2793  int align_proposed = 1 << stb_lowbit8(size);
2794 
2795  if (align_proposed < 0)
2796  align_proposed = 4;
2797 
2798  if (align_proposed == 0) {
2799  if (size == 0)
2800  align_proposed = 1;
2801  else
2802  align_proposed = 256;
2803  }
2804 
2805  // a negative alignment means 'don't align any larger
2806  // than this'; so -16 means we align 1,2,4,8, or 16
2807 
2808  if (align < 0) {
2809  if (align_proposed > -align)
2810  align_proposed = -align;
2811  }
2812 
2813  align = align_proposed;
2814  }
2815 
2816  assert(stb_is_pow2(align));
2817 
2818  // don't cause misalignment when allocating nochildren
2819  if (t == STB__nochildren && align > 8)
2820  t = STB__alloc;
2821 
2822  switch (t) {
2823  case STB__alloc: {
2824  stb__alloc *s = (stb__alloc *) malloc(size + sizeof(*s));
2825  if (s == NULL) return NULL;
2826  p = s+1;
2827  s->child = NULL;
2828  stb__insert_alloc(src, s);
2829 
2830  stb__setchunks(s,NULL);
2831  break;
2832  }
2833 
2834  case STB__nochildren: {
2835  stb__nochildren *s = (stb__nochildren *) malloc(size + sizeof(*s));
2836  if (s == NULL) return NULL;
2837  p = s+1;
2838  stb__insert_nochild(src, s);
2839  break;
2840  }
2841 
2842  case STB__chunk_raw: {
2843  p = stb__alloc_chunk(src, size, align, 0);
2844  if (p == NULL) return NULL;
2845  break;
2846  }
2847 
2848  case STB__chunked: {
2849  stb__chunked *s;
2850  if (align < sizeof(stb_uintptr)) align = sizeof(stb_uintptr);
2851  s = (stb__chunked *) stb__alloc_chunk(src, size, align, sizeof(*s));
2852  if (s == NULL) return NULL;
2853  stb__setparent(s, src);
2854  p = s+1;
2855  break;
2856  }
2857 
2858  default: p = NULL; assert(0); /* NOTREACHED */
2859  }
2860 
2861  ++stb_alloc_count_alloc;
2862  return p;
2863 }
2864 
2865 void *stb_malloc_global(size_t size)
2866 {
2867  return malloc_base(NULL, size, STB__alloc, stb_alloc_alignment);
2868 }
2869 
2870 void *stb_malloc(void *context, size_t size)
2871 {
2872  return malloc_base(context, size, STB__alloc, stb_alloc_alignment);
2873 }
2874 
2875 void *stb_malloc_nofree(void *context, size_t size)
2876 {
2877  return malloc_base(context, size, STB__chunked, stb_alloc_alignment);
2878 }
2879 
2880 void *stb_malloc_leaf(void *context, size_t size)
2881 {
2882  return malloc_base(context, size, STB__nochildren, stb_alloc_alignment);
2883 }
2884 
2885 void *stb_malloc_raw(void *context, size_t size)
2886 {
2887  return malloc_base(context, size, STB__chunk_raw, stb_alloc_alignment);
2888 }
2889 
2890 char *stb_malloc_string(void *context, size_t size)
2891 {
2892  return (char *) malloc_base(context, size, STB__chunk_raw, 1);
2893 }
2894 
2895 void *stb_realloc(void *ptr, size_t newsize)
2896 {
2897  stb__alloc_type t;
2898 
2899  if (ptr == NULL) return stb_malloc(NULL, newsize);
2900  if (newsize == 0) { stb_free(ptr); return NULL; }
2901 
2902  t = stb__identify(ptr);
2903  assert(t == STB__alloc || t == STB__nochildren);
2904 
2905  if (t == STB__alloc) {
2906  stb__alloc *s = (stb__alloc *) ptr - 1;
2907 
2908  s = (stb__alloc *) realloc(s, newsize + sizeof(*s));
2909  if (s == NULL) return NULL;
2910 
2911  ptr = s+1;
2912 
2913  // update pointers
2914  (*s->prevn) = ptr;
2915  if (s->next)
2916  *stb__prevn(s->next) = &s->next;
2917 
2918  if (s->child)
2919  *stb__prevn(s->child) = &s->child;
2920 
2921  return ptr;
2922  } else {
2923  stb__nochildren *s = (stb__nochildren *) ptr - 1;
2924 
2925  s = (stb__nochildren *) realloc(ptr, newsize + sizeof(s));
2926  if (s == NULL) return NULL;
2927 
2928  // update pointers
2929  (*s->prevn) = s+1;
2930  if (s->next)
2931  *stb__prevn(s->next) = &s->next;
2932 
2933  return s+1;
2934  }
2935 }
2936 
2937 void *stb_realloc_c(void *context, void *ptr, size_t newsize)
2938 {
2939  if (ptr == NULL) return stb_malloc(context, newsize);
2940  if (newsize == 0) { stb_free(ptr); return NULL; }
2941  // @TODO: verify you haven't changed contexts
2942  return stb_realloc(ptr, newsize);
2943 }
2944 
2945 void stb_reassign(void *new_context, void *ptr)
2946 {
2947  stb__alloc *src = stb__get_context(new_context);
2948 
2949  stb__alloc_type t = stb__identify(ptr);
2950  assert(t == STB__alloc || t == STB__nochildren);
2951 
2952  if (t == STB__alloc) {
2953  stb__alloc *s = (stb__alloc *) ptr - 1;
2954 
2955  // unlink from old
2956  *(s->prevn) = s->next;
2957  if (s->next)
2958  *stb__prevn(s->next) = s->prevn;
2959 
2960  stb__insert_alloc(src, s);
2961  } else {
2962  stb__nochildren *s = (stb__nochildren *) ptr - 1;
2963 
2964  // unlink from old
2965  *(s->prevn) = s->next;
2966  if (s->next)
2967  *stb__prevn(s->next) = s->prevn;
2968 
2969  stb__insert_nochild(src, s);
2970  }
2971 }
2972 
2973 #endif
2974 
2975 
2977 //
2978 // stb_arr
2979 //
2980 // An stb_arr is directly useable as a pointer (use the actual type in your
2981 // definition), but when it resizes, it returns a new pointer and you can't
2982 // use the old one, so you have to be careful to copy-in-out as necessary.
2983 //
2984 // Use a NULL pointer as a 0-length array.
2985 //
2986 // float *my_array = NULL, *temp;
2987 //
2988 // // add elements on the end one at a time
2989 // stb_arr_push(my_array, 0.0f);
2990 // stb_arr_push(my_array, 1.0f);
2991 // stb_arr_push(my_array, 2.0f);
2992 //
2993 // assert(my_array[1] == 2.0f);
2994 //
2995 // // add an uninitialized element at the end, then assign it
2996 // *stb_arr_add(my_array) = 3.0f;
2997 //
2998 // // add three uninitialized elements at the end
2999 // temp = stb_arr_addn(my_array,3);
3000 // temp[0] = 4.0f;
3001 // temp[1] = 5.0f;
3002 // temp[2] = 6.0f;
3003 //
3004 // assert(my_array[5] == 5.0f);
3005 //
3006 // // remove the last one
3007 // stb_arr_pop(my_array);
3008 //
3009 // assert(stb_arr_len(my_array) == 6);
3010 
3011 
3012 #ifdef STB_MALLOC_WRAPPER
3013  #define STB__PARAMS , char *file, int line
3014  #define STB__ARGS , file, line
3015 #else
3016  #define STB__PARAMS
3017  #define STB__ARGS
3018 #endif
3019 
3020 // calling this function allocates an empty stb_arr attached to p
3021 // (whereas NULL isn't attached to anything)
3022 STB_EXTERN void stb_arr_malloc(void **target, void *context);
3023 
3024 // call this function with a non-NULL value to have all successive
3025 // stbs that are created be attached to the associated parent. Note
3026 // that once a given stb_arr is non-empty, it stays attached to its
3027 // current parent, even if you call this function again.
3028 // it turns the previous value, so you can restore it
3029 STB_EXTERN void* stb_arr_malloc_parent(void *p);
3030 
3031 // simple functions written on top of other functions
3032 #define stb_arr_empty(a) ( stb_arr_len(a) == 0 )
3033 #define stb_arr_add(a) ( stb_arr_addn((a),1) )
3034 #define stb_arr_push(a,v) ( *stb_arr_add(a)=(v) )
3035 
3036 typedef struct
3037 {
3038  int len, limit;
3039  int stb_malloc;
3040  unsigned int signature;
3041 } stb__arr;
3042 
3043 #define stb_arr_signature 0x51bada7b // ends with 0123 in decimal
3044 
3045 // access the header block stored before the data
3046 #define stb_arrhead(a) /*lint --e(826)*/ (((stb__arr *) (a)) - 1)
3047 #define stb_arrhead2(a) /*lint --e(826)*/ (((stb__arr *) (a)) - 1)
3048 
3049 #ifdef STB_DEBUG
3050 #define stb_arr_check(a) assert(!a || stb_arrhead(a)->signature == stb_arr_signature)
3051 #define stb_arr_check2(a) assert(!a || stb_arrhead2(a)->signature == stb_arr_signature)
3052 #else
3053 #define stb_arr_check(a) ((void) 0)
3054 #define stb_arr_check2(a) ((void) 0)
3055 #endif
3056 
3057 // ARRAY LENGTH
3058 
3059 // get the array length; special case if pointer is NULL
3060 #define stb_arr_len(a) (a ? stb_arrhead(a)->len : 0)
3061 #define stb_arr_len2(a) ((stb__arr *) (a) ? stb_arrhead2(a)->len : 0)
3062 #define stb_arr_lastn(a) (stb_arr_len(a)-1)
3063 
3064 // check whether a given index is valid -- tests 0 <= i < stb_arr_len(a)
3065 #define stb_arr_valid(a,i) (a ? (int) (i) < stb_arrhead(a)->len : 0)
3066 
3067 // change the array length so is is exactly N entries long, creating
3068 // uninitialized entries as needed
3069 #define stb_arr_setlen(a,n) \
3070  (stb__arr_setlen((void **) &(a), sizeof(a[0]), (n)))
3071 
3072 // change the array length so that N is a valid index (that is, so
3073 // it is at least N entries long), creating uninitialized entries as needed
3074 #define stb_arr_makevalid(a,n) \
3075  (stb_arr_len(a) < (n)+1 ? stb_arr_setlen(a,(n)+1),(a) : (a))
3076 
3077 // remove the last element of the array, returning it
3078 #define stb_arr_pop(a) ((stb_arr_check(a), (a))[--stb_arrhead(a)->len])
3079 
3080 // access the last element in the array
3081 #define stb_arr_last(a) ((stb_arr_check(a), (a))[stb_arr_len(a)-1])
3082 
3083 // is iterator at end of list?
3084 #define stb_arr_end(a,i) ((i) >= &(a)[stb_arr_len(a)])
3085 
3086 // (internal) change the allocated length of the array
3087 #define stb_arr__grow(a,n) (stb_arr_check(a), stb_arrhead(a)->len += (n))
3088 
3089 // add N new unitialized elements to the end of the array
3090 #define stb_arr__addn(a,n) /*lint --e(826)*/ \
3091  ((stb_arr_len(a)+(n) > stb_arrcurmax(a)) \
3092  ? (stb__arr_addlen((void **) &(a),sizeof(*a),(n)),0) \
3093  : ((stb_arr__grow(a,n), 0)))
3094 
3095 // add N new unitialized elements to the end of the array, and return
3096 // a pointer to the first new one
3097 #define stb_arr_addn(a,n) (stb_arr__addn((a),n),(a)+stb_arr_len(a)-(n))
3098 
3099 // add N new uninitialized elements starting at index 'i'
3100 #define stb_arr_insertn(a,i,n) (stb__arr_insertn((void **) &(a), sizeof(*a), i, n))
3101 
3102 // insert an element at i
3103 #define stb_arr_insert(a,i,v) (stb__arr_insertn((void **) &(a), sizeof(*a), i, 1), ((a)[i] = v))
3104 
3105 // delete N elements from the middle starting at index 'i'
3106 #define stb_arr_deleten(a,i,n) (stb__arr_deleten((void **) &(a), sizeof(*a), i, n))
3107 
3108 // delete the i'th element
3109 #define stb_arr_delete(a,i) stb_arr_deleten(a,i,1)
3110 
3111 // delete the i'th element, swapping down from the end
3112 #define stb_arr_fastdelete(a,i) \
3113  (stb_swap(&a[i], &a[stb_arrhead(a)->len-1], sizeof(*a)), stb_arr_pop(a))
3114 
3115 
3116 // ARRAY STORAGE
3117 
3118 // get the array maximum storage; special case if NULL
3119 #define stb_arrcurmax(a) (a ? stb_arrhead(a)->limit : 0)
3120 #define stb_arrcurmax2(a) (a ? stb_arrhead2(a)->limit : 0)
3121 
3122 // set the maxlength of the array to n in anticipation of further growth
3123 #define stb_arr_setsize(a,n) (stb_arr_check(a), stb__arr_setsize((void **) &(a),sizeof((a)[0]),n))
3124 
3125 // make sure maxlength is large enough for at least N new allocations
3126 #define stb_arr_atleast(a,n) (stb_arr_len(a)+(n) > stb_arrcurmax(a) \
3127  ? stb_arr_setsize((a), (n)) : 0)
3128 
3129 // make a copy of a given array (copies contents via 'memcpy'!)
3130 #define stb_arr_copy(a) stb__arr_copy(a, sizeof((a)[0]))
3131 
3132 // compute the storage needed to store all the elements of the array
3133 #define stb_arr_storage(a) (stb_arr_len(a) * sizeof((a)[0]))
3134 
3135 #define stb_arr_for(v,arr) for((v)=(arr); (v) < (arr)+stb_arr_len(arr); ++(v))
3136 
3137 // IMPLEMENTATION
3138 
3139 STB_EXTERN void stb_arr_free_(void **p);
3140 STB_EXTERN void *stb__arr_copy_(void *p, int elem_size);
3141 STB_EXTERN void stb__arr_setsize_(void **p, int size, int limit STB__PARAMS);
3142 STB_EXTERN void stb__arr_setlen_(void **p, int size, int newlen STB__PARAMS);
3143 STB_EXTERN void stb__arr_addlen_(void **p, int size, int addlen STB__PARAMS);
3144 STB_EXTERN void stb__arr_deleten_(void **p, int size, int loc, int n STB__PARAMS);
3145 STB_EXTERN void stb__arr_insertn_(void **p, int size, int loc, int n STB__PARAMS);
3146 
3147 #define stb_arr_free(p) stb_arr_free_((void **) &(p))
3148 #define stb__arr_copy stb__arr_copy_
3149 
3150 #ifndef STB_MALLOC_WRAPPER
3151  #define stb__arr_setsize stb__arr_setsize_
3152  #define stb__arr_setlen stb__arr_setlen_
3153  #define stb__arr_addlen stb__arr_addlen_
3154  #define stb__arr_deleten stb__arr_deleten_
3155  #define stb__arr_insertn stb__arr_insertn_
3156 #else
3157  #define stb__arr_addlen(p,s,n) stb__arr_addlen_(p,s,n,__FILE__,__LINE__)
3158  #define stb__arr_setlen(p,s,n) stb__arr_setlen_(p,s,n,__FILE__,__LINE__)
3159  #define stb__arr_setsize(p,s,n) stb__arr_setsize_(p,s,n,__FILE__,__LINE__)
3160  #define stb__arr_deleten(p,s,i,n) stb__arr_deleten_(p,s,i,n,__FILE__,__LINE__)
3161  #define stb__arr_insertn(p,s,i,n) stb__arr_insertn_(p,s,i,n,__FILE__,__LINE__)
3162 #endif
3163 
3164 #ifdef STB_DEFINE
3165 static void *stb__arr_context;
3166 
3167 void *stb_arr_malloc_parent(void *p)
3168 {
3169  void *q = stb__arr_context;
3170  stb__arr_context = p;
3171  return q;
3172 }
3173 
3174 void stb_arr_malloc(void **target, void *context)
3175 {
3176  stb__arr *q = (stb__arr *) stb_malloc(context, sizeof(*q));
3177  q->len = q->limit = 0;
3178  q->stb_malloc = 1;
3179  q->signature = stb_arr_signature;
3180  *target = (void *) (q+1);
3181 }
3182 
3183 static void * stb__arr_malloc(int size)
3184 {
3185  if (stb__arr_context)
3186  return stb_malloc(stb__arr_context, size);
3187  return malloc(size);
3188 }
3189 
3190 void * stb__arr_copy_(void *p, int elem_size)
3191 {
3192  stb__arr *q;
3193  if (p == NULL) return p;
3194  q = (stb__arr *) stb__arr_malloc(sizeof(*q) + elem_size * stb_arrhead2(p)->limit);
3195  stb_arr_check2(p);
3196  memcpy(q, stb_arrhead2(p), sizeof(*q) + elem_size * stb_arrhead2(p)->len);
3197  q->stb_malloc = !!stb__arr_context;
3198  return q+1;
3199 }
3200 
3201 void stb_arr_free_(void **pp)
3202 {
3203  void *p = *pp;
3204  stb_arr_check2(p);
3205  if (p) {
3206  stb__arr *q = stb_arrhead2(p);
3207  if (q->stb_malloc)
3208  stb_free(q);
3209  else
3210  free(q);
3211  }
3212  *pp = NULL;
3213 }
3214 
3215 static void stb__arrsize_(void **pp, int size, int limit, int len STB__PARAMS)
3216 {
3217  void *p = *pp;
3218  stb__arr *a;
3219  stb_arr_check2(p);
3220  if (p == NULL) {
3221  if (len == 0 && size == 0) return;
3222  a = (stb__arr *) stb__arr_malloc(sizeof(*a) + size*limit);
3223  a->limit = limit;
3224  a->len = len;
3225  a->stb_malloc = !!stb__arr_context;
3226  a->signature = stb_arr_signature;
3227  } else {
3228  a = stb_arrhead2(p);
3229  a->len = len;
3230  if (a->limit < limit) {
3231  void *p;
3232  if (a->limit >= 4 && limit < a->limit * 2)
3233  limit = a->limit * 2;
3234  if (a->stb_malloc)
3235  p = stb_realloc(a, sizeof(*a) + limit*size);
3236  else
3237  #ifdef STB_MALLOC_WRAPPER
3238  p = stb__realloc(a, sizeof(*a) + limit*size, file, line);
3239  #else
3240  p = realloc(a, sizeof(*a) + limit*size);
3241  #endif
3242  if (p) {
3243  a = (stb__arr *) p;
3244  a->limit = limit;
3245  } else {
3246  // throw an error!
3247  }
3248  }
3249  }
3250  a->len = stb_min(a->len, a->limit);
3251  *pp = a+1;
3252 }
3253 
3254 void stb__arr_setsize_(void **pp, int size, int limit STB__PARAMS)
3255 {
3256  void *p = *pp;
3257  stb_arr_check2(p);
3258  stb__arrsize_(pp, size, limit, stb_arr_len2(p) STB__ARGS);
3259 }
3260 
3261 void stb__arr_setlen_(void **pp, int size, int newlen STB__PARAMS)
3262 {
3263  void *p = *pp;
3264  stb_arr_check2(p);
3265  if (stb_arrcurmax2(p) < newlen || p == NULL) {
3266  stb__arrsize_(pp, size, newlen, newlen STB__ARGS);
3267  } else {
3268  stb_arrhead2(p)->len = newlen;
3269  }
3270 }
3271 
3272 void stb__arr_addlen_(void **p, int size, int addlen STB__PARAMS)
3273 {
3274  stb__arr_setlen_(p, size, stb_arr_len2(*p) + addlen STB__ARGS);
3275 }
3276 
3277 void stb__arr_insertn_(void **pp, int size, int i, int n STB__PARAMS)
3278 {
3279  void *p = *pp;
3280  if (n) {
3281  int z;
3282 
3283  if (p == NULL) {
3284  stb__arr_addlen_(pp, size, n STB__ARGS);
3285  return;
3286  }
3287 
3288  z = stb_arr_len2(p);
3289  stb__arr_addlen_(&p, size, n STB__ARGS);
3290  memmove((char *) p + (i+n)*size, (char *) p + i*size, size * (z-i));
3291  }
3292  *pp = p;
3293 }
3294 
3295 void stb__arr_deleten_(void **pp, int size, int i, int n STB__PARAMS)
3296 {
3297  void *p = *pp;
3298  if (n) {
3299  memmove((char *) p + i*size, (char *) p + (i+n)*size, size * (stb_arr_len2(p)-(i+n)));
3300  stb_arrhead2(p)->len -= n;
3301  }
3302  *pp = p;
3303 }
3304 
3305 #endif
3306 
3308 //
3309 // Hashing
3310 //
3311 // typical use for this is to make a power-of-two hash table.
3312 //
3313 // let N = size of table (2^n)
3314 // let H = stb_hash(str)
3315 // let S = stb_rehash(H) | 1
3316 //
3317 // then hash probe sequence P(i) for i=0..N-1
3318 // P(i) = (H + S*i) & (N-1)
3319 //
3320 // the idea is that H has 32 bits of hash information, but the
3321 // table has only, say, 2^20 entries so only uses 20 of the bits.
3322 // then by rehashing the original H we get 2^12 different probe
3323 // sequences for a given initial probe location. (So it's optimal
3324 // for 64K tables and its optimality decreases past that.)
3325 //
3326 // ok, so I've added something that generates _two separate_
3327 // 32-bit hashes simultaneously which should scale better to
3328 // very large tables.
3329 
3330 
3331 STB_EXTERN unsigned int stb_hash(char *str);
3332 STB_EXTERN unsigned int stb_hashptr(void *p);
3333 STB_EXTERN unsigned int stb_hashlen(char *str, int len);
3334 STB_EXTERN unsigned int stb_rehash_improved(unsigned int v);
3335 STB_EXTERN unsigned int stb_hash_fast(void *p, int len);
3336 STB_EXTERN unsigned int stb_hash2(char *str, unsigned int *hash2_ptr);
3337 STB_EXTERN unsigned int stb_hash_number(unsigned int hash);
3338 
3339 #define stb_rehash(x) ((x) + ((x) >> 6) + ((x) >> 19))
3340 
3341 #ifdef STB_DEFINE
3342 unsigned int stb_hash(char *str)
3343 {
3344  unsigned int hash = 0;
3345  while (*str)
3346  hash = (hash << 7) + (hash >> 25) + *str++;
3347  return hash + (hash >> 16);
3348 }
3349 
3350 unsigned int stb_hashlen(char *str, int len)
3351 {
3352  unsigned int hash = 0;
3353  while (len-- > 0 && *str)
3354  hash = (hash << 7) + (hash >> 25) + *str++;
3355  return hash + (hash >> 16);
3356 }
3357 
3358 unsigned int stb_hashptr(void *p)
3359 {
3360  unsigned int x = (unsigned int) p;
3361 
3362  // typically lacking in low bits and high bits
3363  x = stb_rehash(x);
3364  x += x << 16;
3365 
3366  // pearson's shuffle
3367  x ^= x << 3;
3368  x += x >> 5;
3369  x ^= x << 2;
3370  x += x >> 15;
3371  x ^= x << 10;
3372  return stb_rehash(x);
3373 }
3374 
3375 unsigned int stb_rehash_improved(unsigned int v)
3376 {
3377  return stb_hashptr((void *)(size_t) v);
3378 }
3379 
3380 unsigned int stb_hash2(char *str, unsigned int *hash2_ptr)
3381 {
3382  unsigned int hash1 = 0x3141592c;
3383  unsigned int hash2 = 0x77f044ed;
3384  while (*str) {
3385  hash1 = (hash1 << 7) + (hash1 >> 25) + *str;
3386  hash2 = (hash2 << 11) + (hash2 >> 21) + *str;
3387  ++str;
3388  }
3389  *hash2_ptr = hash2 + (hash1 >> 16);
3390  return hash1 + (hash2 >> 16);
3391 }
3392 
3393 // Paul Hsieh hash
3394 #define stb__get16_slow(p) ((p)[0] + ((p)[1] << 8))
3395 #if defined(_MSC_VER)
3396  #define stb__get16(p) (*((unsigned short *) (p)))
3397 #else
3398  #define stb__get16(p) stb__get16_slow(p)
3399 #endif
3400 
3401 unsigned int stb_hash_fast(void *p, int len)
3402 {
3403  unsigned char *q = (unsigned char *) p;
3404  unsigned int hash = len;
3405 
3406  if (len <= 0 || q == NULL) return 0;
3407 
3408  /* Main loop */
3409  if (((int) q & 1) == 0) {
3410  for (;len > 3; len -= 4) {
3411  unsigned int val;
3412  hash += stb__get16(q);
3413  val = (stb__get16(q+2) << 11);
3414  hash = (hash << 16) ^ hash ^ val;
3415  q += 4;
3416  hash += hash >> 11;
3417  }
3418  } else {
3419  for (;len > 3; len -= 4) {
3420  unsigned int val;
3421  hash += stb__get16_slow(q);
3422  val = (stb__get16_slow(q+2) << 11);
3423  hash = (hash << 16) ^ hash ^ val;
3424  q += 4;
3425  hash += hash >> 11;
3426  }
3427  }
3428 
3429  /* Handle end cases */
3430  switch (len) {
3431  case 3: hash += stb__get16_slow(q);
3432  hash ^= hash << 16;
3433  hash ^= q[2] << 18;
3434  hash += hash >> 11;
3435  break;
3436  case 2: hash += stb__get16_slow(q);
3437  hash ^= hash << 11;
3438  hash += hash >> 17;
3439  break;
3440  case 1: hash += q[0];
3441  hash ^= hash << 10;
3442  hash += hash >> 1;
3443  break;
3444  case 0: break;
3445  }
3446 
3447  /* Force "avalanching" of final 127 bits */
3448  hash ^= hash << 3;
3449  hash += hash >> 5;
3450  hash ^= hash << 4;
3451  hash += hash >> 17;
3452  hash ^= hash << 25;
3453  hash += hash >> 6;
3454 
3455  return hash;
3456 }
3457 
3458 unsigned int stb_hash_number(unsigned int hash)
3459 {
3460  hash ^= hash << 3;
3461  hash += hash >> 5;
3462  hash ^= hash << 4;
3463  hash += hash >> 17;
3464  hash ^= hash << 25;
3465  hash += hash >> 6;
3466  return hash;
3467 }
3468 
3469 #endif
3470 
3472 //
3473 // Perfect hashing for ints/pointers
3474 //
3475 // This is mainly useful for making faster pointer-indexed tables
3476 // that don't change frequently. E.g. for stb_ischar().
3477 //
3478 
3479 typedef struct
3480 {
3481  stb_uint32 addend;
3482  stb_uint multiplicand;
3483  stb_uint b_mask;
3484  stb_uint8 small_bmap[16];
3485  stb_uint16 *large_bmap;
3486 
3487  stb_uint table_mask;
3488  stb_uint32 *table;
3489 } stb_perfect;
3490 
3491 STB_EXTERN int stb_perfect_create(stb_perfect *,unsigned int*,int n);
3492 STB_EXTERN void stb_perfect_destroy(stb_perfect *);
3493 STB_EXTERN int stb_perfect_hash(stb_perfect *, unsigned int x);
3494 extern int stb_perfect_hash_max_failures;
3495 
3496 #ifdef STB_DEFINE
3497 
3498 int stb_perfect_hash_max_failures;
3499 
3500 int stb_perfect_hash(stb_perfect *p, unsigned int x)
3501 {
3502  stb_uint m = x * p->multiplicand;
3503  stb_uint y = x >> 16;
3504  stb_uint bv = (m >> 24) + y;
3505  stb_uint av = (m + y) >> 12;
3506  if (p->table == NULL) return -1; // uninitialized table fails
3507  bv &= p->b_mask;
3508  av &= p->table_mask;
3509  if (p->large_bmap)
3510  av ^= p->large_bmap[bv];
3511  else
3512  av ^= p->small_bmap[bv];
3513  return p->table[av] == x ? av : -1;
3514 }
3515 
3516 static void stb__perfect_prehash(stb_perfect *p, stb_uint x, stb_uint16 *a, stb_uint16 *b)
3517 {
3518  stb_uint m = x * p->multiplicand;
3519  stb_uint y = x >> 16;
3520  stb_uint bv = (m >> 24) + y;
3521  stb_uint av = (m + y) >> 12;
3522  bv &= p->b_mask;
3523  av &= p->table_mask;
3524  *b = bv;
3525  *a = av;
3526 }
3527 
3528 static unsigned long stb__perfect_rand(void)
3529 {
3530  static unsigned long stb__rand;
3531  stb__rand = stb__rand * 2147001325 + 715136305;
3532  return 0x31415926 ^ ((stb__rand >> 16) + (stb__rand << 16));
3533 }
3534 
3535 typedef struct {
3536  unsigned short count;
3537  unsigned short b;
3538  unsigned short map;
3539  unsigned short *entries;
3540 } stb__slot;
3541 
3542 static int stb__slot_compare(const void *p, const void *q)
3543 {
3544  stb__slot *a = (stb__slot *) p;
3545  stb__slot *b = (stb__slot *) q;
3546  return a->count > b->count ? -1 : a->count < b->count; // sort large to small
3547 }
3548 
3549 int stb_perfect_create(stb_perfect *p, unsigned int *v, int n)
3550 {
3551  unsigned int buffer1[64], buffer2[64], buffer3[64], buffer4[64], buffer5[32];
3552  unsigned short *as = (unsigned short *) stb_temp(buffer1, sizeof(*v)*n);
3553  unsigned short *bs = (unsigned short *) stb_temp(buffer2, sizeof(*v)*n);
3554  unsigned short *entries = (unsigned short *) stb_temp(buffer4, sizeof(*entries) * n);
3555  int size = 1 << stb_log2_ceil(n), bsize=8;
3556  int failure = 0,i,j,k;
3557 
3558  assert(n <= 32768);
3559  p->large_bmap = NULL;
3560 
3561  for(;;) {
3562  stb__slot *bcount = (stb__slot *) stb_temp(buffer3, sizeof(*bcount) * bsize);
3563  unsigned short *bloc = (unsigned short *) stb_temp(buffer5, sizeof(*bloc) * bsize);
3564  unsigned short *e;
3565  int bad=0;
3566 
3567  p->addend = stb__perfect_rand();
3568  p->multiplicand = stb__perfect_rand() | 1;
3569  p->table_mask = size-1;
3570  p->b_mask = bsize-1;
3571  p->table = (stb_uint32 *) malloc(size * sizeof(*p->table));
3572 
3573  for (i=0; i < bsize; ++i) {
3574  bcount[i].b = i;
3575  bcount[i].count = 0;
3576  bcount[i].map = 0;
3577  }
3578  for (i=0; i < n; ++i) {
3579  stb__perfect_prehash(p, v[i], as+i, bs+i);
3580  ++bcount[bs[i]].count;
3581  }
3582  qsort(bcount, bsize, sizeof(*bcount), stb__slot_compare);
3583  e = entries; // now setup up their entries index
3584  for (i=0; i < bsize; ++i) {
3585  bcount[i].entries = e;
3586  e += bcount[i].count;
3587  bcount[i].count = 0;
3588  bloc[bcount[i].b] = i;
3589  }
3590  // now fill them out
3591  for (i=0; i < n; ++i) {
3592  int b = bs[i];
3593  int w = bloc[b];
3594  bcount[w].entries[bcount[w].count++] = i;
3595  }
3596  stb_tempfree(buffer5,bloc);
3597  // verify
3598  for (i=0; i < bsize; ++i)
3599  for (j=0; j < bcount[i].count; ++j)
3600  assert(bs[bcount[i].entries[j]] == bcount[i].b);
3601  memset(p->table, 0, size*sizeof(*p->table));
3602 
3603  // check if any b has duplicate a
3604  for (i=0; i < bsize; ++i) {
3605  if (bcount[i].count > 1) {
3606  for (j=0; j < bcount[i].count; ++j) {
3607  if (p->table[as[bcount[i].entries[j]]])
3608  bad = 1;
3609  p->table[as[bcount[i].entries[j]]] = 1;
3610  }
3611  for (j=0; j < bcount[i].count; ++j) {
3612  p->table[as[bcount[i].entries[j]]] = 0;
3613  }
3614  if (bad) break;
3615  }
3616  }
3617 
3618  if (!bad) {
3619  // go through the bs and populate the table, first fit
3620  for (i=0; i < bsize; ++i) {
3621  if (bcount[i].count) {
3622  // go through the candidate table[b] values
3623  for (j=0; j < size; ++j) {
3624  // go through the a values and see if they fit
3625  for (k=0; k < bcount[i].count; ++k) {
3626  int a = as[bcount[i].entries[k]];
3627  if (p->table[(a^j)&p->table_mask]) {
3628  break; // fails
3629  }
3630  }
3631  // if succeeded, accept
3632  if (k == bcount[i].count) {
3633  bcount[i].map = j;
3634  for (k=0; k < bcount[i].count; ++k) {
3635  int a = as[bcount[i].entries[k]];
3636  p->table[(a^j)&p->table_mask] = 1;
3637  }
3638  break;
3639  }
3640  }
3641  if (j == size)
3642  break; // no match for i'th entry, so break out in failure
3643  }
3644  }
3645  if (i == bsize) {
3646  // success... fill out map
3647  if (bsize <= 16 && size <= 256) {
3648  p->large_bmap = NULL;
3649  for (i=0; i < bsize; ++i)
3650  p->small_bmap[bcount[i].b] = (stb_uint8) bcount[i].map;
3651  } else {
3652  p->large_bmap = (unsigned short *) malloc(sizeof(*p->large_bmap) * bsize);
3653  for (i=0; i < bsize; ++i)
3654  p->large_bmap[bcount[i].b] = bcount[i].map;
3655  }
3656 
3657  // initialize table to v[0], so empty slots will fail
3658  for (i=0; i < size; ++i)
3659  p->table[i] = v[0];
3660 
3661  for (i=0; i < n; ++i)
3662  if (p->large_bmap)
3663  p->table[as[i] ^ p->large_bmap[bs[i]]] = v[i];
3664  else
3665  p->table[as[i] ^ p->small_bmap[bs[i]]] = v[i];
3666 
3667  // and now validate that none of them collided
3668  for (i=0; i < n; ++i)
3669  assert(stb_perfect_hash(p, v[i]) >= 0);
3670 
3671  stb_tempfree(buffer3, bcount);
3672  break;
3673  }
3674  }
3675  free(p->table);
3676  p->table = NULL;
3677  stb_tempfree(buffer3, bcount);
3678 
3679  ++failure;
3680  if (failure >= 4 && bsize < size) bsize *= 2;
3681  if (failure >= 8 && (failure & 3) == 0 && size < 4*n) {
3682  size *= 2;
3683  bsize *= 2;
3684  }
3685  if (failure == 6) {
3686  // make sure the input data is unique, so we don't infinite loop
3687  unsigned int *data = (unsigned int *) stb_temp(buffer3, n * sizeof(*data));
3688  memcpy(data, v, sizeof(*data) * n);
3689  qsort(data, n, sizeof(*data), stb_intcmp(0));
3690  for (i=1; i < n; ++i) {
3691  if (data[i] == data[i-1])
3692  size = 0; // size is return value, so 0 it
3693  }
3694  stb_tempfree(buffer3, data);
3695  if (!size) break;
3696  }
3697  }
3698 
3699  if (failure > stb_perfect_hash_max_failures)
3700  stb_perfect_hash_max_failures = failure;
3701 
3702  stb_tempfree(buffer1, as);
3703  stb_tempfree(buffer2, bs);
3704  stb_tempfree(buffer4, entries);
3705 
3706  return size;
3707 }
3708 
3709 void stb_perfect_destroy(stb_perfect *p)
3710 {
3711  if (p->large_bmap) free(p->large_bmap);
3712  if (p->table ) free(p->table);
3713  p->large_bmap = NULL;
3714  p->table = NULL;
3715  p->b_mask = 0;
3716  p->table_mask = 0;
3717 }
3718 #endif
3719 
3721 //
3722 // Perfect hash clients
3723 
3724 STB_EXTERN int stb_ischar(char s, char *set);
3725 
3726 #ifdef STB_DEFINE
3727 
3728 int stb_ischar(char c, char *set)
3729 {
3730  static unsigned char bit[8] = { 1,2,4,8,16,32,64,128 };
3731  static stb_perfect p;
3732  static unsigned char (*tables)[256];
3733  static char ** sets = NULL;
3734 
3735  int z = stb_perfect_hash(&p, (int) set);
3736  if (z < 0) {
3737  int i,k,n,j,f;
3738  // special code that means free all existing data
3739  if (set == NULL) {
3740  stb_arr_free(sets);
3741  free(tables);
3742  tables = NULL;
3743  stb_perfect_destroy(&p);
3744  return 0;
3745  }
3746  stb_arr_push(sets, set);
3747  stb_perfect_destroy(&p);
3748  n = stb_perfect_create(&p, (unsigned int *) (char **) sets, stb_arr_len(sets));
3749  assert(n != 0);
3750  k = (n+7) >> 3;
3751  tables = (unsigned char (*)[256]) realloc(tables, sizeof(*tables) * k);
3752  memset(tables, 0, sizeof(*tables) * k);
3753  for (i=0; i < stb_arr_len(sets); ++i) {
3754  k = stb_perfect_hash(&p, (int) sets[i]);
3755  assert(k >= 0);
3756  n = k >> 3;
3757  f = bit[k&7];
3758  for (j=0; !j || sets[i][j]; ++j) {
3759  tables[n][(unsigned char) sets[i][j]] |= f;
3760  }
3761  }
3762  z = stb_perfect_hash(&p, (int) set);
3763  }
3764  return tables[z >> 3][(unsigned char) c] & bit[z & 7];
3765 }
3766 
3767 #endif
3768 
3770 //
3771 // Instantiated data structures
3772 //
3773 // This is an attempt to implement a templated data structure.
3774 //
3775 // Hash table: call stb_define_hash(TYPE,N,KEY,K1,K2,HASH,VALUE)
3776 // TYPE -- will define a structure type containing the hash table
3777 // N -- the name, will prefix functions named:
3778 // N create
3779 // N destroy
3780 // N get
3781 // N set, N add, N update,
3782 // N remove
3783 // KEY -- the type of the key. 'x == y' must be valid
3784 // K1,K2 -- keys never used by the app, used as flags in the hashtable
3785 // HASH -- a piece of code ending with 'return' that hashes key 'k'
3786 // VALUE -- the type of the value. 'x = y' must be valid
3787 //
3788 // Note that stb_define_hash_base can be used to define more sophisticated
3789 // hash tables, e.g. those that make copies of the key or use special
3790 // comparisons (e.g. strcmp).
3791 
3792 #define STB_(prefix,name) stb__##prefix##name
3793 #define STB__(prefix,name) prefix##name
3794 #define STB__use(x) x
3795 #define STB__skip(x)
3796 
3797 #define stb_declare_hash(PREFIX,TYPE,N,KEY,VALUE) \
3798  typedef struct stb__st_##TYPE TYPE;\
3799  PREFIX int STB__(N, init)(TYPE *h, int count);\
3800  PREFIX int STB__(N, memory_usage)(TYPE *h);\
3801  PREFIX TYPE * STB__(N, create)(void);\
3802  PREFIX TYPE * STB__(N, copy)(TYPE *h);\
3803  PREFIX void STB__(N, destroy)(TYPE *h);\
3804  PREFIX int STB__(N,get_flag)(TYPE *a, KEY k, VALUE *v);\
3805  PREFIX VALUE STB__(N,get)(TYPE *a, KEY k);\
3806  PREFIX int STB__(N, set)(TYPE *a, KEY k, VALUE v);\
3807  PREFIX int STB__(N, add)(TYPE *a, KEY k, VALUE v);\
3808  PREFIX int STB__(N, update)(TYPE*a,KEY k,VALUE v);\
3809  PREFIX int STB__(N, remove)(TYPE *a, KEY k, VALUE *v);
3810 
3811 #define STB_nocopy(x) (x)
3812 #define STB_nodelete(x) 0
3813 #define STB_nofields
3814 #define STB_nonullvalue(x)
3815 #define STB_nullvalue(x) x
3816 #define STB_safecompare(x) x
3817 #define STB_nosafe(x)
3818 #define STB_noprefix
3819 
3820 #ifdef __GNUC__
3821 #define STB__nogcc(x)
3822 #else
3823 #define STB__nogcc(x) x
3824 #endif
3825 
3826 #define stb_define_hash_base(PREFIX,TYPE,FIELDS,N,NC,LOAD_FACTOR, \
3827  KEY,EMPTY,DEL,COPY,DISPOSE,SAFE, \
3828  VCOMPARE,CCOMPARE,HASH, \
3829  VALUE,HASVNULL,VNULL) \
3830  \
3831 typedef struct \
3832 { \
3833  KEY k; \
3834  VALUE v; \
3835 } STB_(N,_hashpair); \
3836  \
3837 STB__nogcc( typedef struct stb__st_##TYPE TYPE; ) \
3838 struct stb__st_##TYPE { \
3839  FIELDS \
3840  STB_(N,_hashpair) *table; \
3841  unsigned int mask; \
3842  int count, limit; \
3843  int deleted; \
3844  \
3845  int delete_threshhold; \
3846  int grow_threshhold; \
3847  int shrink_threshhold; \
3848  unsigned char alloced, has_empty, has_del; \
3849  VALUE ev; VALUE dv; \
3850 }; \
3851  \
3852 static unsigned int STB_(N, hash)(KEY k) \
3853 { \
3854  HASH \
3855 } \
3856  \
3857 PREFIX int STB__(N, init)(TYPE *h, int count) \
3858 { \
3859  int i; \
3860  if (count < 4) count = 4; \
3861  h->limit = count; \
3862  h->count = 0; \
3863  h->mask = count-1; \
3864  h->deleted = 0; \
3865  h->grow_threshhold = (int) (count * LOAD_FACTOR); \
3866  h->has_empty = h->has_del = 0; \
3867  h->alloced = 0; \
3868  if (count <= 64) \
3869  h->shrink_threshhold = 0; \
3870  else \
3871  h->shrink_threshhold = (int) (count * (LOAD_FACTOR/2.25)); \
3872  h->delete_threshhold = (int) (count * (1-LOAD_FACTOR)/2); \
3873  h->table = (STB_(N,_hashpair)*) malloc(sizeof(h->table[0]) * count); \
3874  if (h->table == NULL) return 0; \
3875  /* ideally this gets turned into a memset32 automatically */ \
3876  for (i=0; i < count; ++i) \
3877  h->table[i].k = EMPTY; \
3878  return 1; \
3879 } \
3880  \
3881 PREFIX int STB__(N, memory_usage)(TYPE *h) \
3882 { \
3883  return sizeof(*h) + h->limit * sizeof(h->table[0]); \
3884 } \
3885  \
3886 PREFIX TYPE * STB__(N, create)(void) \
3887 { \
3888  TYPE *h = (TYPE *) malloc(sizeof(*h)); \
3889  if (h) { \
3890  if (STB__(N, init)(h, 16)) \
3891  h->alloced = 1; \
3892  else { free(h); h=NULL; } \
3893  } \
3894  return h; \
3895 } \
3896  \
3897 PREFIX void STB__(N, destroy)(TYPE *a) \
3898 { \
3899  int i; \
3900  for (i=0; i < a->limit; ++i) \
3901  if (!CCOMPARE(a->table[i].k,EMPTY) && !CCOMPARE(a->table[i].k, DEL)) \
3902  DISPOSE(a->table[i].k); \
3903  free(a->table); \
3904  if (a->alloced) \
3905  free(a); \
3906 } \
3907  \
3908 static void STB_(N, rehash)(TYPE *a, int count); \
3909  \
3910 PREFIX int STB__(N,get_flag)(TYPE *a, KEY k, VALUE *v) \
3911 { \
3912  unsigned int h = STB_(N, hash)(k); \
3913  unsigned int n = h & a->mask, s; \
3914  if (CCOMPARE(k,EMPTY)){ if (a->has_empty) *v = a->ev; return a->has_empty;}\
3915  if (CCOMPARE(k,DEL)) { if (a->has_del ) *v = a->dv; return a->has_del; }\
3916  if (CCOMPARE(a->table[n].k,EMPTY)) return 0; \
3917  SAFE(if (!CCOMPARE(a->table[n].k,DEL))) \
3918  if (VCOMPARE(a->table[n].k,k)) { *v = a->table[n].v; return 1; } \
3919  s = stb_rehash(h) | 1; \
3920  for(;;) { \
3921  n = (n + s) & a->mask; \
3922  if (CCOMPARE(a->table[n].k,EMPTY)) return 0; \
3923  SAFE(if (CCOMPARE(a->table[n].k,DEL)) continue;) \
3924  if (VCOMPARE(a->table[n].k,k)) \
3925  { *v = a->table[n].v; return 1; } \
3926  } \
3927 } \
3928  \
3929 HASVNULL( \
3930  PREFIX VALUE STB__(N,get)(TYPE *a, KEY k) \
3931  { \
3932  VALUE v; \
3933  if (STB__(N,get_flag)(a,k,&v)) return v; \
3934  else return VNULL; \
3935  } \
3936 ) \
3937  \
3938 PREFIX int STB__(N,getkey)(TYPE *a, KEY k, KEY *kout) \
3939 { \
3940  unsigned int h = STB_(N, hash)(k); \
3941  unsigned int n = h & a->mask, s; \
3942  if (CCOMPARE(k,EMPTY)||CCOMPARE(k,DEL)) return 0; \
3943  if (CCOMPARE(a->table[n].k,EMPTY)) return 0; \
3944  SAFE(if (!CCOMPARE(a->table[n].k,DEL))) \
3945  if (VCOMPARE(a->table[n].k,k)) { *kout = a->table[n].k; return 1; } \
3946  s = stb_rehash(h) | 1; \
3947  for(;;) { \
3948  n = (n + s) & a->mask; \
3949  if (CCOMPARE(a->table[n].k,EMPTY)) return 0; \
3950  SAFE(if (CCOMPARE(a->table[n].k,DEL)) continue;) \
3951  if (VCOMPARE(a->table[n].k,k)) \
3952  { *kout = a->table[n].k; return 1; } \
3953  } \
3954 } \
3955  \
3956 static int STB_(N,addset)(TYPE *a, KEY k, VALUE v, \
3957  int allow_new, int allow_old, int copy) \
3958 { \
3959  unsigned int h = STB_(N, hash)(k); \
3960  unsigned int n = h & a->mask; \
3961  int b = -1; \
3962  if (CCOMPARE(k,EMPTY)) { \
3963  if (a->has_empty ? allow_old : allow_new) { \
3964  n=a->has_empty; a->ev = v; a->has_empty = 1; return !n; \
3965  } else return 0; \
3966  } \
3967  if (CCOMPARE(k,DEL)) { \
3968  if (a->has_del ? allow_old : allow_new) { \
3969  n=a->has_del; a->dv = v; a->has_del = 1; return !n; \
3970  } else return 0; \
3971  } \
3972  if (!CCOMPARE(a->table[n].k, EMPTY)) { \
3973  unsigned int s; \
3974  if (CCOMPARE(a->table[n].k, DEL)) \
3975  b = n; \
3976  else if (VCOMPARE(a->table[n].k,k)) { \
3977  if (allow_old) \
3978  a->table[n].v = v; \
3979  return !allow_new; \
3980  } \
3981  s = stb_rehash(h) | 1; \
3982  for(;;) { \
3983  n = (n + s) & a->mask; \
3984  if (CCOMPARE(a->table[n].k, EMPTY)) break; \
3985  if (CCOMPARE(a->table[n].k, DEL)) { \
3986  if (b < 0) b = n; \
3987  } else if (VCOMPARE(a->table[n].k,k)) { \
3988  if (allow_old) \
3989  a->table[n].v = v; \
3990  return !allow_new; \
3991  } \
3992  } \
3993  } \
3994  if (!allow_new) return 0; \
3995  if (b < 0) b = n; else --a->deleted; \
3996  a->table[b].k = copy ? COPY(k) : k; \
3997  a->table[b].v = v; \
3998  ++a->count; \
3999  if (a->count > a->grow_threshhold) \
4000  STB_(N,rehash)(a, a->limit*2); \
4001  return 1; \
4002 } \
4003  \
4004 PREFIX int STB__(N, set)(TYPE *a, KEY k, VALUE v){return STB_(N,addset)(a,k,v,1,1,1);}\
4005 PREFIX int STB__(N, add)(TYPE *a, KEY k, VALUE v){return STB_(N,addset)(a,k,v,1,0,1);}\
4006 PREFIX int STB__(N, update)(TYPE*a,KEY k,VALUE v){return STB_(N,addset)(a,k,v,0,1,1);}\
4007  \
4008 PREFIX int STB__(N, remove)(TYPE *a, KEY k, VALUE *v) \
4009 { \
4010  unsigned int h = STB_(N, hash)(k); \
4011  unsigned int n = h & a->mask, s; \
4012  if (CCOMPARE(k,EMPTY)) { if (a->has_empty) { if(v)*v = a->ev; a->has_empty=0; return 1; } return 0; } \
4013  if (CCOMPARE(k,DEL)) { if (a->has_del ) { if(v)*v = a->dv; a->has_del =0; return 1; } return 0; } \
4014  if (CCOMPARE(a->table[n].k,EMPTY)) return 0; \
4015  if (SAFE(CCOMPARE(a->table[n].k,DEL) || ) !VCOMPARE(a->table[n].k,k)) { \
4016  s = stb_rehash(h) | 1; \
4017  for(;;) { \
4018  n = (n + s) & a->mask; \
4019  if (CCOMPARE(a->table[n].k,EMPTY)) return 0; \
4020  SAFE(if (CCOMPARE(a->table[n].k, DEL)) continue;) \
4021  if (VCOMPARE(a->table[n].k,k)) break; \
4022  } \
4023  } \
4024  DISPOSE(a->table[n].k); \
4025  a->table[n].k = DEL; \
4026  --a->count; \
4027  ++a->deleted; \
4028  if (v != NULL) \
4029  *v = a->table[n].v; \
4030  if (a->count < a->shrink_threshhold) \
4031  STB_(N, rehash)(a, a->limit >> 1); \
4032  else if (a->deleted > a->delete_threshhold) \
4033  STB_(N, rehash)(a, a->limit); \
4034  return 1; \
4035 } \
4036  \
4037 PREFIX TYPE * STB__(NC, copy)(TYPE *a) \
4038 { \
4039  int i; \
4040  TYPE *h = (TYPE *) malloc(sizeof(*h)); \
4041  if (!h) return NULL; \
4042  if (!STB__(N, init)(h, a->limit)) { free(h); return NULL; } \
4043  h->count = a->count; \
4044  h->deleted = a->deleted; \
4045  h->alloced = 1; \
4046  h->ev = a->ev; h->dv = a->dv; \
4047  h->has_empty = a->has_empty; h->has_del = a->has_del; \
4048  memcpy(h->table, a->table, h->limit * sizeof(h->table[0])); \
4049  for (i=0; i < a->limit; ++i) \
4050  if (!CCOMPARE(h->table[i].k,EMPTY) && !CCOMPARE(h->table[i].k,DEL)) \
4051  h->table[i].k = COPY(h->table[i].k); \
4052  return h; \
4053 } \
4054  \
4055 static void STB_(N, rehash)(TYPE *a, int count) \
4056 { \
4057  int i; \
4058  TYPE b; \
4059  STB__(N, init)(&b, count); \
4060  for (i=0; i < a->limit; ++i) \
4061  if (!CCOMPARE(a->table[i].k,EMPTY) && !CCOMPARE(a->table[i].k,DEL)) \
4062  STB_(N,addset)(&b, a->table[i].k, a->table[i].v,1,1,0); \
4063  free(a->table); \
4064  a->table = b.table; \
4065  a->mask = b.mask; \
4066  a->count = b.count; \
4067  a->limit = b.limit; \
4068  a->deleted = b.deleted; \
4069  a->delete_threshhold = b.delete_threshhold; \
4070  a->grow_threshhold = b.grow_threshhold; \
4071  a->shrink_threshhold = b.shrink_threshhold; \
4072 }
4073 
4074 #define STB_equal(a,b) ((a) == (b))
4075 
4076 #define stb_define_hash(TYPE,N,KEY,EMPTY,DEL,HASH,VALUE) \
4077  stb_define_hash_base(STB_noprefix, TYPE,STB_nofields,N,NC,0.85f, \
4078  KEY,EMPTY,DEL,STB_nocopy,STB_nodelete,STB_nosafe, \
4079  STB_equal,STB_equal,HASH, \
4080  VALUE,STB_nonullvalue,0)
4081 
4082 #define stb_define_hash_vnull(TYPE,N,KEY,EMPTY,DEL,HASH,VALUE,VNULL) \
4083  stb_define_hash_base(STB_noprefix, TYPE,STB_nofields,N,NC,0.85f, \
4084  KEY,EMPTY,DEL,STB_nocopy,STB_nodelete,STB_nosafe, \
4085  STB_equal,STB_equal,HASH, \
4086  VALUE,STB_nullvalue,VNULL)
4087 
4089 //
4090 // stb_ptrmap
4091 //
4092 // An stb_ptrmap data structure is an O(1) hash table between pointers. One
4093 // application is to let you store "extra" data associated with pointers,
4094 // which is why it was originally called stb_extra.
4095 
4096 stb_declare_hash(STB_EXTERN, stb_ptrmap, stb_ptrmap_, void *, void *)
4097 stb_declare_hash(STB_EXTERN, stb_idict, stb_idict_, stb_int32, stb_int32)
4098 
4099 STB_EXTERN void stb_ptrmap_delete(stb_ptrmap *e, void (*free_func)(void *));
4100 STB_EXTERN stb_ptrmap *stb_ptrmap_new(void);
4101 
4102 STB_EXTERN stb_idict * stb_idict_new_size(int size);
4103 STB_EXTERN void stb_idict_remove_all(stb_idict *e);
4104 
4105 #ifdef STB_DEFINE
4106 
4107 #define STB_EMPTY ((void *) 2)
4108 #define STB_EDEL ((void *) 6)
4109 
4110 stb_define_hash_base(STB_noprefix,stb_ptrmap, STB_nofields, stb_ptrmap_,stb_ptrmap_,0.85f,
4111  void *,STB_EMPTY,STB_EDEL,STB_nocopy,STB_nodelete,STB_nosafe,
4112  STB_equal,STB_equal,return stb_hashptr(k);,
4113  void *,STB_nullvalue,NULL)
4114 
4115 stb_ptrmap *stb_ptrmap_new(void)
4116 {
4117  return stb_ptrmap_create();
4118 }
4119 
4120 void stb_ptrmap_delete(stb_ptrmap *e, void (*free_func)(void *))
4121 {
4122  int i;
4123  if (free_func)
4124  for (i=0; i < e->limit; ++i)
4125  if (e->table[i].k != STB_EMPTY && e->table[i].k != STB_EDEL) {
4126  if (free_func == free)
4127  free(e->table[i].v); // allow STB_MALLOC_WRAPPER to operate
4128  else
4129  free_func(e->table[i].v);
4130  }
4131  stb_ptrmap_destroy(e);
4132 }
4133 
4134 // extra fields needed for stua_dict
4135 #define STB_IEMPTY ((int) 1)
4136 #define STB_IDEL ((int) 3)
4137 stb_define_hash_base(STB_noprefix, stb_idict, short type; short gc; STB_nofields, stb_idict_,stb_idict_,0.85f,
4138  stb_int32,STB_IEMPTY,STB_IDEL,STB_nocopy,STB_nodelete,STB_nosafe,
4139  STB_equal,STB_equal,
4140  return stb_rehash_improved(k);,stb_int32,STB_nonullvalue,0)
4141 
4142 stb_idict * stb_idict_new_size(int size)
4143 {
4144  stb_idict *e = (stb_idict *) malloc(sizeof(*e));
4145  if (e) {
4146  if (!stb_is_pow2(size))
4147  size = 1 << stb_log2_ceil(size);
4148  stb_idict_init(e, size);
4149  e->alloced = 1;
4150  }
4151  return e;
4152 }
4153 
4154 void stb_idict_remove_all(stb_idict *e)
4155 {
4156  int n;
4157  for (n=0; n < e->limit; ++n)
4158  e->table[n].k = STB_IEMPTY;
4159  e->has_empty = e->has_del = 0;
4160 }
4161 #endif
4162 
4164 //
4165 // stb_sparse_ptr_matrix
4166 //
4167 // An stb_ptrmap data structure is an O(1) hash table storing an arbitrary
4168 // block of data for a given pair of pointers.
4169 //
4170 // If create=0, returns
4171 
4172 typedef struct stb__st_stb_spmatrix stb_spmatrix;
4173 
4174 STB_EXTERN stb_spmatrix * stb_sparse_ptr_matrix_new(int val_size);
4175 STB_EXTERN void stb_sparse_ptr_matrix_free(stb_spmatrix *z);
4176 STB_EXTERN void * stb_sparse_ptr_matrix_get(stb_spmatrix *z, void *a, void *b, int create);
4177 
4178 #ifdef STB_DEFINE
4179 typedef struct
4180 {
4181  void *a;
4182  void *b;
4183 } stb__ptrpair;
4184 
4185 static stb__ptrpair stb__ptrpair_empty = { (void *) 1, (void *) 1 };
4186 static stb__ptrpair stb__ptrpair_del = { (void *) 2, (void *) 2 };
4187 
4188 #define STB__equal_ptrpair(x,y) ((x).a == (y).a && (x).b == (y).b)
4189 
4190 stb_define_hash_base(static, stb_spmatrix, int val_size; void *arena;, stb__spmatrix_,stb__spmatrix_, 0.85,
4191  stb__ptrpair, stb__ptrpair_empty, stb__ptrpair_del,
4192  STB_nocopy, STB_nodelete, STB_nosafe,
4193  STB__equal_ptrpair, STB__equal_ptrpair, return stb_rehash(stb_hashptr(k.a))+stb_hashptr(k.b);,
4194  void *, STB_nullvalue, 0)
4195 
4196 stb_spmatrix *stb_sparse_ptr_matrix_new(int val_size)
4197 {
4198  stb_spmatrix *m = stb__spmatrix_create();
4199  if (m) m->val_size = val_size;
4200  if (m) m->arena = stb_malloc_global(1);
4201  return m;
4202 }
4203 
4204 void stb_sparse_ptr_matrix_free(stb_spmatrix *z)
4205 {
4206  if (z->arena) stb_free(z->arena);
4207  stb__spmatrix_destroy(z);
4208 }
4209 
4210 void *stb_sparse_ptr_matrix_get(stb_spmatrix *z, void *a, void *b, int create)
4211 {
4212  stb__ptrpair t = { a,b };
4213  void *data = stb__spmatrix_get(z, t);
4214  if (!data && create) {
4215  data = stb_malloc_raw(z->arena, z->val_size);
4216  if (!data) return NULL;
4217  memset(data, 0, z->val_size);
4218  stb__spmatrix_add(z, t, data);
4219  }
4220  return data;
4221 }
4222 #endif
4223 
4224 
4225 
4227 //
4228 // SDICT: Hash Table for Strings (symbol table)
4229 //
4230 // if "use_arena=1", then strings will be copied
4231 // into blocks and never freed until the sdict is freed;
4232 // otherwise they're malloc()ed and free()d on the fly.
4233 // (specify use_arena=1 if you never stb_sdict_remove)
4234 
4235 stb_declare_hash(STB_EXTERN, stb_sdict, stb_sdict_, char *, void *)
4236 
4237 STB_EXTERN stb_sdict * stb_sdict_new(int use_arena);
4238 STB_EXTERN stb_sdict * stb_sdict_copy(stb_sdict*);
4239 STB_EXTERN void stb_sdict_delete(stb_sdict *);
4240 STB_EXTERN void * stb_sdict_change(stb_sdict *, char *str, void *p);
4241 STB_EXTERN int stb_sdict_count(stb_sdict *d);
4242 
4243 #define stb_sdict_for(d,i,q,z) \
4244  for(i=0; i < (d)->limit ? q=(d)->table[i].k,z=(d)->table[i].v,1 : 0; ++i) \
4245  if (q==NULL||q==(void *) 1);else // reversed makes macro friendly
4246 
4247 #ifdef STB_DEFINE
4248 
4249 #define STB_DEL ((void *) 1)
4250 #define STB_SDEL ((char *) 1)
4251 
4252 #define stb_sdict__copy(x) \
4253  strcpy(a->arena ? stb_malloc_string(a->arena, strlen(x)+1) \
4254  : (char *) malloc(strlen(x)+1), x)
4255 
4256 #define stb_sdict__dispose(x) if (!a->arena) free(x)
4257 
4258 stb_define_hash_base(STB_noprefix, stb_sdict, void*arena;, stb_sdict_,stb_sdictinternal_, 0.85f,
4259  char *, NULL, STB_SDEL, stb_sdict__copy, stb_sdict__dispose,
4260  STB_safecompare, !strcmp, STB_equal, return stb_hash(k);,
4261  void *, STB_nullvalue, NULL)
4262 
4263 int stb_sdict_count(stb_sdict *a)
4264 {
4265  return a->count;
4266 }
4267 
4268 stb_sdict * stb_sdict_new(int use_arena)
4269 {
4270  stb_sdict *d = stb_sdict_create();
4271  if (d == NULL) return NULL;
4272  d->arena = use_arena ? stb_malloc_global(1) : NULL;
4273  return d;
4274 }
4275 
4276 stb_sdict* stb_sdict_copy(stb_sdict *old)
4277 {
4278  stb_sdict *n;
4279  void *old_arena = old->arena;
4280  void *new_arena = old_arena ? stb_malloc_global(1) : NULL;
4281  old->arena = new_arena;
4282  n = stb_sdictinternal_copy(old);
4283  old->arena = old_arena;
4284  if (n)
4285  n->arena = new_arena;
4286  else if (new_arena)
4287  stb_free(new_arena);
4288  return n;
4289 }
4290 
4291 
4292 void stb_sdict_delete(stb_sdict *d)
4293 {
4294  if (d->arena)
4295  stb_free(d->arena);
4296  stb_sdict_destroy(d);
4297 }
4298 
4299 void * stb_sdict_change(stb_sdict *d, char *str, void *p)
4300 {
4301  void *q = stb_sdict_get(d, str);
4302  stb_sdict_set(d, str, p);
4303  return q;
4304 }
4305 #endif
4306 
4308 //
4309 // Instantiated data structures
4310 //
4311 // This is an attempt to implement a templated data structure.
4312 // What you do is define a struct foo, and then include several
4313 // pointer fields to struct foo in your struct. Then you call
4314 // the instantiator, which creates the functions that implement
4315 // the data structure. This requires massive undebuggable #defines,
4316 // so we limit the cases where we do this.
4317 //
4318 // AA tree is an encoding of a 2-3 tree whereas RB trees encode a 2-3-4 tree;
4319 // much simpler code due to fewer cases.
4320 
4321 #define stb__bst_parent(x) x
4322 #define stb__bst_noparent(x)
4323 
4324 #define stb_bst_fields(N) \
4325  *STB_(N,left), *STB_(N,right); \
4326  unsigned char STB_(N,level)
4327 
4328 #define stb_bst_fields_parent(N) \
4329  *STB_(N,left), *STB_(N,right), *STB_(N,parent); \
4330  unsigned char STB_(N,level)
4331 
4332 #define STB__level(N,x) ((x) ? (x)->STB_(N,level) : 0)
4333 
4334 #define stb_bst_base(TYPE, N, TREE, M, compare, PAR) \
4335  \
4336 static int STB_(N,_compare)(TYPE *p, TYPE *q) \
4337 { \
4338  compare \
4339 } \
4340  \
4341 static void STB_(N,setleft)(TYPE *q, TYPE *v) \
4342 { \
4343  q->STB_(N,left) = v; \
4344  PAR(if (v) v->STB_(N,parent) = q;) \
4345 } \
4346  \
4347 static void STB_(N,setright)(TYPE *q, TYPE *v) \
4348 { \
4349  q->STB_(N,right) = v; \
4350  PAR(if (v) v->STB_(N,parent) = q;) \
4351 } \
4352  \
4353 static TYPE *STB_(N,skew)(TYPE *q) \
4354 { \
4355  if (q == NULL) return q; \
4356  if (q->STB_(N,left) \
4357  && q->STB_(N,left)->STB_(N,level) == q->STB_(N,level)) { \
4358  TYPE *p = q->STB_(N,left); \
4359  STB_(N,setleft)(q, p->STB_(N,right)); \
4360  STB_(N,setright)(p, q); \
4361  return p; \
4362  } \
4363  return q; \
4364 } \
4365  \
4366 static TYPE *STB_(N,split)(TYPE *p) \
4367 { \
4368  TYPE *q = p->STB_(N,right); \
4369  if (q && q->STB_(N,right) \
4370  && q->STB_(N,right)->STB_(N,level) == p->STB_(N,level)) { \
4371  STB_(N,setright)(p, q->STB_(N,left)); \
4372  STB_(N,setleft)(q,p); \
4373  ++q->STB_(N,level); \
4374  return q; \
4375  } \
4376  return p; \
4377 } \
4378  \
4379 TYPE *STB__(N,insert)(TYPE *tree, TYPE *item) \
4380 { \
4381  int c; \
4382  if (tree == NULL) { \
4383  item->STB_(N,left) = NULL; \
4384  item->STB_(N,right) = NULL; \
4385  item->STB_(N,level) = 1; \
4386  PAR(item->STB_(N,parent) = NULL;) \
4387  return item; \
4388  } \
4389  c = STB_(N,_compare)(item,tree); \
4390  if (c == 0) { \
4391  if (item != tree) { \
4392  STB_(N,setleft)(item, tree->STB_(N,left)); \
4393  STB_(N,setright)(item, tree->STB_(N,right)); \
4394  item->STB_(N,level) = tree->STB_(N,level); \
4395  PAR(item->STB_(N,parent) = NULL;) \
4396  } \
4397  return item; \
4398  } \
4399  if (c < 0) \
4400  STB_(N,setleft )(tree, STB__(N,insert)(tree->STB_(N,left), item)); \
4401  else \
4402  STB_(N,setright)(tree, STB__(N,insert)(tree->STB_(N,right), item)); \
4403  tree = STB_(N,skew)(tree); \
4404  tree = STB_(N,split)(tree); \
4405  PAR(tree->STB_(N,parent) = NULL;) \
4406  return tree; \
4407 } \
4408  \
4409 TYPE *STB__(N,remove)(TYPE *tree, TYPE *item) \
4410 { \
4411  static TYPE *delnode, *leaf, *restore; \
4412  if (tree == NULL) return NULL; \
4413  leaf = tree; \
4414  if (STB_(N,_compare)(item, tree) < 0) { \
4415  STB_(N,setleft)(tree, STB__(N,remove)(tree->STB_(N,left), item)); \
4416  } else { \
4417  TYPE *r; \
4418  delnode = tree; \
4419  r = STB__(N,remove)(tree->STB_(N,right), item); \
4420  /* maybe move 'leaf' up to this location */ \
4421  if (restore == tree) { tree = leaf; leaf = restore = NULL; } \
4422  STB_(N,setright)(tree,r); \
4423  assert(tree->STB_(N,right) != tree); \
4424  } \
4425  if (tree == leaf) { \
4426  if (delnode == item) { \
4427  tree = tree->STB_(N,right); \
4428  assert(leaf->STB_(N,left) == NULL); \
4429  /* move leaf (the right sibling) up to delnode */ \
4430  STB_(N,setleft )(leaf, item->STB_(N,left )); \
4431  STB_(N,setright)(leaf, item->STB_(N,right)); \
4432  leaf->STB_(N,level) = item->STB_(N,level); \
4433  if (leaf != item) \
4434  restore = delnode; \
4435  } \
4436  delnode = NULL; \
4437  } else { \
4438  if (STB__level(N,tree->STB_(N,left) ) < tree->STB_(N,level)-1 || \
4439  STB__level(N,tree->STB_(N,right)) < tree->STB_(N,level)-1) { \
4440  --tree->STB_(N,level); \
4441  if (STB__level(N,tree->STB_(N,right)) > tree->STB_(N,level)) \
4442  tree->STB_(N,right)->STB_(N,level) = tree->STB_(N,level); \
4443  tree = STB_(N,skew)(tree); \
4444  STB_(N,setright)(tree, STB_(N,skew)(tree->STB_(N,right))); \
4445  if (tree->STB_(N,right)) \
4446  STB_(N,setright)(tree->STB_(N,right), \
4447  STB_(N,skew)(tree->STB_(N,right)->STB_(N,right))); \
4448  tree = STB_(N,split)(tree); \
4449  if (tree->STB_(N,right)) \
4450  STB_(N,setright)(tree, STB_(N,split)(tree->STB_(N,right))); \
4451  } \
4452  } \
4453  PAR(if (tree) tree->STB_(N,parent) = NULL;) \
4454  return tree; \
4455 } \
4456  \
4457 TYPE *STB__(N,last)(TYPE *tree) \
4458 { \
4459  if (tree) \
4460  while (tree->STB_(N,right)) tree = tree->STB_(N,right); \
4461  return tree; \
4462 } \
4463  \
4464 TYPE *STB__(N,first)(TYPE *tree) \
4465 { \
4466  if (tree) \
4467  while (tree->STB_(N,left)) tree = tree->STB_(N,left); \
4468  return tree; \
4469 } \
4470  \
4471 TYPE *STB__(N,next)(TYPE *tree, TYPE *item) \
4472 { \
4473  TYPE *next = NULL; \
4474  if (item->STB_(N,right)) \
4475  return STB__(N,first)(item->STB_(N,right)); \
4476  PAR( \
4477  while(item->STB_(N,parent)) { \
4478  TYPE *up = item->STB_(N,parent); \
4479  if (up->STB_(N,left) == item) return up; \
4480  item = up; \
4481  } \
4482  return NULL; \
4483  ) \
4484  while (tree != item) { \
4485  if (STB_(N,_compare)(item, tree) < 0) { \
4486  next = tree; \
4487  tree = tree->STB_(N,left); \
4488  } else { \
4489  tree = tree->STB_(N,right); \
4490  } \
4491  } \
4492  return next; \
4493 } \
4494  \
4495 TYPE *STB__(N,prev)(TYPE *tree, TYPE *item) \
4496 { \
4497  TYPE *next = NULL; \
4498  if (item->STB_(N,left)) \
4499  return STB__(N,last)(item->STB_(N,left)); \
4500  PAR( \
4501  while(item->STB_(N,parent)) { \
4502  TYPE *up = item->STB_(N,parent); \
4503  if (up->STB_(N,right) == item) return up; \
4504  item = up; \
4505  } \
4506  return NULL; \
4507  ) \
4508  while (tree != item) { \
4509  if (STB_(N,_compare)(item, tree) < 0) { \
4510  tree = tree->STB_(N,left); \
4511  } else { \
4512  next = tree; \
4513  tree = tree->STB_(N,right); \
4514  } \
4515  } \
4516  return next; \
4517 } \
4518  \
4519 STB__DEBUG( \
4520  void STB__(N,_validate)(TYPE *tree, int root) \
4521  { \
4522  if (tree == NULL) return; \
4523  PAR(if(root) assert(tree->STB_(N,parent) == NULL);) \
4524  assert(STB__level(N,tree->STB_(N,left) ) == tree->STB_(N,level)-1); \
4525  assert(STB__level(N,tree->STB_(N,right)) <= tree->STB_(N,level)); \
4526  assert(STB__level(N,tree->STB_(N,right)) >= tree->STB_(N,level)-1); \
4527  if (tree->STB_(N,right)) { \
4528  assert(STB__level(N,tree->STB_(N,right)->STB_(N,right)) \
4529  != tree->STB_(N,level)); \
4530  PAR(assert(tree->STB_(N,right)->STB_(N,parent) == tree);) \
4531  } \
4532  PAR(if(tree->STB_(N,left)) assert(tree->STB_(N,left)->STB_(N,parent) == tree);) \
4533  STB__(N,_validate)(tree->STB_(N,left) ,0); \
4534  STB__(N,_validate)(tree->STB_(N,right),0); \
4535  } \
4536 ) \
4537  \
4538 typedef struct \
4539 { \
4540  TYPE *root; \
4541 } TREE; \
4542  \
4543 void STB__(M,Insert)(TREE *tree, TYPE *item) \
4544 { tree->root = STB__(N,insert)(tree->root, item); } \
4545 void STB__(M,Remove)(TREE *tree, TYPE *item) \
4546 { tree->root = STB__(N,remove)(tree->root, item); } \
4547 TYPE *STB__(M,Next)(TREE *tree, TYPE *item) \
4548 { return STB__(N,next)(tree->root, item); } \
4549 TYPE *STB__(M,Prev)(TREE *tree, TYPE *item) \
4550 { return STB__(N,prev)(tree->root, item); } \
4551 TYPE *STB__(M,First)(TREE *tree) { return STB__(N,first)(tree->root); } \
4552 TYPE *STB__(M,Last) (TREE *tree) { return STB__(N,last) (tree->root); } \
4553 void STB__(M,Init)(TREE *tree) { tree->root = NULL; }
4554 
4555 
4556 #define stb_bst_find(N,tree,fcompare) \
4557 { \
4558  int c; \
4559  while (tree != NULL) { \
4560  fcompare \
4561  if (c == 0) return tree; \
4562  if (c < 0) tree = tree->STB_(N,left); \
4563  else tree = tree->STB_(N,right); \
4564  } \
4565  return NULL; \
4566 }
4567 
4568 #define stb_bst_raw(TYPE,N,TREE,M,vfield,VTYPE,compare,PAR) \
4569  stb_bst_base(TYPE,N,TREE,M, \
4570  VTYPE a = p->vfield; VTYPE b = q->vfield; return (compare);, PAR ) \
4571  \
4572 TYPE *STB__(N,find)(TYPE *tree, VTYPE a) \
4573  stb_bst_find(N,tree,VTYPE b = tree->vfield; c = (compare);) \
4574 TYPE *STB__(M,Find)(TREE *tree, VTYPE a) \
4575 { return STB__(N,find)(tree->root, a); }
4576 
4577 #define stb_bst(TYPE,N,TREE,M,vfield,VTYPE,compare) \
4578  stb_bst_raw(TYPE,N,TREE,M,vfield,VTYPE,compare,stb__bst_noparent)
4579 #define stb_bst_parent(TYPE,N,TREE,M,vfield,VTYPE,compare) \
4580  stb_bst_raw(TYPE,N,TREE,M,vfield,VTYPE,compare,stb__bst_parent)
4581 
4582 
4583 
4585 //
4586 // Pointer Nulling
4587 //
4588 // This lets you automatically NULL dangling pointers to "registered"
4589 // objects. Note that you have to make sure you call the appropriate
4590 // functions when you free or realloc blocks of memory that contain
4591 // pointers or pointer targets. stb.h can automatically do this for
4592 // stb_arr, or for all frees/reallocs if it's wrapping them.
4593 //
4594 
4595 #ifdef STB_NPTR
4596 
4597 STB_EXTERN void stb_nptr_set(void *address_of_pointer, void *value_to_write);
4598 STB_EXTERN void stb_nptr_didset(void *address_of_pointer);
4599 
4600 STB_EXTERN void stb_nptr_didfree(void *address_being_freed, int len);
4601 STB_EXTERN void stb_nptr_free(void *address_being_freed, int len);
4602 
4603 STB_EXTERN void stb_nptr_didrealloc(void *new_address, void *old_address, int len);
4604 STB_EXTERN void stb_nptr_recache(void); // recache all known pointers
4605  // do this after pointer sets outside your control, slow
4606 
4607 #ifdef STB_DEFINE
4608 // for fast updating on free/realloc, we need to be able to find
4609 // all the objects (pointers and targets) within a given block;
4610 // this precludes hashing
4611 
4612 // we use a three-level hierarchy of memory to minimize storage:
4613 // level 1: 65536 pointers to stb__memory_node (always uses 256 KB)
4614 // level 2: each stb__memory_node represents a 64K block of memory
4615 // with 256 stb__memory_leafs (worst case 64MB)
4616 // level 3: each stb__memory_leaf represents 256 bytes of memory
4617 // using a list of target locations and a list of pointers
4618 // (which are hopefully fairly short normally!)
4619 
4620 // this approach won't work in 64-bit, which has a much larger address
4621 // space. need to redesign
4622 
4623 #define STB__NPTR_ROOT_LOG2 16
4624 #define STB__NPTR_ROOT_NUM (1 << STB__NPTR_ROOT_LOG2)
4625 #define STB__NPTR_ROOT_SHIFT (32 - STB__NPTR_ROOT_LOG2)
4626 
4627 #define STB__NPTR_NODE_LOG2 5
4628 #define STB__NPTR_NODE_NUM (1 << STB__NPTR_NODE_LOG2)
4629 #define STB__NPTR_NODE_MASK (STB__NPTR_NODE_NUM-1)
4630 #define STB__NPTR_NODE_SHIFT (STB__NPTR_ROOT_SHIFT - STB__NPTR_NODE_LOG2)
4631 #define STB__NPTR_NODE_OFFSET(x) (((x) >> STB__NPTR_NODE_SHIFT) & STB__NPTR_NODE_MASK)
4632 
4633 typedef struct stb__st_nptr
4634 {
4635  void *ptr; // address of actual pointer
4636  struct stb__st_nptr *next; // next pointer with same target
4637  struct stb__st_nptr **prev; // prev pointer with same target, address of 'next' field (or first)
4638  struct stb__st_nptr *next_in_block;
4639 } stb__nptr;
4640 
4641 typedef struct stb__st_nptr_target
4642 {
4643  void *ptr; // address of target
4644  stb__nptr *first; // address of first nptr pointing to this
4645  struct stb__st_nptr_target *next_in_block;
4646 } stb__nptr_target;
4647 
4648 typedef struct
4649 {
4650  stb__nptr *pointers;
4651  stb__nptr_target *targets;
4652 } stb__memory_leaf;
4653 
4654 typedef struct
4655 {
4656  stb__memory_leaf *children[STB__NPTR_NODE_NUM];
4657 } stb__memory_node;
4658 
4659 stb__memory_node *stb__memtab_root[STB__NPTR_ROOT_NUM];
4660 
4661 static stb__memory_leaf *stb__nptr_find_leaf(void *mem)
4662 {
4663  stb_uint32 address = (stb_uint32) mem;
4664  stb__memory_node *z = stb__memtab_root[address >> STB__NPTR_ROOT_SHIFT];
4665  if (z)
4666  return z->children[STB__NPTR_NODE_OFFSET(address)];
4667  else
4668  return NULL;
4669 }
4670 
4671 static void * stb__nptr_alloc(int size)
4672 {
4673  return stb__realloc_raw(0,size);
4674 }
4675 
4676 static void stb__nptr_free(void *p)
4677 {
4678  stb__realloc_raw(p,0);
4679 }
4680 
4681 static stb__memory_leaf *stb__nptr_make_leaf(void *mem)
4682 {
4683  stb_uint32 address = (stb_uint32) mem;
4684  stb__memory_node *z = stb__memtab_root[address >> STB__NPTR_ROOT_SHIFT];
4685  stb__memory_leaf *f;
4686  if (!z) {
4687  int i;
4688  z = (stb__memory_node *) stb__nptr_alloc(sizeof(*stb__memtab_root[0]));
4689  stb__memtab_root[address >> STB__NPTR_ROOT_SHIFT] = z;
4690  for (i=0; i < 256; ++i)
4691  z->children[i] = 0;
4692  }
4693  f = (stb__memory_leaf *) stb__nptr_alloc(sizeof(*f));
4694  z->children[STB__NPTR_NODE_OFFSET(address)] = f;
4695  f->pointers = NULL;
4696  f->targets = NULL;
4697  return f;
4698 }
4699 
4700 static stb__nptr_target *stb__nptr_find_target(void *target, int force)
4701 {
4702  stb__memory_leaf *p = stb__nptr_find_leaf(target);
4703  if (p) {
4704  stb__nptr_target *t = p->targets;
4705  while (t) {
4706  if (t->ptr == target)
4707  return t;
4708  t = t->next_in_block;
4709  }
4710  }
4711  if (force) {
4712  stb__nptr_target *t = (stb__nptr_target*) stb__nptr_alloc(sizeof(*t));
4713  if (!p) p = stb__nptr_make_leaf(target);
4714  t->ptr = target;
4715  t->first = NULL;
4716  t->next_in_block = p->targets;
4717  p->targets = t;
4718  return t;
4719  } else
4720  return NULL;
4721 }
4722 
4723 static stb__nptr *stb__nptr_find_pointer(void *ptr, int force)
4724 {
4725  stb__memory_leaf *p = stb__nptr_find_leaf(ptr);
4726  if (p) {
4727  stb__nptr *t = p->pointers;
4728  while (t) {
4729  if (t->ptr == ptr)
4730  return t;
4731  t = t->next_in_block;
4732  }
4733  }
4734  if (force) {
4735  stb__nptr *t = (stb__nptr *) stb__nptr_alloc(sizeof(*t));
4736  if (!p) p = stb__nptr_make_leaf(ptr);
4737  t->ptr = ptr;
4738  t->next = NULL;
4739  t->prev = NULL;
4740  t->next_in_block = p->pointers;
4741  p->pointers = t;
4742  return t;
4743  } else
4744  return NULL;
4745 }
4746 
4747 void stb_nptr_set(void *address_of_pointer, void *value_to_write)
4748 {
4749  if (*(void **)address_of_pointer != value_to_write) {
4750  *(void **) address_of_pointer = value_to_write;
4751  stb_nptr_didset(address_of_pointer);
4752  }
4753 }
4754 
4755 void stb_nptr_didset(void *address_of_pointer)
4756 {
4757  // first unlink from old chain
4758  void *new_address;
4759  stb__nptr *p = stb__nptr_find_pointer(address_of_pointer, 1); // force building if doesn't exist
4760  if (p->prev) { // if p->prev is NULL, we just built it, or it was NULL
4761  *(p->prev) = p->next;
4762  if (p->next) p->next->prev = p->prev;
4763  }
4764  // now add to new chain
4765  new_address = *(void **)address_of_pointer;
4766  if (new_address != NULL) {
4767  stb__nptr_target *t = stb__nptr_find_target(new_address, 1);
4768  p->next = t->first;
4769  if (p->next) p->next->prev = &p->next;
4770  p->prev = &t->first;
4771  t->first = p;
4772  } else {
4773  p->prev = NULL;
4774  p->next = NULL;
4775  }
4776 }
4777 
4778 void stb__nptr_block(void *address, int len, void (*function)(stb__memory_leaf *f, int datum, void *start, void *end), int datum)
4779 {
4780  void *end_address = (void *) ((char *) address + len - 1);
4781  stb__memory_node *n;
4782  stb_uint32 start = (stb_uint32) address;
4783  stb_uint32 end = start + len - 1;
4784 
4785  int b0 = start >> STB__NPTR_ROOT_SHIFT;
4786  int b1 = end >> STB__NPTR_ROOT_SHIFT;
4787  int b=b0,i,e0,e1;
4788 
4789  e0 = STB__NPTR_NODE_OFFSET(start);
4790 
4791  if (datum <= 0) {
4792  // first block
4793  n = stb__memtab_root[b0];
4794  if (n) {
4795  if (b0 != b1)
4796  e1 = STB__NPTR_NODE_NUM-1;
4797  else
4798  e1 = STB__NPTR_NODE_OFFSET(end);
4799  for (i=e0; i <= e1; ++i)
4800  if (n->children[i])
4801  function(n->children[i], datum, address, end_address);
4802  }
4803  if (b1 > b0) {
4804  // blocks other than the first and last block
4805  for (b=b0+1; b < b1; ++b) {
4806  n = stb__memtab_root[b];
4807  if (n)
4808  for (i=0; i <= STB__NPTR_NODE_NUM-1; ++i)
4809  if (n->children[i])
4810  function(n->children[i], datum, address, end_address);
4811  }
4812  // last block
4813  n = stb__memtab_root[b1];
4814  if (n) {
4815  e1 = STB__NPTR_NODE_OFFSET(end);
4816  for (i=0; i <= e1; ++i)
4817  if (n->children[i])
4818  function(n->children[i], datum, address, end_address);
4819  }
4820  }
4821  } else {
4822  if (b1 > b0) {
4823  // last block
4824  n = stb__memtab_root[b1];
4825  if (n) {
4826  e1 = STB__NPTR_NODE_OFFSET(end);
4827  for (i=e1; i >= 0; --i)
4828  if (n->children[i])
4829  function(n->children[i], datum, address, end_address);
4830  }
4831  // blocks other than the first and last block
4832  for (b=b1-1; b > b0; --b) {
4833  n = stb__memtab_root[b];
4834  if (n)
4835  for (i=STB__NPTR_NODE_NUM-1; i >= 0; --i)
4836  if (n->children[i])
4837  function(n->children[i], datum, address, end_address);
4838  }
4839  }
4840  // first block
4841  n = stb__memtab_root[b0];
4842  if (n) {
4843  if (b0 != b1)
4844  e1 = STB__NPTR_NODE_NUM-1;
4845  else
4846  e1 = STB__NPTR_NODE_OFFSET(end);
4847  for (i=e1; i >= e0; --i)
4848  if (n->children[i])
4849  function(n->children[i], datum, address, end_address);
4850  }
4851  }
4852 }
4853 
4854 static void stb__nptr_delete_pointers(stb__memory_leaf *f, int offset, void *start, void *end)
4855 {
4856  stb__nptr **p = &f->pointers;
4857  while (*p) {
4858  stb__nptr *n = *p;
4859  if (n->ptr >= start && n->ptr <= end) {
4860  // unlink
4861  if (n->prev) {
4862  *(n->prev) = n->next;
4863  if (n->next) n->next->prev = n->prev;
4864  }
4865  *p = n->next_in_block;
4866  stb__nptr_free(n);
4867  } else
4868  p = &(n->next_in_block);
4869  }
4870 }
4871 
4872 static void stb__nptr_delete_targets(stb__memory_leaf *f, int offset, void *start, void *end)
4873 {
4874  stb__nptr_target **p = &f->targets;
4875  while (*p) {
4876  stb__nptr_target *n = *p;
4877  if (n->ptr >= start && n->ptr <= end) {
4878  // null pointers
4879  stb__nptr *z = n->first;
4880  while (z) {
4881  stb__nptr *y = z->next;
4882  z->prev = NULL;
4883  z->next = NULL;
4884  *(void **) z->ptr = NULL;
4885  z = y;
4886  }
4887  // unlink this target
4888  *p = n->next_in_block;
4889  stb__nptr_free(n);
4890  } else
4891  p = &(n->next_in_block);
4892  }
4893 }
4894 
4895 void stb_nptr_didfree(void *address_being_freed, int len)
4896 {
4897  // step one: delete all pointers in this block
4898  stb__nptr_block(address_being_freed, len, stb__nptr_delete_pointers, 0);
4899  // step two: NULL all pointers to this block; do this second to avoid NULLing deleted pointers
4900  stb__nptr_block(address_being_freed, len, stb__nptr_delete_targets, 0);
4901 }
4902 
4903 void stb_nptr_free(void *address_being_freed, int len)
4904 {
4905  free(address_being_freed);
4906  stb_nptr_didfree(address_being_freed, len);
4907 }
4908 
4909 static void stb__nptr_move_targets(stb__memory_leaf *f, int offset, void *start, void *end)
4910 {
4911  stb__nptr_target **t = &f->targets;
4912  while (*t) {
4913  stb__nptr_target *n = *t;
4914  if (n->ptr >= start && n->ptr <= end) {
4915  stb__nptr *z;
4916  stb__memory_leaf *f;
4917  // unlink n
4918  *t = n->next_in_block;
4919  // update n to new address
4920  n->ptr = (void *) ((char *) n->ptr + offset);
4921  f = stb__nptr_find_leaf(n->ptr);
4922  if (!f) f = stb__nptr_make_leaf(n->ptr);
4923  n->next_in_block = f->targets;
4924  f->targets = n;
4925  // now go through all pointers and make them point here
4926  z = n->first;
4927  while (z) {
4928  *(void**) z->ptr = n->ptr;
4929  z = z->next;
4930  }
4931  } else
4932  t = &(n->next_in_block);
4933  }
4934 }
4935 
4936 static void stb__nptr_move_pointers(stb__memory_leaf *f, int offset, void *start, void *end)
4937 {
4938  stb__nptr **p = &f->pointers;
4939  while (*p) {
4940  stb__nptr *n = *p;
4941  if (n->ptr >= start && n->ptr <= end) {
4942  // unlink
4943  *p = n->next_in_block;
4944  n->ptr = (void *) ((int) n->ptr + offset);
4945  // move to new block
4946  f = stb__nptr_find_leaf(n->ptr);
4947  if (!f) f = stb__nptr_make_leaf(n->ptr);
4948  n->next_in_block = f->pointers;
4949  f->pointers = n;
4950  } else
4951  p = &(n->next_in_block);
4952  }
4953 }
4954 
4955 void stb_nptr_realloc(void *new_address, void *old_address, int len)
4956 {
4957  if (new_address == old_address) return;
4958 
4959  // have to move the pointers first, because moving the targets
4960  // requires writing to the pointers-to-the-targets, and if some of those moved too,
4961  // we need to make sure we don't write to the old memory
4962 
4963  // step one: move all pointers within the block
4964  stb__nptr_block(old_address, len, stb__nptr_move_pointers, (char *) new_address - (char *) old_address);
4965  // step two: move all targets within the block
4966  stb__nptr_block(old_address, len, stb__nptr_move_targets, (char *) new_address - (char *) old_address);
4967 }
4968 
4969 void stb_nptr_move(void *new_address, void *old_address)
4970 {
4971  stb_nptr_realloc(new_address, old_address, 1);
4972 }
4973 
4974 void stb_nptr_recache(void)
4975 {
4976  int i,j;
4977  for (i=0; i < STB__NPTR_ROOT_NUM; ++i)
4978  if (stb__memtab_root[i])
4979  for (j=0; j < STB__NPTR_NODE_NUM; ++j)
4980  if (stb__memtab_root[i]->children[j]) {
4981  stb__nptr *p = stb__memtab_root[i]->children[j]->pointers;
4982  while (p) {
4983  stb_nptr_didset(p->ptr);
4984  p = p->next_in_block;
4985  }
4986  }
4987 }
4988 
4989 #endif // STB_DEFINE
4990 #endif // STB_NPTR
4991 
4992

4995 // File Processing
4996 //
4997 
4998 
4999 #ifdef _MSC_VER
5000  #define stb_rename(x,y) _wrename((const wchar_t *)stb__from_utf8(x), (const wchar_t *)stb__from_utf8_alt(y))
5001  #define stb_mktemp _mktemp
5002 #else
5003  #define stb_mktemp mktemp
5004  #define stb_rename rename
5005 #endif
5006

5008 STB_EXTERN stb_uint64 stb_fget_varlen64(FILE *f);
5009 STB_EXTERN int stb_size_varlen64(stb_uint64 v);

5013 #define stb_fileu (unsigned char *) stb_file
5014 STB_EXTERN void * stb_file(char *filename, size_t *length);
5015 STB_EXTERN void * stb_file_max(char *filename, size_t *length);
5016 STB_EXTERN size_t stb_filelen(FILE *f);
5017 STB_EXTERN int stb_filewrite(char *filename, void *data, size_t length);
5018 STB_EXTERN int stb_filewritestr(char *filename, char *data);
5019 STB_EXTERN char ** stb_stringfile(char *filename, int *len);
5020 STB_EXTERN char ** stb_stringfile_trimmed(char *name, int *len, char comm);
5021 STB_EXTERN char * stb_fgets(char *buffer, int buflen, FILE *f);
5022 STB_EXTERN char * stb_fgets_malloc(FILE *f);
5023 STB_EXTERN int stb_fexists(char *filename);

5025 STB_EXTERN int stb_feq(char *s1, char *s2);

5027

5029 STB_EXTERN FILE * stb_fopen(char *filename, char *mode);
5030 STB_EXTERN int stb_fclose(FILE *f, int keep);

5033 {
5034  stb_keep_no = 0,
5035  stb_keep_yes = 1,
5036  stb_keep_if_different = 2,
5037 };

5042 STB_EXTERN stb_uint64 stb_fget_varlen64(FILE *f);
5043 STB_EXTERN int stb_size_varlen64(stb_uint64 v);
5044

5046 STB_EXTERN void stb_fput_varlen (FILE *f, int v);
5047 STB_EXTERN void stb_fput_varlenu(FILE *f, unsigned int v);
5048 STB_EXTERN int stb_fget_varlen (FILE *f);
5049 STB_EXTERN stb_uint stb_fget_varlenu(FILE *f);
5050 STB_EXTERN void stb_fput_ranged (FILE *f, int v, int b, stb_uint n);
5051 STB_EXTERN int stb_fget_ranged (FILE *f, int b, stb_uint n);

5056 STB_EXTERN int stb_fread(void *data, size_t len, size_t count, void *f);
5057 STB_EXTERN int stb_fwrite(void *data, size_t len, size_t count, void *f);
5058 
5059 #if 0
5060 typedef struct
5061 {
5062  FILE *base_file;
5063  char *buffer;
5064  int buffer_size;
5065  int buffer_off;
5066  int buffer_left;
5067 } STBF;
5068 
5069 STB_EXTERN STBF *stb_tfopen(char *filename, char *mode);
5070 STB_EXTERN int stb_tfread(void *data, size_t len, size_t count, STBF *f);
5071 STB_EXTERN int stb_tfwrite(void *data, size_t len, size_t count, STBF *f);
5072 #endif
5073 
5074 #ifdef STB_DEFINE
5075 
5076 #if 0
5077 STBF *stb_tfopen(char *filename, char *mode)
5078 {
5079  STBF *z;
5080  FILE *f = fopen(filename, mode);
5081  if (!f) return NULL;
5082  z = (STBF *) malloc(sizeof(*z));
5083  if (!z) { fclose(f); return NULL; }
5084  z->base_file = f;
5085  if (!strcmp(mode, "rb") || !strcmp(mode, "wb")) {
5086  z->buffer_size = 4096;
5087  z->buffer_off = z->buffer_size;
5088  z->buffer_left = 0;
5089  z->buffer = malloc(z->buffer_size);
5090  if (!z->buffer) { free(z); fclose(f); return NULL; }
5091  } else {
5092  z->buffer = 0;
5093  z->buffer_size = 0;
5094  z->buffer_left = 0;
5095  }
5096  return z;
5097 }
5098 
5099 int stb_tfread(void *data, size_t len, size_t count, STBF *f)
5100 {
5101  int total = len*count, done=0;
5102  if (!total) return 0;
5103  if (total <= z->buffer_left) {
5104  memcpy(data, z->buffer + z->buffer_off, total);
5105  z->buffer_off += total;
5106  z->buffer_left -= total;
5107  return count;
5108  } else {
5109  char *out = (char *) data;
5110 
5111  // consume all buffered data
5112  memcpy(data, z->buffer + z->buffer_off, z->buffer_left);
5113  done = z->buffer_left;
5114  out += z->buffer_left;
5115  z->buffer_left=0;
5116 
5117  if (total-done > (z->buffer_size >> 1)) {
5118  done += fread(out
5119  }
5120  }
5121 }
5122 #endif
5123 
5124 void stb_fwrite32(FILE *f, stb_uint32 x)
5125 {
5126  fwrite(&x, 4, 1, f);
5127 }
5128 
5129 #if defined(_MSC_VER) || defined(__MINGW32__)
5130  #define stb__stat _stat
5131 #else
5132  #define stb__stat stat
5133 #endif
5134 
5135 int stb_fexists(char *filename)
5136 {
5137  struct stb__stat buf;
5138  return stb__windows(
5139  _wstat((const wchar_t *)stb__from_utf8(filename), &buf),
5140  stat(filename,&buf)
5141  ) == 0;
5142 }
5143 
5144 time_t stb_ftimestamp(char *filename)
5145 {
5146  struct stb__stat buf;
5147  if (stb__windows(
5148  _wstat((const wchar_t *)stb__from_utf8(filename), &buf),
5149  stat(filename,&buf)
5150  ) == 0)
5151  {
5152  return buf.st_mtime;
5153  } else {
5154  return 0;
5155  }
5156 }
5157 
5158 size_t stb_filelen(FILE *f)
5159 {
5160  size_t len, pos;
5161  pos = ftell(f);
5162  fseek(f, 0, SEEK_END);
5163  len = ftell(f);
5164  fseek(f, pos, SEEK_SET);
5165  return len;
5166 }
5167 
5168 void *stb_file(char *filename, size_t *length)
5169 {
5170  FILE *f = stb__fopen(filename, "rb");
5171  char *buffer;
5172  size_t len, len2;
5173  if (!f) return NULL;
5174  len = stb_filelen(f);
5175  buffer = (char *) malloc(len+2); // nul + extra
5176  len2 = fread(buffer, 1, len, f);
5177  if (len2 == len) {
5178  if (length) *length = len;
5179  buffer[len] = 0;
5180  } else {
5181  free(buffer);
5182  buffer = NULL;
5183  }
5184  fclose(f);
5185  return buffer;
5186 }
5187 
5188 int stb_filewrite(char *filename, void *data, size_t length)
5189 {
5190  FILE *f = stb_fopen(filename, "wb");
5191  if (f) {
5192  fwrite(data, 1, length, f);
5193  stb_fclose(f, stb_keep_if_different);
5194  }
5195  return f != NULL;
5196 }
5197 
5198 int stb_filewritestr(char *filename, char *data)
5199 {
5200  return stb_filewrite(filename, data, strlen(data));
5201 }
5202 
5203 void * stb_file_max(char *filename, size_t *length)
5204 {
5205  FILE *f = stb__fopen(filename, "rb");
5206  char *buffer;
5207  size_t len, maxlen;
5208  if (!f) return NULL;
5209  maxlen = *length;
5210  buffer = (char *) malloc(maxlen+1);
5211  len = fread(buffer, 1, maxlen, f);
5212  buffer[len] = 0;
5213  fclose(f);
5214  *length = len;
5215  return buffer;
5216 }
5217 
5218 char ** stb_stringfile(char *filename, int *plen)
5219 {
5220  FILE *f = stb__fopen(filename, "rb");
5221  char *buffer, **list=NULL, *s;
5222  size_t len, count, i;
5223 
5224  if (!f) return NULL;
5225  len = stb_filelen(f);
5226  buffer = (char *) malloc(len+1);
5227  len = fread(buffer, 1, len, f);
5228  buffer[len] = 0;
5229  fclose(f);
5230 
5231  // two passes through: first time count lines, second time set them
5232  for (i=0; i < 2; ++i) {
5233  s = buffer;
5234  if (i == 1)
5235  list[0] = s;
5236  count = 1;
5237  while (*s) {
5238  if (*s == '\n' || *s == '\r') {
5239  // detect if both cr & lf are together
5240  int crlf = (s[0] + s[1]) == ('\n' + '\r');
5241  if (i == 1) *s = 0;
5242  if (crlf) ++s;
5243  if (s[1]) { // it's not over yet
5244  if (i == 1) list[count] = s+1;
5245  ++count;
5246  }
5247  }
5248  ++s;
5249  }
5250  if (i == 0) {
5251  list = (char **) malloc(sizeof(*list) * (count+1) + len+1);
5252  if (!list) return NULL;
5253  list[count] = 0;
5254  // recopy the file so there's just a single allocation to free
5255  memcpy(&list[count+1], buffer, len+1);
5256  free(buffer);
5257  buffer = (char *) &list[count+1];
5258  if (plen) *plen = count;
5259  }
5260  }
5261  return list;
5262 }
5263 
5264 char ** stb_stringfile_trimmed(char *name, int *len, char comment)
5265 {
5266  int i,n,o=0;
5267  char **s = stb_stringfile(name, &n);
5268  if (s == NULL) return NULL;
5269  for (i=0; i < n; ++i) {
5270  char *p = stb_skipwhite(s[i]);
5271  if (*p && *p != comment)
5272  s[o++] = p;
5273  }
5274  s[o] = NULL;
5275  if (len) *len = o;
5276  return s;
5277 }
5278 
5279 char * stb_fgets(char *buffer, int buflen, FILE *f)
5280 {
5281  char *p;
5282  buffer[0] = 0;
5283  p = fgets(buffer, buflen, f);
5284  if (p) {
5285  int n = strlen(p)-1;
5286  if (n >= 0)
5287  if (p[n] == '\n')
5288  p[n] = 0;
5289  }
5290  return p;
5291 }
5292 
5293 char * stb_fgets_malloc(FILE *f)
5294 {
5295  // avoid reallocing for small strings
5296  char quick_buffer[800];
5297  quick_buffer[sizeof(quick_buffer)-2] = 0;
5298  if (!fgets(quick_buffer, sizeof(quick_buffer), f))
5299  return NULL;
5300 
5301  if (quick_buffer[sizeof(quick_buffer)-2] == 0) {
5302  int n = strlen(quick_buffer);
5303  if (n > 0 && quick_buffer[n-1] == '\n')
5304  quick_buffer[n-1] = 0;
5305  return _strdup(quick_buffer);
5306  } else {
5307  char *p;
5308  char *a = _strdup(quick_buffer);
5309  int len = sizeof(quick_buffer)-1;
5310 
5311  while (!feof(f)) {
5312  if (a[len-1] == '\n') break;
5313  a = (char *) realloc(a, len*2);
5314  p = &a[len];
5315  p[len-2] = 0;
5316  if (!fgets(p, len, f))
5317  break;
5318  if (p[len-2] == 0) {
5319  len += strlen(p);
5320  break;
5321  }
5322  len = len + (len-1);
5323  }
5324  if (a[len-1] == '\n')
5325  a[len-1] = 0;
5326  return a;
5327  }
5328 }
5329 
5330 int stb_fullpath(char *abs, int abs_size, char *rel)
5331 {
5332  #ifdef _MSC_VER
5333  return _fullpath(abs, rel, abs_size) != NULL;
5334  #else
5335  if (rel[0] == '/' || rel[0] == '~') {
5336  if ((int) strlen(rel) >= abs_size)
5337  return 0;
5338  strcpy(abs,rel);
5339  return STB_TRUE;
5340  } else {
5341  int n;
5342  getcwd(abs, abs_size);
5343  n = strlen(abs);
5344  if (n+(int) strlen(rel)+2 <= abs_size) {
5345  abs[n] = '/';
5346  strcpy(abs+n+1, rel);
5347  return STB_TRUE;
5348  } else {
5349  return STB_FALSE;
5350  }
5351  }
5352  #endif
5353 }
5354 
5355 static int stb_fcmp_core(FILE *f, FILE *g)
5356 {
5357  char buf1[1024],buf2[1024];
5358  int n1,n2, res=0;
5359 
5360  while (1) {
5361  n1 = fread(buf1, 1, sizeof(buf1), f);
5362  n2 = fread(buf2, 1, sizeof(buf2), g);
5363  res = memcmp(buf1,buf2,stb_min(n1,n2));
5364  if (res)
5365  break;
5366  if (n1 != n2) {
5367  res = n1 < n2 ? -1 : 1;
5368  break;
5369  }
5370  if (n1 == 0)
5371  break;
5372  }
5373 
5374  fclose(f);
5375  fclose(g);
5376  return res;
5377 }
5378 
5379 int stb_fcmp(char *s1, char *s2)
5380 {
