5381  FILE *f = stb__fopen(s1, "rb");
5382  FILE *g = stb__fopen(s2, "rb");
5383 
5384  if (f == NULL || g == NULL) {
5385  if (f) fclose(f);
5386  if (g) {
5387  fclose(g);
5388  return STB_TRUE;
5389  }
5390  return f != NULL;
5391  }
5392 
5393  return stb_fcmp_core(f,g);
5394 }
5395 
5396 int stb_feq(char *s1, char *s2)
5397 {
5398  FILE *f = stb__fopen(s1, "rb");
5399  FILE *g = stb__fopen(s2, "rb");
5400 
5401  if (f == NULL || g == NULL) {
5402  if (f) fclose(f);
5403  if (g) fclose(g);
5404  return f == g;
5405  }
5406 
5407  // feq is faster because it shortcuts if they're different length
5408  if (stb_filelen(f) != stb_filelen(g)) {
5409  fclose(f);
5410  fclose(g);
5411  return 0;
5412  }
5413 
5414  return !stb_fcmp_core(f,g);
5415 }
5416 
5417 static stb_ptrmap *stb__files;
5418 
5419 typedef struct
5420 {
5421  char *temp_name;
5422  char *name;
5423  int errors;
5424 } stb__file_data;
5425 
5426 FILE * stb_fopen(char *filename, char *mode)
5427 {
5428  FILE *f;
5429  char name_full[4096];
5430  char temp_full[sizeof(name_full) + 12];
5431  int p;
5432 #ifdef _MSC_VER
5433  int j;
5434 #endif
5435  if (mode[0] != 'w' && !strchr(mode, '+'))
5436  return stb__fopen(filename, mode);
5437 
5438  // save away the full path to the file so if the program
5439  // changes the cwd everything still works right! unix has
5440  // better ways to do this, but we have to work in windows
5441  name_full[0] = '\0'; // stb_fullpath reads name_full[0]
5442  if (stb_fullpath(name_full, sizeof(name_full), filename)==0)
5443  return 0;
5444 
5445  // try to generate a temporary file in the same directory
5446  p = strlen(name_full)-1;
5447  while (p > 0 && name_full[p] != '/' && name_full[p] != '\\'
5448  && name_full[p] != ':' && name_full[p] != '~')
5449  --p;
5450  ++p;
5451 
5452  memcpy(temp_full, name_full, p);
5453 
5454  #ifdef _MSC_VER
5455  // try multiple times to make a temp file... just in
5456  // case some other process makes the name first
5457  for (j=0; j < 32; ++j) {
5458  strcpy(temp_full+p, "stmpXXXXXX");
5459  if (stb_mktemp(temp_full) == NULL)
5460  return 0;
5461 
5462  f = fopen(temp_full, mode);
5463  if (f != NULL)
5464  break;
5465  }
5466  #else
5467  {
5468  strcpy(temp_full+p, "stmpXXXXXX");
5469  #ifdef __MINGW32__
5470  int fd = open(mktemp(temp_full), O_RDWR);
5471  #else
5472  int fd = mkstemp(temp_full);
5473  #endif
5474  if (fd == -1) return NULL;
5475  f = fdopen(fd, mode);
5476  if (f == NULL) {
5477  unlink(temp_full);
5478  close(fd);
5479  return NULL;
5480  }
5481  }
5482  #endif
5483  if (f != NULL) {
5484  stb__file_data *d = (stb__file_data *) malloc(sizeof(*d));
5485  if (!d) { assert(0); /* NOTREACHED */fclose(f); return NULL; }
5486  if (stb__files == NULL) stb__files = stb_ptrmap_create();
5487  d->temp_name = _strdup(temp_full);
5488  d->name = _strdup(name_full);
5489  d->errors = 0;
5490  stb_ptrmap_add(stb__files, f, d);
5491  return f;
5492  }
5493 
5494  return NULL;
5495 }
5496 
5497 int stb_fclose(FILE *f, int keep)
5498 {
5499  stb__file_data *d;
5500 
5501  int ok = STB_FALSE;
5502  if (f == NULL) return 0;
5503 
5504  if (ferror(f))
5505  keep = stb_keep_no;
5506 
5507  fclose(f);
5508 
5509  if (stb__files && stb_ptrmap_remove(stb__files, f, (void **) &d)) {
5510  if (stb__files->count == 0) {
5511  stb_ptrmap_destroy(stb__files);
5512  stb__files = NULL;
5513  }
5514  } else
5515  return STB_TRUE; // not special
5516 
5517  if (keep == stb_keep_if_different) {
5518  // check if the files are identical
5519  if (stb_feq(d->name, d->temp_name)) {
5520  keep = stb_keep_no;
5521  ok = STB_TRUE; // report success if no change
5522  }
5523  }
5524 
5525  if (keep != stb_keep_no) {
5526  if (stb_fexists(d->name) && remove(d->name)) {
5527  // failed to delete old, so don't keep new
5528  keep = stb_keep_no;
5529  } else {
5530  if (!stb_rename(d->temp_name, d->name))
5531  ok = STB_TRUE;
5532  else
5533  keep=stb_keep_no;
5534  }
5535  }
5536 
5537  if (keep == stb_keep_no)
5538  remove(d->temp_name);
5539 
5540  free(d->temp_name);
5541  free(d->name);
5542  free(d);
5543 
5544  return ok;
5545 }
5546 
5547 int stb_copyfile(char *src, char *dest)
5548 {
5549  char raw_buffer[1024];
5550  char *buffer;
5551  int buf_size = 65536;
5552 
5553  FILE *f, *g;
5554 
5555  // if file already exists at destination, do nothing
5556  if (stb_feq(src, dest)) return STB_TRUE;
5557 
5558  // open file
5559  f = stb__fopen(src, "rb");
5560  if (f == NULL) return STB_FALSE;
5561 
5562  // open file for writing
5563  g = stb__fopen(dest, "wb");
5564  if (g == NULL) {
5565  fclose(f);
5566  return STB_FALSE;
5567  }
5568 
5569  buffer = (char *) malloc(buf_size);
5570  if (buffer == NULL) {
5571  buffer = raw_buffer;
5572  buf_size = sizeof(raw_buffer);
5573  }
5574 
5575  while (!feof(f)) {
5576  int n = fread(buffer, 1, buf_size, f);
5577  if (n != 0)
5578  fwrite(buffer, 1, n, g);
5579  }
5580 
5581  fclose(f);
5582  if (buffer != raw_buffer)
5583  free(buffer);
5584 
5585  fclose(g);
5586  return STB_TRUE;
5587 }
5588 
5589 // varlen:
5590 // v' = (v >> 31) + (v < 0 ? ~v : v)<<1; // small abs(v) => small v'
5591 // output v as big endian v'+k for v' <= k:
5592 // 1 byte : v' <= 0x00000080 ( -64 <= v < 64) 7 bits
5593 // 2 bytes: v' <= 0x00004000 (-8192 <= v < 8192) 14 bits
5594 // 3 bytes: v' <= 0x00200000 21 bits
5595 // 4 bytes: v' <= 0x10000000 28 bits
5596 // the number of most significant 1-bits in the first byte
5597 // equals the number of bytes after the first
5598 
5599 #define stb__varlen_xform(v) (v<0 ? (~v << 1)+1 : (v << 1))
5600 
5601 int stb_size_varlen(int v) { return stb_size_varlenu(stb__varlen_xform(v)); }
5602 int stb_size_varlenu(unsigned int v)
5603 {
5604  if (v < 0x00000080) return 1;
5605  if (v < 0x00004000) return 2;
5606  if (v < 0x00200000) return 3;
5607  if (v < 0x10000000) return 4;
5608  return 5;
5609 }
5610 
5611 void stb_fput_varlen(FILE *f, int v) { stb_fput_varlenu(f, stb__varlen_xform(v)); }
5612 
5613 void stb_fput_varlenu(FILE *f, unsigned int z)
5614 {
5615  if (z >= 0x10000000) fputc(0xF0,f);
5616  if (z >= 0x00200000) fputc((z < 0x10000000 ? 0xE0 : 0)+(z>>24),f);
5617  if (z >= 0x00004000) fputc((z < 0x00200000 ? 0xC0 : 0)+(z>>16),f);
5618  if (z >= 0x00000080) fputc((z < 0x00004000 ? 0x80 : 0)+(z>> 8),f);
5619  fputc(z,f);
5620 }
5621 
5622 #define stb_fgetc(f) ((unsigned char) fgetc(f))
5623 
5624 int stb_fget_varlen(FILE *f)
5625 {
5626  unsigned int z = stb_fget_varlenu(f);
5627  return (z & 1) ? ~(z>>1) : (z>>1);
5628 }
5629 
5630 unsigned int stb_fget_varlenu(FILE *f)
5631 {
5632  unsigned int z;
5633  unsigned char d;
5634  d = stb_fgetc(f);
5635 
5636  if (d >= 0x80) {
5637  if (d >= 0xc0) {
5638  if (d >= 0xe0) {
5639  if (d == 0xf0) z = stb_fgetc(f) << 24;
5640  else z = (d - 0xe0) << 24;
5641  z += stb_fgetc(f) << 16;
5642  }
5643  else
5644  z = (d - 0xc0) << 16;
5645  z += stb_fgetc(f) << 8;
5646  } else
5647  z = (d - 0x80) << 8;
5648  z += stb_fgetc(f);
5649  } else
5650  z = d;
5651  return z;
5652 }
5653 
5654 stb_uint64 stb_fget_varlen64(FILE *f)
5655 {
5656  stb_uint64 z;
5657  unsigned char d;
5658  d = stb_fgetc(f);
5659 
5660  if (d >= 0x80) {
5661  if (d >= 0xc0) {
5662  if (d >= 0xe0) {
5663  if (d >= 0xf0) {
5664  if (d >= 0xf8) {
5665  if (d >= 0xfc) {
5666  if (d >= 0xfe) {
5667  if (d >= 0xff)
5668  z = (stb_uint64) stb_fgetc(f) << 56;
5669  else
5670  z = (stb_uint64) (d - 0xfe) << 56;
5671  z |= (stb_uint64) stb_fgetc(f) << 48;
5672  } else z = (stb_uint64) (d - 0xfc) << 48;
5673  z |= (stb_uint64) stb_fgetc(f) << 40;
5674  } else z = (stb_uint64) (d - 0xf8) << 40;
5675  z |= (stb_uint64) stb_fgetc(f) << 32;
5676  } else z = (stb_uint64) (d - 0xf0) << 32;
5677  z |= (stb_uint) stb_fgetc(f) << 24;
5678  } else z = (stb_uint) (d - 0xe0) << 24;
5679  z |= (stb_uint) stb_fgetc(f) << 16;
5680  } else z = (stb_uint) (d - 0xc0) << 16;
5681  z |= (stb_uint) stb_fgetc(f) << 8;
5682  } else z = (stb_uint) (d - 0x80) << 8;
5683  z |= stb_fgetc(f);
5684  } else
5685  z = d;
5686 
5687  return (z & 1) ? ~(z >> 1) : (z >> 1);
5688 }
5689 
5690 int stb_size_varlen64(stb_uint64 v)
5691 {
5692  if (v < 0x00000080) return 1;
5693  if (v < 0x00004000) return 2;
5694  if (v < 0x00200000) return 3;
5695  if (v < 0x10000000) return 4;
5696  if (v < STB_IMM_UINT64(0x0000000800000000)) return 5;
5697  if (v < STB_IMM_UINT64(0x0000040000000000)) return 6;
5698  if (v < STB_IMM_UINT64(0x0002000000000000)) return 7;
5699  if (v < STB_IMM_UINT64(0x0100000000000000)) return 8;
5700  return 9;
5701 }
5702 
5703 void stb_fput_varlen64(FILE *f, stb_uint64 v)
5704 {
5705  stb_uint64 z = stb__varlen_xform(v);
5706  int first=1;
5707  if (z >= STB_IMM_UINT64(0x100000000000000)) {
5708  fputc(0xff,f);
5709  first=0;
5710  }
5711  if (z >= STB_IMM_UINT64(0x02000000000000)) fputc((first ? 0xFE : 0)+(char)(z>>56),f), first=0;
5712  if (z >= STB_IMM_UINT64(0x00040000000000)) fputc((first ? 0xFC : 0)+(char)(z>>48),f), first=0;
5713  if (z >= STB_IMM_UINT64(0x00000800000000)) fputc((first ? 0xF8 : 0)+(char)(z>>40),f), first=0;
5714  if (z >= STB_IMM_UINT64(0x00000010000000)) fputc((first ? 0xF0 : 0)+(char)(z>>32),f), first=0;
5715  if (z >= STB_IMM_UINT64(0x00000000200000)) fputc((first ? 0xE0 : 0)+(char)(z>>24),f), first=0;
5716  if (z >= STB_IMM_UINT64(0x00000000004000)) fputc((first ? 0xC0 : 0)+(char)(z>>16),f), first=0;
5717  if (z >= STB_IMM_UINT64(0x00000000000080)) fputc((first ? 0x80 : 0)+(char)(z>> 8),f), first=0;
5718  fputc((char)z,f);
5719 }
5720 
5721 void stb_fput_ranged(FILE *f, int v, int b, stb_uint n)
5722 {
5723  v -= b;
5724  if (n <= (1 << 31))
5725  assert((stb_uint) v < n);
5726  if (n > (1 << 24)) fputc(v >> 24, f);
5727  if (n > (1 << 16)) fputc(v >> 16, f);
5728  if (n > (1 << 8)) fputc(v >> 8, f);
5729  fputc(v,f);
5730 }
5731 
5732 int stb_fget_ranged(FILE *f, int b, stb_uint n)
5733 {
5734  unsigned int v=0;
5735  if (n > (1 << 24)) v += stb_fgetc(f) << 24;
5736  if (n > (1 << 16)) v += stb_fgetc(f) << 16;
5737  if (n > (1 << 8)) v += stb_fgetc(f) << 8;
5738  v += stb_fgetc(f);
5739  return b+v;
5740 }
5741 
5742 int stb_size_ranged(int b, stb_uint n)
5743 {
5744  if (n > (1 << 24)) return 4;
5745  if (n > (1 << 16)) return 3;
5746  if (n > (1 << 8)) return 2;
5747  return 1;
5748 }
5749 
5750 void stb_fput_string(FILE *f, char *s)
5751 {
5752  int len = strlen(s);
5753  stb_fput_varlenu(f, len);
5754  fwrite(s, 1, len, f);
5755 }
5756 
5757 // inverse of the above algorithm
5758 char *stb_fget_string(FILE *f, void *p)
5759 {
5760  char *s;
5761  int len = stb_fget_varlenu(f);
5762  if (len > 4096) return NULL;
5763  s = p ? stb_malloc_string(p, len+1) : (char *) malloc(len+1);
5764  fread(s, 1, len, f);
5765  s[len] = 0;
5766  return s;
5767 }
5768 
5769 char *stb__strdup(char *str, void *pool)
5770 {
5771  int len = strlen(str);
5772  char *p = stb_malloc_string(pool, len+1);
5773  strcpy(p, str);
5774  return p;
5775 }
5776 
5777 // strip the trailing '/' or '\\' from a directory so we can refer to it
5778 // as a file for _stat()
5779 char *stb_strip_final_slash(char *t)
5780 {
5781  if (t[0]) {
5782  char *z = t + strlen(t) - 1;
5783  // *z is the last character
5784  if (*z == '\\' || *z == '/')
5785  if (z != t+2 || t[1] != ':') // but don't strip it if it's e.g. "c:/"
5786  *z = 0;
5787  if (*z == '\\')
5788  *z = '/'; // canonicalize to make sure it matches db
5789  }
5790  return t;
5791 }
5792 #endif
5793 
5795 //
5796 // Options parsing
5797 //
5798 
5799 STB_EXTERN char **stb_getopt_param(int *argc, char **argv, char *param);
5800 STB_EXTERN char **stb_getopt(int *argc, char **argv);
5801 STB_EXTERN void stb_getopt_free(char **opts);
5802 
5803 #ifdef STB_DEFINE
5804 
5805 void stb_getopt_free(char **opts)
5806 {
5807  int i;
5808  char ** o2 = opts;
5809  for (i=0; i < stb_arr_len(o2); ++i)
5810  free(o2[i]);
5811  stb_arr_free(o2);
5812 }
5813 
5814 char **stb_getopt(int *argc, char **argv)
5815 {
5816  return stb_getopt_param(argc, argv, "");
5817 }
5818 
5819 char **stb_getopt_param(int *argc, char **argv, char *param)
5820 {
5821  char ** opts=NULL;
5822  int i,j=1;
5823  for (i=1; i < *argc; ++i) {
5824  if (argv[i][0] != '-') {
5825  argv[j++] = argv[i];
5826  } else {
5827  if (argv[i][1] == 0) { // plain - == don't parse further options
5828  ++i;
5829  while (i < *argc)
5830  argv[j++] = argv[i++];
5831  break;
5832  } else {
5833  int k;
5834  char *q = argv[i]; // traverse options list
5835  for (k=1; q[k]; ++k) {
5836  char *s;
5837  if (strchr(param, q[k])) { // does it take a parameter?
5838  char *t = &q[k+1], z = q[k];
5839  int len=0;
5840  if (*t == 0) {
5841  if (i == *argc-1) { // takes a parameter, but none found
5842  *argc = 0;
5843  stb_getopt_free(opts);
5844  return NULL;
5845  }
5846  t = argv[++i];
5847  } else
5848  k += strlen(t);
5849  len = strlen(t);
5850  s = (char *) malloc(len+2);
5851  if (!s) return NULL;
5852  s[0] = z;
5853  strcpy(s+1, t);
5854  } else {
5855  // no parameter
5856  s = (char *) malloc(2);
5857  if (!s) return NULL;
5858  s[0] = q[k];
5859  s[1] = 0;
5860  }
5861  stb_arr_push(opts, s);
5862  }
5863  }
5864  }
5865  }
5866  stb_arr_push(opts, NULL);
5867  *argc = j;
5868  return opts;
5869 }
5870 #endif
5871 
5872 
5874 //
5875 // Portable directory reading
5876 //
5877 
5878 STB_EXTERN char **stb_readdir_files (char *dir);
5879 STB_EXTERN char **stb_readdir_files_mask(char *dir, char *wild);
5880 STB_EXTERN char **stb_readdir_subdirs(char *dir);
5881 STB_EXTERN char **stb_readdir_subdirs_mask(char *dir, char *wild);
5882 STB_EXTERN void stb_readdir_free (char **files);
5883 STB_EXTERN char **stb_readdir_recursive(char *dir, char *filespec);
5884 STB_EXTERN void stb_delete_directory_recursive(char *dir);
5885 
5886 #ifdef STB_DEFINE
5887 
5888 #ifdef _MSC_VER
5889 #include <io.h>
5890 #else
5891 #include <unistd.h>
5892 #include <dirent.h>
5893 #endif
5894 
5895 void stb_readdir_free(char **files)
5896 {
5897  char **f2 = files;
5898  int i;
5899  for (i=0; i < stb_arr_len(f2); ++i)
5900  free(f2[i]);
5901  stb_arr_free(f2);
5902 }
5903 
5904 static int isdotdirname(char *name)
5905 {
5906  if (name[0] == '.')
5907  return (name[1] == '.') ? !name[2] : !name[1];
5908  return 0;
5909 }
5910 
5911 STB_EXTERN int stb_wildmatchi(char *expr, char *candidate);
5912 static char **readdir_raw(char *dir, int return_subdirs, char *mask)
5913 {
5914  char **results = NULL;
5915  char buffer[4096], with_slash[4096];
5916  size_t n;
5917 
5918  #ifdef _MSC_VER
5919  stb__wchar *ws;
5920  struct _wfinddata_t data;
5921  #ifdef _WIN64
5922  const intptr_t none = -1;
5923  intptr_t z;
5924  #else
5925  const long none = -1;
5926  long z;
5927  #endif
5928  #else // !_MSC_VER
5929  const DIR *none = NULL;
5930  DIR *z;
5931  #endif
5932 
5933  n = stb_strscpy(buffer,dir,sizeof(buffer));
5934  if (!n || n >= sizeof(buffer))
5935  return NULL;
5936  stb_fixpath(buffer);
5937  n--;
5938 
5939  if (n > 0 && (buffer[n-1] != '/')) {
5940  buffer[n++] = '/';
5941  }
5942  buffer[n] = 0;
5943  if (!stb_strscpy(with_slash,buffer,sizeof(with_slash)))
5944  return NULL;
5945 
5946  #ifdef _MSC_VER
5947  if (!stb_strscpy(buffer+n,"*.*",sizeof(buffer)-n))
5948  return NULL;
5949  ws = stb__from_utf8(buffer);
5950  z = _wfindfirst((const wchar_t *)ws, &data);
5951  #else
5952  z = opendir(dir);
5953  #endif
5954 
5955  if (z != none) {
5956  int nonempty = STB_TRUE;
5957  #ifndef _MSC_VER
5958  struct dirent *data = readdir(z);
5959  nonempty = (data != NULL);
5960  #endif
5961 
5962  if (nonempty) {
5963 
5964  do {
5965  int is_subdir;
5966  #ifdef _MSC_VER
5967  char *name = stb__to_utf8((stb__wchar *)data.name);
5968  if (name == NULL) {
5969  fprintf(stderr, "%s to convert '%S' to %s!\n", "Unable", data.name, "utf8");
5970  continue;
5971  }
5972  is_subdir = !!(data.attrib & _A_SUBDIR);
5973  #else
5974  char *name = data->d_name;
5975  if (!stb_strscpy(buffer+n,name,sizeof(buffer)-n))
5976  break;
5977  // Could follow DT_LNK, but would need to check for recursive links.
5978  is_subdir = !!(data->d_type & DT_DIR);
5979  #endif
5980 
5981  if (is_subdir == return_subdirs) {
5982  if (!is_subdir || !isdotdirname(name)) {
5983  if (!mask || stb_wildmatchi(mask, name)) {
5984  char buffer[4096],*p=buffer;
5985  if ( stb_snprintf(buffer, sizeof(buffer), "%s%s", with_slash, name) < 0 )
5986  break;
5987  if (buffer[0] == '.' && buffer[1] == '/')
5988  p = buffer+2;
5989  stb_arr_push(results, _strdup(p));
5990  }
5991  }
5992  }
5993  }
5994  #ifdef _MSC_VER
5995  while (0 == _wfindnext(z, &data));
5996  #else
5997  while ((data = readdir(z)) != NULL);
5998  #endif
5999  }
6000  #ifdef _MSC_VER
6001  _findclose(z);
6002  #else
6003  closedir(z);
6004  #endif
6005  }
6006  return results;
6007 }
6008 
6009 char **stb_readdir_files (char *dir) { return readdir_raw(dir, 0, NULL); }
6010 char **stb_readdir_subdirs(char *dir) { return readdir_raw(dir, 1, NULL); }
6011 char **stb_readdir_files_mask(char *dir, char *wild) { return readdir_raw(dir, 0, wild); }
6012 char **stb_readdir_subdirs_mask(char *dir, char *wild) { return readdir_raw(dir, 1, wild); }
6013 
6014 int stb__rec_max=0x7fffffff;
6015 static char **stb_readdir_rec(char **sofar, char *dir, char *filespec)
6016 {
6017  char **files;
6018  char ** dirs;
6019  char **p;
6020 
6021  if (stb_arr_len(sofar) >= stb__rec_max) return sofar;
6022 
6023  files = stb_readdir_files_mask(dir, filespec);
6024  stb_arr_for(p, files) {
6025  stb_arr_push(sofar, _strdup(*p));
6026  if (stb_arr_len(sofar) >= stb__rec_max) break;
6027  }
6028  stb_readdir_free(files);
6029  if (stb_arr_len(sofar) >= stb__rec_max) return sofar;
6030 
6031  dirs = stb_readdir_subdirs(dir);
6032  stb_arr_for(p, dirs)
6033  sofar = stb_readdir_rec(sofar, *p, filespec);
6034  stb_readdir_free(dirs);
6035  return sofar;
6036 }
6037 
6038 char **stb_readdir_recursive(char *dir, char *filespec)
6039 {
6040  return stb_readdir_rec(NULL, dir, filespec);
6041 }
6042 
6043 void stb_delete_directory_recursive(char *dir)
6044 {
6045  char **list = stb_readdir_subdirs(dir);
6046  int i;
6047  for (i=0; i < stb_arr_len(list); ++i)
6048  stb_delete_directory_recursive(list[i]);
6049  stb_arr_free(list);
6050  list = stb_readdir_files(dir);
6051  for (i=0; i < stb_arr_len(list); ++i)
6052  if (!remove(list[i])) {
6053  // on windows, try again after making it writeable; don't ALWAYS
6054  // do this first since that would be slow in the normal case
6055  #ifdef _MSC_VER
6056  _chmod(list[i], _S_IWRITE);
6057  remove(list[i]);
6058  #endif
6059  }
6060  stb_arr_free(list);
6061  stb__windows(_rmdir,rmdir)(dir);
6062 }
6063 
6064 #endif
6065 
6067 //
6068 // construct trees from filenames; useful for cmirror summaries
6069 
6070 typedef struct stb_dirtree2 stb_dirtree2;
6071 
6072 struct stb_dirtree2
6073 {
6074  stb_dirtree2 **subdirs;
6075 
6076  // make convenient for stb_summarize_tree
6077  int num_subdir;
6078  float weight;
6079 
6080  // actual data
6081  char *fullpath;
6082  char *relpath;
6083  char **files;
6084 };
6085 
6086 STB_EXTERN stb_dirtree2 *stb_dirtree2_from_files_relative(char *src, char **filelist, int count);
6087 STB_EXTERN stb_dirtree2 *stb_dirtree2_from_files(char **filelist, int count);
6088 STB_EXTERN int stb_dir_is_prefix(char *dir, int dirlen, char *file);
6089 
6090 #ifdef STB_DEFINE
6091 
6092 int stb_dir_is_prefix(char *dir, int dirlen, char *file)
6093 {
6094  if (dirlen == 0) return STB_TRUE;
6095  if (stb_strnicmp(dir, file, dirlen)) return STB_FALSE;
6096  if (file[dirlen] == '/' || file[dirlen] == '\\') return STB_TRUE;
6097  return STB_FALSE;
6098 }
6099 
6100 stb_dirtree2 *stb_dirtree2_from_files_relative(char *src, char **filelist, int count)
6101 {
6102  char buffer1[1024];
6103  int i;
6104  int dlen = strlen(src), elen;
6105  stb_dirtree2 *d;
6106  char ** descendents = NULL;
6107  char ** files = NULL;
6108  char *s;
6109  if (!count) return NULL;
6110  // first find all the ones that belong here... note this is will take O(NM) with N files and M subdirs
6111  for (i=0; i < count; ++i) {
6112  if (stb_dir_is_prefix(src, dlen, filelist[i])) {
6113  stb_arr_push(descendents, filelist[i]);
6114  }
6115  }
6116  if (descendents == NULL)
6117  return NULL;
6118  elen = dlen;
6119  // skip a leading slash
6120  if (elen == 0 && (descendents[0][0] == '/' || descendents[0][0] == '\\'))
6121  ++elen;
6122  else if (elen)
6123  ++elen;
6124  // now extract all the ones that have their root here
6125  for (i=0; i < stb_arr_len(descendents);) {
6126  if (!stb_strchr2(descendents[i]+elen, '/', '\\')) {
6127  stb_arr_push(files, descendents[i]);
6128  descendents[i] = descendents[stb_arr_len(descendents)-1];
6129  stb_arr_pop(descendents);
6130  } else
6131  ++i;
6132  }
6133  // now create a record
6134  d = (stb_dirtree2 *) malloc(sizeof(*d));
6135  d->files = files;
6136  d->subdirs = NULL;
6137  d->fullpath = _strdup(src);
6138  s = stb_strrchr2(d->fullpath, '/', '\\');
6139  if (s)
6140  ++s;
6141  else
6142  s = d->fullpath;
6143  d->relpath = s;
6144  // now create the children
6145  qsort(descendents, stb_arr_len(descendents), sizeof(char *), stb_qsort_stricmp(0));
6146  buffer1[0] = 0;
6147  for (i=0; i < stb_arr_len(descendents); ++i) {
6148  char buffer2[1024];
6149  char *s = descendents[i] + elen, *t;
6150  t = stb_strchr2(s, '/', '\\');
6151  assert(t);
6152  stb_strncpy(buffer2, descendents[i], t-descendents[i]+1);
6153  if (stb_stricmp(buffer1, buffer2)) {
6154  stb_dirtree2 *t = stb_dirtree2_from_files_relative(buffer2, descendents, stb_arr_len(descendents));
6155  assert(t != NULL);
6156  strcpy(buffer1, buffer2);
6157  stb_arr_push(d->subdirs, t);
6158  }
6159  }
6160  d->num_subdir = stb_arr_len(d->subdirs);
6161  d->weight = 0;
6162  return d;
6163 }
6164 
6165 stb_dirtree2 *stb_dirtree2_from_files(char **filelist, int count)
6166 {
6167  return stb_dirtree2_from_files_relative("", filelist, count);
6168 }
6169 #endif
6170 
6172 //
6173 // Checksums: CRC-32, ADLER32, SHA-1
6174 //
6175 // CRC-32 and ADLER32 allow streaming blocks
6176 // SHA-1 requires either a complete buffer, max size 2^32 - 73
6177 // or it can checksum directly from a file, max 2^61
6178 
6179 #define STB_ADLER32_SEED 1
6180 #define STB_CRC32_SEED 0 // note that we logical NOT this in the code
6181 
6182 STB_EXTERN stb_uint
6183  stb_adler32(stb_uint adler32, stb_uchar *buffer, stb_uint buflen);
6184 STB_EXTERN stb_uint
6185  stb_crc32_block(stb_uint crc32, stb_uchar *buffer, stb_uint len);
6186 STB_EXTERN stb_uint stb_crc32(unsigned char *buffer, stb_uint len);
6187 
6188 STB_EXTERN void stb_sha1(
6189  unsigned char output[20], unsigned char *buffer, unsigned int len);
6190 STB_EXTERN int stb_sha1_file(unsigned char output[20], char *file);
6191 
6192 STB_EXTERN void stb_sha1_readable(char display[27], unsigned char sha[20]);
6193 
6194 #ifdef STB_DEFINE
6195 stb_uint stb_crc32_block(stb_uint crc, unsigned char *buffer, stb_uint len)
6196 {
6197  static stb_uint crc_table[256];
6198  stb_uint i,j,s;
6199  crc = ~crc;
6200 
6201  if (crc_table[1] == 0)
6202  for(i=0; i < 256; i++) {
6203  for (s=i, j=0; j < 8; ++j)
6204  s = (s >> 1) ^ (s & 1 ? 0xedb88320 : 0);
6205  crc_table[i] = s;
6206  }
6207  for (i=0; i < len; ++i)
6208  crc = (crc >> 8) ^ crc_table[buffer[i] ^ (crc & 0xff)];
6209  return ~crc;
6210 }
6211 
6212 stb_uint stb_crc32(unsigned char *buffer, stb_uint len)
6213 {
6214  return stb_crc32_block(0, buffer, len);
6215 }
6216 
6217 stb_uint stb_adler32(stb_uint adler32, stb_uchar *buffer, stb_uint buflen)
6218 {
6219  const unsigned long ADLER_MOD = 65521;
6220  unsigned long s1 = adler32 & 0xffff, s2 = adler32 >> 16;
6221  unsigned long blocklen, i;
6222 
6223  blocklen = buflen % 5552;
6224  while (buflen) {
6225  for (i=0; i + 7 < blocklen; i += 8) {
6226  s1 += buffer[0], s2 += s1;
6227  s1 += buffer[1], s2 += s1;
6228  s1 += buffer[2], s2 += s1;
6229  s1 += buffer[3], s2 += s1;
6230  s1 += buffer[4], s2 += s1;
6231  s1 += buffer[5], s2 += s1;
6232  s1 += buffer[6], s2 += s1;
6233  s1 += buffer[7], s2 += s1;
6234 
6235  buffer += 8;
6236  }
6237 
6238  for (; i < blocklen; ++i)
6239  s1 += *buffer++, s2 += s1;
6240 
6241  s1 %= ADLER_MOD, s2 %= ADLER_MOD;
6242  buflen -= blocklen;
6243  blocklen = 5552;
6244  }
6245  return (s2 << 16) + s1;
6246 }
6247 
6248 static void stb__sha1(stb_uchar *chunk, stb_uint h[5])
6249 {
6250  int i;
6251  stb_uint a,b,c,d,e;
6252  stb_uint w[80];
6253 
6254  for (i=0; i < 16; ++i)
6255  w[i] = stb_big32(&chunk[i*4]);
6256  for (i=16; i < 80; ++i) {
6257  stb_uint t;
6258  t = w[i-3] ^ w[i-8] ^ w[i-14] ^ w[i-16];
6259  w[i] = (t + t) | (t >> 31);
6260  }
6261 
6262  a = h[0];
6263  b = h[1];
6264  c = h[2];
6265  d = h[3];
6266  e = h[4];
6267 
6268  #define STB__SHA1(k,f) \
6269  { \
6270  stb_uint temp = (a << 5) + (a >> 27) + (f) + e + (k) + w[i]; \
6271  e = d; \
6272  d = c; \
6273  c = (b << 30) + (b >> 2); \
6274  b = a; \
6275  a = temp; \
6276  }
6277 
6278  i=0;
6279  for (; i < 20; ++i) STB__SHA1(0x5a827999, d ^ (b & (c ^ d)) );
6280  for (; i < 40; ++i) STB__SHA1(0x6ed9eba1, b ^ c ^ d );
6281  for (; i < 60; ++i) STB__SHA1(0x8f1bbcdc, (b & c) + (d & (b ^ c)) );
6282  for (; i < 80; ++i) STB__SHA1(0xca62c1d6, b ^ c ^ d );
6283 
6284  #undef STB__SHA1
6285 
6286  h[0] += a;
6287  h[1] += b;
6288  h[2] += c;
6289  h[3] += d;
6290  h[4] += e;
6291 }
6292 
6293 void stb_sha1(stb_uchar output[20], stb_uchar *buffer, stb_uint len)
6294 {
6295  unsigned char final_block[128];
6296  stb_uint end_start, final_len, j;
6297  int i;
6298 
6299  stb_uint h[5];
6300 
6301  h[0] = 0x67452301;
6302  h[1] = 0xefcdab89;
6303  h[2] = 0x98badcfe;
6304  h[3] = 0x10325476;
6305  h[4] = 0xc3d2e1f0;
6306 
6307  // we need to write padding to the last one or two
6308  // blocks, so build those first into 'final_block'
6309 
6310  // we have to write one special byte, plus the 8-byte length
6311 
6312  // compute the block where the data runs out
6313  end_start = len & ~63;
6314 
6315  // compute the earliest we can encode the length
6316  if (((len+9) & ~63) == end_start) {
6317  // it all fits in one block, so fill a second-to-last block
6318  end_start -= 64;
6319  }
6320 
6321  final_len = end_start + 128;
6322 
6323  // now we need to copy the data in
6324  assert(end_start + 128 >= len+9);
6325  assert(end_start < len || len < 64-9);
6326 
6327  j = 0;
6328  if (end_start > len)
6329  j = (stb_uint) - (int) end_start;
6330 
6331  for (; end_start + j < len; ++j)
6332  final_block[j] = buffer[end_start + j];
6333  final_block[j++] = 0x80;
6334  while (j < 128-5) // 5 byte length, so write 4 extra padding bytes
6335  final_block[j++] = 0;
6336  // big-endian size
6337  final_block[j++] = len >> 29;
6338  final_block[j++] = len >> 21;
6339  final_block[j++] = len >> 13;
6340  final_block[j++] = len >> 5;
6341  final_block[j++] = len << 3;
6342  assert(j == 128 && end_start + j == final_len);
6343 
6344  for (j=0; j < final_len; j += 64) { // 512-bit chunks
6345  if (j+64 >= end_start+64)
6346  stb__sha1(&final_block[j - end_start], h);
6347  else
6348  stb__sha1(&buffer[j], h);
6349  }
6350 
6351  for (i=0; i < 5; ++i) {
6352  output[i*4 + 0] = h[i] >> 24;
6353  output[i*4 + 1] = h[i] >> 16;
6354  output[i*4 + 2] = h[i] >> 8;
6355  output[i*4 + 3] = h[i] >> 0;
6356  }
6357 }
6358 
6359 #ifdef _MSC_VER
6360 int stb_sha1_file(stb_uchar output[20], char *file)
6361 {
6362  int i;
6363  stb_uint64 length=0;
6364  unsigned char buffer[128];
6365 
6366  FILE *f = stb__fopen(file, "rb");
6367  stb_uint h[5];
6368 
6369  if (f == NULL) return 0; // file not found
6370 
6371  h[0] = 0x67452301;
6372  h[1] = 0xefcdab89;
6373  h[2] = 0x98badcfe;
6374  h[3] = 0x10325476;
6375  h[4] = 0xc3d2e1f0;
6376 
6377  for(;;) {
6378  int n = fread(buffer, 1, 64, f);
6379  if (n == 64) {
6380  stb__sha1(buffer, h);
6381  length += n;
6382  } else {
6383  int block = 64;
6384 
6385  length += n;
6386 
6387  buffer[n++] = 0x80;
6388 
6389  // if there isn't enough room for the length, double the block
6390  if (n + 8 > 64)
6391  block = 128;
6392 
6393  // pad to end
6394  memset(buffer+n, 0, block-8-n);
6395 
6396  i = block - 8;
6397  buffer[i++] = (stb_uchar) (length >> 53);
6398  buffer[i++] = (stb_uchar) (length >> 45);
6399  buffer[i++] = (stb_uchar) (length >> 37);
6400  buffer[i++] = (stb_uchar) (length >> 29);
6401  buffer[i++] = (stb_uchar) (length >> 21);
6402  buffer[i++] = (stb_uchar) (length >> 13);
6403  buffer[i++] = (stb_uchar) (length >> 5);
6404  buffer[i++] = (stb_uchar) (length << 3);
6405  assert(i == block);
6406  stb__sha1(buffer, h);
6407  if (block == 128)
6408  stb__sha1(buffer+64, h);
6409  else
6410  assert(block == 64);
6411  break;
6412  }
6413  }
6414  fclose(f);
6415 
6416  for (i=0; i < 5; ++i) {
6417  output[i*4 + 0] = h[i] >> 24;
6418  output[i*4 + 1] = h[i] >> 16;
6419  output[i*4 + 2] = h[i] >> 8;
6420  output[i*4 + 3] = h[i] >> 0;
6421  }
6422 
6423  return 1;
6424 }
6425 #endif // _MSC_VER
6426 
6427 // client can truncate this wherever they like
6428 void stb_sha1_readable(char display[27], unsigned char sha[20])
6429 {
6430  char encoding[65] = "0123456789abcdefghijklmnopqrstuv"
6431  "wxyzABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ%$";
6432  int num_bits = 0, acc=0;
6433  int i=0,o=0;
6434  while (o < 26) {
6435  int v;
6436  // expand the accumulator
6437  if (num_bits < 6) {
6438  assert(i != 20);
6439  acc += sha[i++] << num_bits;
6440  num_bits += 8;
6441  }
6442  v = acc & ((1 << 6) - 1);
6443  display[o++] = encoding[v];
6444  acc >>= 6;
6445  num_bits -= 6;
6446  }
6447  assert(num_bits == 20*8 - 26*6);
6448  display[o++] = encoding[acc];
6449 }
6450 
6451 #endif // STB_DEFINE
6452 
6454 //
6455 // simplified WINDOWS registry interface... hopefully
6456 // we'll never actually use this?
6457 
6458 #if defined(_WIN32)
6459 
6460 STB_EXTERN void * stb_reg_open(char *mode, char *where); // mode: "rHKLM" or "rHKCU" or "w.."
6461 STB_EXTERN void stb_reg_close(void *reg);
6462 STB_EXTERN int stb_reg_read(void *zreg, char *str, void *data, unsigned long len);
6463 STB_EXTERN int stb_reg_read_string(void *zreg, char *str, char *data, int len);
6464 STB_EXTERN void stb_reg_write(void *zreg, char *str, void *data, unsigned long len);
6465 STB_EXTERN void stb_reg_write_string(void *zreg, char *str, char *data);
6466 
6467 #if defined(STB_DEFINE) && !defined(STB_NO_REGISTRY)
6468 
6469 #define STB_HAS_REGISTRY
6470 
6471 #ifndef _WINDOWS_
6472 
6473 #define HKEY void *
6474 
6475 STB_EXTERN __declspec(dllimport) long __stdcall RegCloseKey ( HKEY hKey );
6476 STB_EXTERN __declspec(dllimport) long __stdcall RegCreateKeyExA ( HKEY hKey, const char * lpSubKey,
6477  int Reserved, char * lpClass, int dwOptions,
6478  int samDesired, void *lpSecurityAttributes, HKEY * phkResult, int * lpdwDisposition );
6479 STB_EXTERN __declspec(dllimport) long __stdcall RegDeleteKeyA ( HKEY hKey, const char * lpSubKey );
6480 STB_EXTERN __declspec(dllimport) long __stdcall RegQueryValueExA ( HKEY hKey, const char * lpValueName,
6481  int * lpReserved, unsigned long * lpType, unsigned char * lpData, unsigned long * lpcbData );
6482 STB_EXTERN __declspec(dllimport) long __stdcall RegSetValueExA ( HKEY hKey, const char * lpValueName,
6483  int Reserved, int dwType, const unsigned char* lpData, int cbData );
6484 STB_EXTERN __declspec(dllimport) long __stdcall RegOpenKeyExA ( HKEY hKey, const char * lpSubKey,
6485  int ulOptions, int samDesired, HKEY * phkResult );
6486 
6487 #endif // _WINDOWS_
6488 
6489 #define STB__REG_OPTION_NON_VOLATILE 0
6490 #define STB__REG_KEY_ALL_ACCESS 0x000f003f
6491 #define STB__REG_KEY_READ 0x00020019
6492 
6493 void *stb_reg_open(char *mode, char *where)
6494 {
6495  long res;
6496  HKEY base;
6497  HKEY zreg;
6498  if (!stb_stricmp(mode+1, "cu") || !stb_stricmp(mode+1, "hkcu"))
6499  base = (HKEY) 0x80000001; // HKCU
6500  else if (!stb_stricmp(mode+1, "lm") || !stb_stricmp(mode+1, "hklm"))
6501  base = (HKEY) 0x80000002; // HKLM
6502  else
6503  return NULL;
6504 
6505  if (mode[0] == 'r')
6506  res = RegOpenKeyExA(base, where, 0, STB__REG_KEY_READ, &zreg);
6507  else if (mode[0] == 'w')
6508  res = RegCreateKeyExA(base, where, 0, NULL, STB__REG_OPTION_NON_VOLATILE, STB__REG_KEY_ALL_ACCESS, NULL, &zreg, NULL);
6509  else
6510  return NULL;
6511 
6512  return res ? NULL : zreg;
6513 }
6514 
6515 void stb_reg_close(void *reg)
6516 {
6517  RegCloseKey((HKEY) reg);
6518 }
6519 
6520 #define STB__REG_SZ 1
6521 #define STB__REG_BINARY 3
6522 #define STB__REG_DWORD 4
6523 
6524 int stb_reg_read(void *zreg, char *str, void *data, unsigned long len)
6525 {
6526  unsigned long type;
6527  unsigned long alen = len;
6528  if (0 == RegQueryValueExA((HKEY) zreg, str, 0, &type, (unsigned char *) data, &len))
6529  if (type == STB__REG_BINARY || type == STB__REG_SZ || type == STB__REG_DWORD) {
6530  if (len < alen)
6531  *((char *) data + len) = 0;
6532  return 1;
6533  }
6534  return 0;
6535 }
6536 
6537 void stb_reg_write(void *zreg, char *str, void *data, unsigned long len)
6538 {
6539  if (zreg)
6540  RegSetValueExA((HKEY) zreg, str, 0, STB__REG_BINARY, (const unsigned char *) data, len);
6541 }
6542 
6543 int stb_reg_read_string(void *zreg, char *str, char *data, int len)
6544 {
6545  if (!stb_reg_read(zreg, str, data, len)) return 0;
6546  data[len-1] = 0; // force a 0 at the end of the string no matter what
6547  return 1;
6548 }
6549 
6550 void stb_reg_write_string(void *zreg, char *str, char *data)
6551 {
6552  if (zreg)
6553  RegSetValueExA((HKEY) zreg, str, 0, STB__REG_SZ, (const unsigned char *) data, strlen(data)+1);
6554 }
6555 #endif // STB_DEFINE
6556 #endif // _WIN32
6557 
6558 
6560 //
6561 // stb_cfg - This is like the registry, but the config info
6562 // is all stored in plain old files where we can
6563 // backup and restore them easily. The LOCATION of
6564 // the config files is gotten from... the registry!
6565 
6566 #ifndef STB_NO_STB_STRINGS
6567 typedef struct stb_cfg_st stb_cfg;
6568 
6569 STB_EXTERN stb_cfg * stb_cfg_open(char *config, char *mode); // mode = "r", "w"
6570 STB_EXTERN void stb_cfg_close(stb_cfg *cfg);
6571 STB_EXTERN int stb_cfg_read(stb_cfg *cfg, char *key, void *value, int len);
6572 STB_EXTERN void stb_cfg_write(stb_cfg *cfg, char *key, void *value, int len);
6573 STB_EXTERN int stb_cfg_read_string(stb_cfg *cfg, char *key, char *value, int len);
6574 STB_EXTERN void stb_cfg_write_string(stb_cfg *cfg, char *key, char *value);
6575 STB_EXTERN int stb_cfg_delete(stb_cfg *cfg, char *key);
6576 STB_EXTERN void stb_cfg_set_directory(char *dir);
6577 
6578 #ifdef STB_DEFINE
6579 
6580 typedef struct
6581 {
6582  char *key;
6583  void *value;
6584  int value_len;
6585 } stb__cfg_item;
6586 
6587 struct stb_cfg_st
6588 {
6589  stb__cfg_item *data;
6590  char *loaded_file; // this needs to be freed
6591  FILE *f; // write the data to this file on close
6592 };
6593 
6594 static char *stb__cfg_sig = "sTbCoNfIg!\0\0";
6595 static char stb__cfg_dir[512];
6596 STB_EXTERN void stb_cfg_set_directory(char *dir)
6597 {
6598  strcpy(stb__cfg_dir, dir);
6599 }
6600 
6601 STB_EXTERN stb_cfg * stb_cfg_open(char *config, char *mode)
6602 {
6603  size_t len;
6604  stb_cfg *z;
6605  char file[512];
6606  if (mode[0] != 'r' && mode[0] != 'w') return NULL;
6607 
6608  if (!stb__cfg_dir[0]) {
6609  #ifdef _WIN32
6610  strcpy(stb__cfg_dir, "c:/stb");
6611  #else
6612  strcpy(stb__cfg_dir, "~/.stbconfig");
6613  #endif
6614 
6615  #ifdef STB_HAS_REGISTRY
6616  {
6617  void *reg = stb_reg_open("rHKLM", "Software\\SilverSpaceship\\stb");
6618  if (reg) {
6619  stb_reg_read_string(reg, "config_dir", stb__cfg_dir, sizeof(stb__cfg_dir));
6620  stb_reg_close(reg);
6621  }
6622  }
6623  #endif
6624  }
6625 
6626  sprintf(file, "%s/%s.cfg", stb__cfg_dir, config);
6627 
6628  z = (stb_cfg *) stb_malloc(0, sizeof(*z));
6629  z->data = NULL;
6630 
6631  z->loaded_file = stb_filec(file, &len);
6632  if (z->loaded_file) {
6633  char *s = z->loaded_file;
6634  if (!memcmp(s, stb__cfg_sig, 12)) {
6635  char *s = z->loaded_file + 12;
6636  while (s < z->loaded_file + len) {
6637  stb__cfg_item a;
6638  int n = *(stb_int16 *) s;
6639  a.key = s+2;
6640  s = s+2 + n;
6641  a.value_len = *(int *) s;
6642  s += 4;
6643  a.value = s;
6644  s += a.value_len;
6645  stb_arr_push(z->data, a);
6646  }
6647  assert(s == z->loaded_file + len);
6648  }
6649  }
6650 
6651  if (mode[0] == 'w')
6652  z->f = fopen(file, "wb");
6653  else
6654  z->f = NULL;
6655 
6656  return z;
6657 }
6658 
6659 void stb_cfg_close(stb_cfg *z)
6660 {
6661  if (z->f) {
6662  int i;
6663  // write the file out
6664  fwrite(stb__cfg_sig, 12, 1, z->f);
6665  for (i=0; i < stb_arr_len(z->data); ++i) {
6666  stb_int16 n = strlen(z->data[i].key)+1;
6667  fwrite(&n, 2, 1, z->f);
6668  fwrite(z->data[i].key, n, 1, z->f);
6669  fwrite(&z->data[i].value_len, 4, 1, z->f);
6670  fwrite(z->data[i].value, z->data[i].value_len, 1, z->f);
6671  }
6672  fclose(z->f);
6673  }
6674  stb_arr_free(z->data);
6675  stb_free(z);
6676 }
6677 
6678 int stb_cfg_read(stb_cfg *z, char *key, void *value, int len)
6679 {
6680  int i;
6681  for (i=0; i < stb_arr_len(z->data); ++i) {
6682  if (!stb_stricmp(z->data[i].key, key)) {
6683  int n = stb_min(len, z->data[i].value_len);
6684  memcpy(value, z->data[i].value, n);
6685  if (n < len)
6686  *((char *) value + n) = 0;
6687  return 1;
6688  }
6689  }
6690  return 0;
6691 }
6692 
6693 void stb_cfg_write(stb_cfg *z, char *key, void *value, int len)
6694 {
6695  int i;
6696  for (i=0; i < stb_arr_len(z->data); ++i)
6697  if (!stb_stricmp(z->data[i].key, key))
6698  break;
6699  if (i == stb_arr_len(z->data)) {
6700  stb__cfg_item p;
6701  p.key = stb__strdup(key, z);
6702  p.value = NULL;
6703  p.value_len = 0;
6704  stb_arr_push(z->data, p);
6705  }
6706  z->data[i].value = stb_malloc(z, len);
6707  z->data[i].value_len = len;
6708  memcpy(z->data[i].value, value, len);
6709 }
6710 
6711 int stb_cfg_delete(stb_cfg *z, char *key)
6712 {
6713  int i;
6714  for (i=0; i < stb_arr_len(z->data); ++i)
6715  if (!stb_stricmp(z->data[i].key, key)) {
6716  stb_arr_fastdelete(z->data, i);
6717  return 1;
6718  }
6719  return 0;
6720 }
6721 
6722 int stb_cfg_read_string(stb_cfg *z, char *key, char *value, int len)
6723 {
6724  if (!stb_cfg_read(z, key, value, len)) return 0;
6725  value[len-1] = 0;
6726  return 1;
6727 }
6728 
6729 void stb_cfg_write_string(stb_cfg *z, char *key, char *value)
6730 {
6731  stb_cfg_write(z, key, value, strlen(value)+1);
6732 }
6733 #endif
6734 
6736 //
6737 // stb_dirtree - load a description of a directory tree
6738 // uses a cache and stat()s the directories for changes
6739 // MUCH faster on NTFS, _wrong_ on FAT32, so should
6740 // ignore the db on FAT32
6741 
6742 #ifdef _WIN32
6743 
6744 typedef struct
6745 {
6746  char * path; // full path from passed-in root
6747  time_t last_modified;
6748  int num_files;
6749 } stb_dirtree_dir;
6750 
6751 typedef struct
6752 {
6753  char *name; // name relative to path
6754  int dir; // index into dirs[] array
6755  unsigned long size; // size, max 4GB
6756  time_t last_modified;
6757 } stb_dirtree_file;
6758 
6759 typedef struct
6760 {
6761  stb_dirtree_dir *dirs;
6762  stb_dirtree_file *files;
6763 
6764  // internal use
6765  void * string_pool; // used to free data en masse
6766 } stb_dirtree;
6767 
6768 extern void stb_dirtree_free ( stb_dirtree *d );
6769 extern stb_dirtree *stb_dirtree_get ( char *dir);
6770 extern stb_dirtree *stb_dirtree_get_dir ( char *dir, char *cache_dir);
6771 extern stb_dirtree *stb_dirtree_get_with_file ( char *dir, char *cache_file);
6772 
6773 // get a list of all the files recursively underneath 'dir'
6774 //
6775 // cache_file is used to store a copy of the directory tree to speed up
6776 // later calls. It must be unique to 'dir' and the current working
6777 // directory! Otherwise who knows what will happen (a good solution
6778 // is to put it _in_ dir, but this API doesn't force that).
6779 //
6780 // Also, it might be possible to break this if you have two different processes
6781 // do a call to stb_dirtree_get() with the same cache file at about the same
6782 // time, but I _think_ it might just work.
6783 
6784 
6785 #ifdef STB_DEFINE
6786 static void stb__dirtree_add_dir(char *path, time_t last, stb_dirtree *active)
6787 {
6788  stb_dirtree_dir d;
6789  d.last_modified = last;
6790  d.num_files = 0;
6791  d.path = stb__strdup(path, active->string_pool);
6792  stb_arr_push(active->dirs, d);
6793 }
6794 
6795 static void stb__dirtree_add_file(char *name, int dir, unsigned long size, time_t last, stb_dirtree *active)
6796 {
6797  stb_dirtree_file f;
6798  f.dir = dir;
6799  f.size = size;
6800  f.last_modified = last;
6801  f.name = stb__strdup(name, active->string_pool);
6802  ++active->dirs[dir].num_files;
6803  stb_arr_push(active->files, f);
6804 }
6805 
6806 static char stb__signature[12] = { 's', 'T', 'b', 'D', 'i', 'R', 't', 'R', 'e', 'E', '0', '1' };
6807 
6808 static void stb__dirtree_save_db(char *filename, stb_dirtree *data, char *root)
6809 {
6810  int i, num_dirs_final=0, num_files_final;
6811  int *remap;
6812  FILE *f = fopen(filename, "wb");
6813  if (!f) return;
6814 
6815  fwrite(stb__signature, sizeof(stb__signature), 1, f);
6816  fwrite(root, strlen(root)+1, 1, f);
6817  // need to be slightly tricky and not write out NULLed directories, nor the root
6818 
6819  // build remapping table of all dirs we'll be writing out
6820  remap = (int *) malloc(sizeof(remap[0]) * stb_arr_len(data->dirs));
6821  for (i=0; i < stb_arr_len(data->dirs); ++i) {
6822  if (data->dirs[i].path == NULL || 0==stb_stricmp(data->dirs[i].path, root)) {
6823  remap[i] = -1;
6824  } else {
6825  remap[i] = num_dirs_final++;
6826  }
6827  }
6828 
6829  fwrite(&num_dirs_final, 4, 1, f);
6830  for (i=0; i < stb_arr_len(data->dirs); ++i) {
6831  if (remap[i] >= 0) {
6832  fwrite(&data->dirs[i].last_modified, 4, 1, f);
6833  stb_fput_string(f, data->dirs[i].path);
6834  }
6835  }
6836 
6837  num_files_final = 0;
6838  for (i=0; i < stb_arr_len(data->files); ++i)
6839  if (remap[data->files[i].dir] >= 0)
6840  ++num_files_final;
6841 
6842  fwrite(&num_files_final, 4, 1, f);
6843  for (i=0; i < stb_arr_len(data->files); ++i) {
6844  if (remap[data->files[i].dir] >= 0) {
6845  stb_fput_ranged(f, remap[data->files[i].dir], 0, num_dirs_final);
6846  stb_fput_varlenu(f, data->files[i].size);
6847  fwrite(&data->files[i].last_modified, 4, 1, f);
6848  stb_fput_string(f, data->files[i].name);
6849  }
6850  }
6851 
6852  fclose(f);
6853 }
6854 
6855 // note: stomps any existing data, rather than appending
6856 static void stb__dirtree_load_db(char *filename, stb_dirtree *data, char *dir)
6857 {
6858  char sig[2048];
6859  int i,n;
6860  FILE *f = fopen(filename, "rb");
6861 
6862  if (!f) return;
6863 
6864  data->string_pool = stb_malloc(0,1);
6865 
6866  fread(sig, sizeof(stb__signature), 1, f);
6867  if (memcmp(stb__signature, sig, sizeof(stb__signature))) { fclose(f); return; }
6868  if (!fread(sig, strlen(dir)+1, 1, f)) { fclose(f); return; }
6869  if (stb_stricmp(sig,dir)) { fclose(f); return; }
6870 
6871  // we can just read them straight in, because they're guaranteed to be valid
6872  fread(&n, 4, 1, f);
6873  stb_arr_setlen(data->dirs, n);
6874  for(i=0; i < stb_arr_len(data->dirs); ++i) {
6875  fread(&data->dirs[i].last_modified, 4, 1, f);
6876  data->dirs[i].path = stb_fget_string(f, data->string_pool);
6877  if (data->dirs[i].path == NULL) goto bail;
6878  }
6879  fread(&n, 4, 1, f);
6880  stb_arr_setlen(data->files, n);
6881  for (i=0; i < stb_arr_len(data->files); ++i) {
6882  data->files[i].dir = stb_fget_ranged(f, 0, stb_arr_len(data->dirs));
6883  data->files[i].size = stb_fget_varlenu(f);
6884  fread(&data->files[i].last_modified, 4, 1, f);
6885  data->files[i].name = stb_fget_string(f, data->string_pool);
6886  if (data->files[i].name == NULL) goto bail;
6887  }
6888 
6889  if (0) {
6890  bail:
6891  stb_arr_free(data->dirs);
6892  stb_arr_free(data->files);
6893  }
6894  fclose(f);
6895 }
6896 
6897 static void stb__dirtree_scandir(char *path, time_t last_time, stb_dirtree *active)
6898 {
6899  // this is dumb depth first; theoretically it might be faster
6900  // to fully traverse each directory before visiting its children,
6901  // but it's complicated and didn't seem like a gain in the test app
6902 
6903  int n;
6904 
6905  struct _wfinddata_t c_file;
6906  #ifdef STB_PTR64
6907  intptr_t hFile;
6908  #else
6909  long hFile;
6910  #endif
6911  stb__wchar full_path[1024];
6912  int has_slash;
6913 
6914  has_slash = (path[0] && path[strlen(path)-1] == '/');
6915  if (has_slash)
6916  swprintf((wchar_t *)full_path, L"%s*", stb__from_utf8(path));
6917  else
6918  swprintf((wchar_t *)full_path, L"%s/*", stb__from_utf8(path));
6919 
6920  // it's possible this directory is already present: that means it was in the
6921  // cache, but its parent wasn't... in that case, we're done with it
6922  for (n=0; n < stb_arr_len(active->dirs); ++n)
6923  if (0 == stb_stricmp(active->dirs[n].path, path))
6924  return;
6925 
6926  // otherwise, we need to add it
6927  stb__dirtree_add_dir(path, last_time, active);
6928  n = stb_arr_lastn(active->dirs);
6929 
6930  if( (hFile = _wfindfirst((const wchar_t *)full_path, &c_file )) != -1L ) {
6931  do {
6932  if (c_file.attrib & _A_SUBDIR) {
6933  // ignore subdirectories starting with '.', e.g. "." and ".."
6934  if (c_file.name[0] != '.') {
6935  char *new_path = (char *) full_path;
6936  char *temp = stb__to_utf8((stb__wchar *)c_file.name);
6937  if (has_slash)
6938  sprintf(new_path, "%s%s", path, temp);
6939  else
6940  sprintf(new_path, "%s/%s", path, temp);
6941  stb__dirtree_scandir(new_path, c_file.time_write, active);
6942  }
6943  } else {
6944  char *temp = stb__to_utf8((stb__wchar *)c_file.name);
6945  stb__dirtree_add_file(temp, n, c_file.size, c_file.time_write, active);
6946  }
6947  } while( _wfindnext( hFile, &c_file ) == 0 );
6948 
6949  _findclose( hFile );
6950  }
6951 }
6952 
6953 // scan the database and see if it's all valid
6954 static int stb__dirtree_update_db(stb_dirtree *db, stb_dirtree *active)
6955 {
6956  int changes_detected = STB_FALSE;
6957  int i;
6958  int *remap;
6959  int *rescan=NULL;
6960  remap = (int *) malloc(sizeof(remap[0]) * stb_arr_len(db->dirs));
6961  memset(remap, 0, sizeof(remap[0]) * stb_arr_len(db->dirs));
6962  rescan = NULL;
6963 
6964  for (i=0; i < stb_arr_len(db->dirs); ++i) {
6965  struct _stat info;
6966  if (0 == _stat(db->dirs[i].path, &info)) {
6967  if (info.st_mode & _S_IFDIR) {
6968  // it's still a directory, as expected
6969  if (info.st_mtime > db->dirs[i].last_modified) {
6970  // it's changed! force a rescan
6971  // we don't want to scan it until we've stat()d its
6972  // subdirs, though, so we queue it
6973  stb_arr_push(rescan, i);
6974  // update the last_mod time
6975  db->dirs[i].last_modified = info.st_mtime;
6976  // ignore existing files in this dir
6977  remap[i] = -1;
6978  changes_detected = STB_TRUE;
6979  } else {
6980  // it hasn't changed, just copy it through unchanged
6981  stb__dirtree_add_dir(db->dirs[i].path, db->dirs[i].last_modified, active);
6982  remap[i] = stb_arr_lastn(active->dirs);
6983  }
6984  } else {
6985  // this path used to refer to a directory, but now it's a file!
6986  // assume that the parent directory is going to be forced to rescan anyway
6987  goto delete_entry;
6988  }
6989  } else {
6990  delete_entry:
6991  // directory no longer exists, so don't copy it
6992  // we don't free it because it's in the string pool now
6993  db->dirs[i].path = NULL;
6994  remap[i] = -1;
6995  changes_detected = STB_TRUE;
6996  }
6997  }
6998 
6999  // at this point, we have:
7000  //
7001  // <rescan> holds a list of directory indices that need to be scanned due to being out of date
7002  // <remap> holds the directory index in <active> for each dir in <db>, if it exists; -1 if not
7003  // directories in <rescan> are not in <active> yet
7004 
7005  // so we can go ahead and remap all the known files right now
7006  for (i=0; i < stb_arr_len(db->files); ++i) {
7007  int dir = db->files[i].dir;
7008  if (remap[dir] >= 0) {
7009  stb__dirtree_add_file(db->files[i].name, remap[dir], db->files[i].size, db->files[i].last_modified, active);
7010  }
7011  }
7012 
7013  // at this point we're done with db->files, and done with remap
7014  free(remap);
7015 
7016  // now scan those directories using the standard scan
7017  for (i=0; i < stb_arr_len(rescan); ++i) {
7018  int z = rescan[i];
7019  stb__dirtree_scandir(db->dirs[z].path, db->dirs[z].last_modified, active);
7020  }
7021  stb_arr_free(rescan);
7022 
7023  return changes_detected;
7024 }
7025 
7026 static void stb__dirtree_free_raw(stb_dirtree *d)
7027 {
7028  stb_free(d->string_pool);
7029  stb_arr_free(d->dirs);
7030  stb_arr_free(d->files);
7031 }
7032 
7033 stb_dirtree *stb_dirtree_get_with_file(char *dir, char *cache_file)
7034 {
7035  stb_dirtree *output = (stb_dirtree *) malloc(sizeof(*output));
7036  stb_dirtree db,active;
7037  int prev_dir_count, cache_mismatch;
7038 
7039  char *stripped_dir; // store the directory name without a trailing '/' or '\\'
7040 
7041  // load the database of last-known state on disk
7042  db.string_pool = NULL;
7043  db.files = NULL;
7044  db.dirs = NULL;
7045 
7046  stripped_dir = stb_strip_final_slash(_strdup(dir));
7047 
7048  if (cache_file != NULL)
7049  stb__dirtree_load_db(cache_file, &db, stripped_dir);
7050 
7051  active.files = NULL;
7052  active.dirs = NULL;
7053  active.string_pool = stb_malloc(0,1); // @TODO: share string pools between both?
7054 
7055  // check all the directories in the database; make note if
7056  // anything we scanned had changed, and rescan those things
7057  cache_mismatch = stb__dirtree_update_db(&db, &active);
7058 
7059  // check the root tree
7060  prev_dir_count = stb_arr_len(active.dirs); // record how many directories we've seen
7061 
7062  stb__dirtree_scandir(stripped_dir, 0, &active); // no last_modified time available for root
7063 
7064  // done with the DB; write it back out if any changes, i.e. either
7065  // 1. any inconsistency found between cached information and actual disk
7066  // or 2. if scanning the root found any new directories--which we detect because
7067  // more than one directory got added to the active db during that scan
7068  if (cache_mismatch || stb_arr_len(active.dirs) > prev_dir_count+1)
7069  stb__dirtree_save_db(cache_file, &active, stripped_dir);
7070 
7071  free(stripped_dir);
7072 
7073  stb__dirtree_free_raw(&db);
7074 
7075  *output = active;
7076  return output;
7077 }
7078 
7079 stb_dirtree *stb_dirtree_get_dir(char *dir, char *cache_dir)
7080 {
7081  int i;
7082  stb_uint8 sha[20];
7083  char dir_lower[1024];
7084  char cache_file[1024],*s;
7085  if (cache_dir == NULL)
7086  return stb_dirtree_get_with_file(dir, NULL);
7087  strcpy(dir_lower, dir);
7088  stb_tolower(dir_lower);
7089  stb_sha1(sha, (unsigned char *) dir_lower, strlen(dir_lower));
7090  strcpy(cache_file, cache_dir);
7091  s = cache_file + strlen(cache_file);
7092  if (s[-1] != '/' && s[-1] != '\\') *s++ = '/';
7093  strcpy(s, "dirtree_");
7094  s += strlen(s);
7095  for (i=0; i < 8; ++i) {
7096  char *hex = "0123456789abcdef";
7097  stb_uint z = sha[i];
7098  *s++ = hex[z >> 4];
7099  *s++ = hex[z & 15];
7100  }
7101  strcpy(s, ".bin");
7102  return stb_dirtree_get_with_file(dir, cache_file);
7103 }
7104 
7105 stb_dirtree *stb_dirtree_get(char *dir)
7106 {
7107  char cache_dir[256];
7108  strcpy(cache_dir, "c:/stb");
7109  #ifdef STB_HAS_REGISTRY
7110  {
7111  void *reg = stb_reg_open("rHKLM", "Software\\SilverSpaceship\\stb");
7112  if (reg) {
7113  stb_reg_read(reg, "dirtree", cache_dir, sizeof(cache_dir));
7114  stb_reg_close(reg);
7115  }
7116  }
7117  #endif
7118  return stb_dirtree_get_dir(dir, cache_dir);
7119 }
7120 
7121 void stb_dirtree_free(stb_dirtree *d)
7122 {
7123  stb__dirtree_free_raw(d);
7124  free(d);
7125 }
7126 #endif // STB_DEFINE
7127 
7128 #endif // _WIN32
7129 #endif // STB_NO_STB_STRINGS
7130 
7132 //
7133 // STB_MALLOC_WRAPPER
7134 //
7135 // you can use the wrapper functions with your own malloc wrapper,
7136 // or define STB_MALLOC_WRAPPER project-wide to have
7137 // malloc/free/realloc/_strdup all get vectored to it
7138 
7139 // this has too many very specific error messages you could google for and find in stb.h,
7140 // so don't use it if they don't want any stb.h-identifiable strings
7141 #if defined(STB_DEFINE) && !defined(STB_NO_STB_STRINGS)
7142 
7143 typedef struct
7144 {
7145  void *p;
7146  char *file;
7147  int line;
7148  int size;
7149 } stb_malloc_record;
7150 
7151 #ifndef STB_MALLOC_HISTORY_COUNT
7152 #define STB_MALLOC_HISTORY_COUNT 50 // 800 bytes
7153 #endif
7154 
7155 stb_malloc_record *stb__allocations;
7156 static int stb__alloc_size, stb__alloc_limit, stb__alloc_mask;
7157 int stb__alloc_count;
7158 
7159 stb_malloc_record stb__alloc_history[STB_MALLOC_HISTORY_COUNT];
7160 int stb__history_pos;
7161 
7162 static int stb__hashfind(void *p)
7163 {
7164  stb_uint32 h = stb_hashptr(p);
7165  int s,n = h & stb__alloc_mask;
7166  if (stb__allocations[n].p == p)
7167  return n;
7168  s = stb_rehash(h)|1;
7169  for(;;) {
7170  if (stb__allocations[n].p == NULL)
7171  return -1;
7172  n = (n+s) & stb__alloc_mask;
7173  if (stb__allocations[n].p == p)
7174  return n;
7175  }
7176 }
7177 
7178 int stb_wrapper_allocsize(void *p)
7179 {
7180  int n = stb__hashfind(p);
7181  if (n < 0) return 0;
7182  return stb__allocations[n].size;
7183 }
7184 
7185 static int stb__historyfind(void *p)
7186 {
7187  int n = stb__history_pos;
7188  int i;
7189  for (i=0; i < STB_MALLOC_HISTORY_COUNT; ++i) {
7190  if (--n < 0) n = STB_MALLOC_HISTORY_COUNT-1;
7191  if (stb__alloc_history[n].p == p)
7192  return n;
7193  }
7194  return -1;
7195 }
7196 
7197 static void stb__add_alloc(void *p, int sz, char *file, int line);
7198 static void stb__grow_alloc(void)
7199 {
7200  int i,old_num = stb__alloc_size;
7201  stb_malloc_record *old = stb__allocations;
7202  if (stb__alloc_size == 0)
7203  stb__alloc_size = 64;
7204  else
7205  stb__alloc_size *= 2;
7206 
7207  stb__allocations = (stb_malloc_record *) stb__realloc_raw(NULL, stb__alloc_size * sizeof(stb__allocations[0]));
7208  if (stb__allocations == NULL)
7209  stb_fatal("Internal error: couldn't grow malloc wrapper table");
7210  memset(stb__allocations, 0, stb__alloc_size * sizeof(stb__allocations[0]));
7211  stb__alloc_limit = (stb__alloc_size*3)>>2;
7212  stb__alloc_mask = stb__alloc_size-1;
7213 
7214  stb__alloc_count = 0;
7215 
7216  for (i=0; i < old_num; ++i)
7217  if (old[i].p > STB_DEL) {
7218  stb__add_alloc(old[i].p, old[i].size, old[i].file, old[i].line);
7219  assert(stb__hashfind(old[i].p) >= 0);
7220  }
7221  for (i=0; i < old_num; ++i)
7222  if (old[i].p > STB_DEL)
7223  assert(stb__hashfind(old[i].p) >= 0);
7224  stb__realloc_raw(old, 0);
7225 }
7226 
7227 static void stb__add_alloc(void *p, int sz, char *file, int line)
7228 {
7229  stb_uint32 h;
7230  int n;
7231  if (stb__alloc_count >= stb__alloc_limit)
7232  stb__grow_alloc();
7233  h = stb_hashptr(p);
7234  n = h & stb__alloc_mask;
7235  if (stb__allocations[n].p > STB_DEL) {
7236  int s = stb_rehash(h)|1;
7237  do {
7238  n = (n+s) & stb__alloc_mask;
7239  } while (stb__allocations[n].p > STB_DEL);
7240  }
7241  assert(stb__allocations[n].p == NULL || stb__allocations[n].p == STB_DEL);
7242  stb__allocations[n].p = p;
7243  stb__allocations[n].size = sz;
7244  stb__allocations[n].line = line;
7245  stb__allocations[n].file = file;
7246  ++stb__alloc_count;
7247 }
7248 
7249 static void stb__remove_alloc(int n, char *file, int line)
7250 {
7251  stb__alloc_history[stb__history_pos] = stb__allocations[n];
7252  stb__alloc_history[stb__history_pos].file = file;
7253  stb__alloc_history[stb__history_pos].line = line;
7254  if (++stb__history_pos == STB_MALLOC_HISTORY_COUNT)
7255  stb__history_pos = 0;
7256  stb__allocations[n].p = STB_DEL;
7257  --stb__alloc_count;
7258 }
7259 
7260 void stb_wrapper_malloc(void *p, int sz, char *file, int line)
7261 {
7262  if (!p) return;
7263  stb__add_alloc(p,sz,file,line);
7264 }
7265 
7266 void stb_wrapper_free(void *p, char *file, int line)
7267 {
7268  int n;
7269 
7270  if (p == NULL) return;
7271 
7272  n = stb__hashfind(p);
7273 
7274  if (n >= 0)
7275  stb__remove_alloc(n, file, line);
7276  else {
7277  // tried to free something we hadn't allocated!
7278  n = stb__historyfind(p);
7279  assert(0); /* NOTREACHED */
7280  if (n >= 0)
7281  stb_fatal("Attempted to free %d-byte block %p at %s:%d previously freed/realloced at %s:%d",
7282  stb__alloc_history[n].size, p,
7283  file, line,
7284  stb__alloc_history[n].file, stb__alloc_history[n].line);
7285  else
7286  stb_fatal("Attempted to free unknown block %p at %s:%d", p, file,line);
7287  }
7288 }
7289 
7290 void stb_wrapper_check(void *p)
7291 {
7292  int n;
7293 
7294  if (p == NULL) return;
7295 
7296  n = stb__hashfind(p);
7297 
7298  if (n >= 0) return;
7299 
7300  for (n=0; n < stb__alloc_size; ++n)
7301  if (stb__allocations[n].p == p)
7302  stb_fatal("Internal error: pointer %p was allocated, but hash search failed", p);
7303 
7304  // tried to free something that wasn't allocated!
7305  n = stb__historyfind(p);
7306  if (n >= 0)
7307  stb_fatal("Checked %d-byte block %p previously freed/realloced at %s:%d",
7308  stb__alloc_history[n].size, p,
7309  stb__alloc_history[n].file, stb__alloc_history[n].line);
7310  stb_fatal("Checked unknown block %p");
7311 }
7312 
7313 void stb_wrapper_realloc(void *p, void *q, int sz, char *file, int line)
7314 {
7315  int n;
7316  if (p == NULL) { stb_wrapper_malloc(q, sz, file, line); return; }
7317  if (q == NULL) return; // nothing happened
7318 
7319  n = stb__hashfind(p);
7320  if (n == -1) {
7321  // tried to free something we hadn't allocated!
7322  // this is weird, though, because we got past the realloc!
7323  n = stb__historyfind(p);
7324  assert(0); /* NOTREACHED */
7325  if (n >= 0)
7326  stb_fatal("Attempted to realloc %d-byte block %p at %s:%d previously freed/realloced at %s:%d",
7327  stb__alloc_history[n].size, p,
7328  file, line,
7329  stb__alloc_history[n].file, stb__alloc_history[n].line);
7330  else
7331  stb_fatal("Attempted to realloc unknown block %p at %s:%d", p, file,line);
7332  } else {
7333  if (q == p) {
7334  stb__allocations[n].size = sz;
7335  stb__allocations[n].file = file;
7336  stb__allocations[n].line = line;
7337  } else {
7338  stb__remove_alloc(n, file, line);
7339  stb__add_alloc(q,sz,file,line);
7340  }
7341  }
7342 }
7343 
7344 void stb_wrapper_listall(void (*func)(void *ptr, int sz, char *file, int line))
7345 {
7346  int i;
7347  for (i=0; i < stb__alloc_size; ++i)
7348  if (stb__allocations[i].p > STB_DEL)
7349  func(stb__allocations[i].p , stb__allocations[i].size,
7350  stb__allocations[i].file, stb__allocations[i].line);
7351 }
7352 
7353 void stb_wrapper_dump(char *filename)
7354 {
7355  int i;
7356  FILE *f = fopen(filename, "w");
7357  if (!f) return;
7358  for (i=0; i < stb__alloc_size; ++i)
7359  if (stb__allocations[i].p > STB_DEL)
7360  fprintf(f, "%p %7d - %4d %s\n",
7361  stb__allocations[i].p , stb__allocations[i].size,
7362  stb__allocations[i].line, stb__allocations[i].file);
7363 }
7364 #endif // STB_DEFINE
7365 
7366 
7368 //
7369 // stb_pointer_set
7370 //
7371 //
7372 // For data structures that support querying by key, data structure
7373 // classes always hand-wave away the issue of what to do if two entries
7374 // have the same key: basically, store a linked list of all the nodes
7375 // which have the same key (a LISP-style list).
7376 //
7377 // The thing is, it's not that trivial. If you have an O(log n)
7378 // lookup data structure, but then n/4 items have the same value,
7379 // you don't want to spend O(n) time scanning that list when
7380 // deleting an item if you already have a pointer to the item.
7381 // (You have to spend O(n) time enumerating all the items with
7382 // a given key, sure, and you can't accelerate deleting a particular
7383 // item if you only have the key, not a pointer to the item.)
7384 //
7385 // I'm going to call this data structure, whatever it turns out to
7386 // be, a "pointer set", because we don't store any associated data for
7387 // items in this data structure, we just answer the question of
7388 // whether an item is in it or not (it's effectively one bit per pointer).
7389 // Technically they don't have to be pointers; you could cast ints
7390 // to (void *) if you want, but you can't store 0 or 1 because of the
7391 // hash table.
7392 //
7393 // Since the fastest data structure we might want to add support for
7394 // identical-keys to is a hash table with O(1)-ish lookup time,
7395 // that means that the conceptual "linked list of all items with
7396 // the same indexed value" that we build needs to have the same
7397 // performance; that way when we index a table we think is arbitrary
7398 // ints, but in fact half of them are 0, we don't get screwed.
7399 //
7400 // Therefore, it needs to be a hash table, at least when it gets
7401 // large. On the other hand, when the data has totally arbitrary ints
7402 // or floats, there won't be many collisions, and we'll have tons of
7403 // 1-item bitmaps. That will be grossly inefficient as hash tables;
7404 // trade-off; the hash table is reasonably efficient per-item when
7405 // it's large, but not when it's small. So we need to do something
7406 // Judy-like and use different strategies depending on the size.
7407 //
7408 // Like Judy, we'll use the bottom bit to encode the strategy:
7409 //
7410 // bottom bits:
7411 // 00 - direct pointer
7412 // 01 - 4-item bucket (16 bytes, no length, NULLs)
7413 // 10 - N-item array
7414 // 11 - hash table
7415 
7416 typedef struct stb_ps stb_ps;
7417 
7418 STB_EXTERN int stb_ps_find (stb_ps *ps, void *value);
7419 STB_EXTERN stb_ps * stb_ps_add (stb_ps *ps, void *value);
7420 STB_EXTERN stb_ps * stb_ps_remove(stb_ps *ps, void *value);
7421 STB_EXTERN stb_ps * stb_ps_remove_any(stb_ps *ps, void **value);
7422 STB_EXTERN void stb_ps_delete(stb_ps *ps);
7423 STB_EXTERN int stb_ps_count (stb_ps *ps);
7424 
7425 STB_EXTERN stb_ps * stb_ps_copy (stb_ps *ps);
7426 STB_EXTERN int stb_ps_subset(stb_ps *bigger, stb_ps *smaller);
7427 STB_EXTERN int stb_ps_eq (stb_ps *p0, stb_ps *p1);
7428 
7429 STB_EXTERN void ** stb_ps_getlist (stb_ps *ps, int *count);
7430 STB_EXTERN int stb_ps_writelist(stb_ps *ps, void **list, int size );
7431 
7432 // enum and fastlist don't allocate storage, but you must consume the
7433 // list before there's any chance the data structure gets screwed up;
7434 STB_EXTERN int stb_ps_enum (stb_ps *ps, void *data,
7435  int (*func)(void *value, void*data) );
7436 STB_EXTERN void ** stb_ps_fastlist(stb_ps *ps, int *count);
7437 // result:
7438 // returns a list, *count is the length of that list,
7439 // but some entries of the list may be invalid;
7440 // test with 'stb_ps_fastlist_valid(x)'
7441 
7442 #define stb_ps_fastlist_valid(x) ((stb_uinta) (x) > 1)
7443 
7444 #ifdef STB_DEFINE
7445 
7446 enum
7447 {
7448  STB_ps_direct = 0,
7449  STB_ps_bucket = 1,
7450  STB_ps_array = 2,
7451  STB_ps_hash = 3,
7452 };
7453 
7454 #define STB_BUCKET_SIZE 4
7455 
7456 typedef struct
7457 {
7458  void *p[STB_BUCKET_SIZE];
7459 } stb_ps_bucket;
7460 #define GetBucket(p) ((stb_ps_bucket *) ((char *) (p) - STB_ps_bucket))
7461 #define EncodeBucket(p) ((stb_ps *) ((char *) (p) + STB_ps_bucket))
7462 
7463 static void stb_bucket_free(stb_ps_bucket *b)
7464 {
7465  free(b);
7466 }
7467 
7468 static stb_ps_bucket *stb_bucket_create2(void *v0, void *v1)
7469 {
7470  stb_ps_bucket *b = (stb_ps_bucket*) malloc(sizeof(*b));
7471  b->p[0] = v0;
7472  b->p[1] = v1;
7473  b->p[2] = NULL;
7474  b->p[3] = NULL;
7475  return b;
7476 }
7477 
7478 static stb_ps_bucket * stb_bucket_create3(void **v)
7479 {
7480  stb_ps_bucket *b = (stb_ps_bucket*) malloc(sizeof(*b));
7481  b->p[0] = v[0];
7482  b->p[1] = v[1];
7483  b->p[2] = v[2];
7484  b->p[3] = NULL;
7485  return b;
7486 }
7487 
7488 
7489 // could use stb_arr, but this will save us memory
7490 typedef struct
7491 {
7492  int count;
7493  void *p[1];
7494 } stb_ps_array;
7495 #define GetArray(p) ((stb_ps_array *) ((char *) (p) - STB_ps_array))
7496 #define EncodeArray(p) ((stb_ps *) ((char *) (p) + STB_ps_array))
7497 
7498 static int stb_ps_array_max = 13;
7499 
7500 typedef struct
7501 {
7502  int size, mask;
7503  int count, count_deletes;
7504  int grow_threshhold;
7505  int shrink_threshhold;
7506  int rehash_threshhold;
7507  int any_offset;
7508  void *table[1];
7509 } stb_ps_hash;
7510 #define GetHash(p) ((stb_ps_hash *) ((char *) (p) - STB_ps_hash))
7511 #define EncodeHash(p) ((stb_ps *) ((char *) (p) + STB_ps_hash))
7512 
7513 #define stb_ps_empty(v) (((stb_uint32) v) <= 1)
7514 
7515 static stb_ps_hash *stb_ps_makehash(int size, int old_size, void **old_data)
7516 {
7517  int i;
7518  stb_ps_hash *h = (stb_ps_hash *) malloc(sizeof(*h) + (size-1) * sizeof(h->table[0]));
7519  assert(stb_is_pow2(size));
7520  h->size = size;
7521  h->mask = size-1;
7522  h->shrink_threshhold = (int) (0.3f * size);
7523  h-> grow_threshhold = (int) (0.8f * size);
7524  h->rehash_threshhold = (int) (0.9f * size);
7525  h->count = 0;
7526  h->count_deletes = 0;
7527  h->any_offset = 0;
7528  memset(h->table, 0, size * sizeof(h->table[0]));
7529  for (i=0; i < old_size; ++i)
7530  if (!stb_ps_empty(old_data[i]))
7531  stb_ps_add(EncodeHash(h), old_data[i]);
7532  return h;
7533 }
7534 
7535 void stb_ps_delete(stb_ps *ps)
7536 {
7537  switch (3 & (int) ps) {
7538  case STB_ps_direct: break;
7539  case STB_ps_bucket: stb_bucket_free(GetBucket(ps)); break;
7540  case STB_ps_array : free(GetArray(ps)); break;
7541  case STB_ps_hash : free(GetHash(ps)); break;
7542  }
7543 }
7544 
7545 stb_ps *stb_ps_copy(stb_ps *ps)
7546 {
7547  int i;
7548  // not a switch: order based on expected performance/power-law distribution
7549  switch (3 & (int) ps) {
7550  case STB_ps_direct: return ps;
7551  case STB_ps_bucket: {
7552  stb_ps_bucket *n = (stb_ps_bucket *) malloc(sizeof(*n));
7553  *n = *GetBucket(ps);
7554  return EncodeBucket(n);
7555  }
7556  case STB_ps_array: {
7557  stb_ps_array *a = GetArray(ps);
7558  stb_ps_array *n = (stb_ps_array *) malloc(sizeof(*n) + stb_ps_array_max * sizeof(n->p[0]));
7559  n->count = a->count;
7560  for (i=0; i < a->count; ++i)
7561  n->p[i] = a->p[i];
7562  return EncodeArray(n);
7563  }
7564  case STB_ps_hash: {
7565  stb_ps_hash *h = GetHash(ps);
7566  stb_ps_hash *n = stb_ps_makehash(h->size, h->size, h->table);
7567  return EncodeHash(n);
7568  }
7569  }
7570  assert(0); /* NOTREACHED */
7571  return NULL;
7572 }
7573 
7574 int stb_ps_find(stb_ps *ps, void *value)
7575 {
7576  int i, code = 3 & (int) ps;
7577  assert((3 & (int) value) == STB_ps_direct);
7578  assert(stb_ps_fastlist_valid(value));
7579  // not a switch: order based on expected performance/power-law distribution
7580  if (code == STB_ps_direct)
7581  return value == ps;
7582  if (code == STB_ps_bucket) {
7583  stb_ps_bucket *b = GetBucket(ps);
7584  assert(STB_BUCKET_SIZE == 4);
7585  if (b->p[0] == value || b->p[1] == value ||
7586  b->p[2] == value || b->p[3] == value)
7587  return STB_TRUE;
7588  return STB_FALSE;
7589  }
7590  if (code == STB_ps_array) {
7591  stb_ps_array *a = GetArray(ps);
7592  for (i=0; i < a->count; ++i)
7593  if (a->p[i] == value)
7594  return STB_TRUE;
7595  return STB_FALSE;
7596  } else {
7597  stb_ps_hash *h = GetHash(ps);
7598  stb_uint32 hash = stb_hashptr(value);
7599  stb_uint32 s, n = hash & h->mask;
7600  void **t = h->table;
7601  if (t[n] == value) return STB_TRUE;
7602  if (t[n] == NULL) return STB_FALSE;
7603  s = stb_rehash(hash) | 1;
7604  do {
7605  n = (n + s) & h->mask;
7606  if (t[n] == value) return STB_TRUE;
7607  } while (t[n] != NULL);
7608  return STB_FALSE;
7609  }
7610 }
7611 
7612 stb_ps * stb_ps_add (stb_ps *ps, void *value)
7613 {
7614  #ifdef STB_DEBUG
7615  assert(!stb_ps_find(ps,value));
7616  #endif
7617  if (value == NULL) return ps; // ignore NULL adds to avoid bad breakage
7618  assert((3 & (int) value) == STB_ps_direct);
7619  assert(stb_ps_fastlist_valid(value));
7620  assert(value != STB_DEL); // STB_DEL is less likely
7621 
7622  switch (3 & (int) ps) {
7623  case STB_ps_direct:
7624  if (ps == NULL) return (stb_ps *) value;
7625  return EncodeBucket(stb_bucket_create2(ps,value));
7626 
7627  case STB_ps_bucket: {
7628  stb_ps_bucket *b = GetBucket(ps);
7629  stb_ps_array *a;
7630  assert(STB_BUCKET_SIZE == 4);
7631  if (b->p[0] == NULL) { b->p[0] = value; return ps; }
7632  if (b->p[1] == NULL) { b->p[1] = value; return ps; }
7633  if (b->p[2] == NULL) { b->p[2] = value; return ps; }
7634  if (b->p[3] == NULL) { b->p[3] = value; return ps; }
7635  a = (stb_ps_array *) malloc(sizeof(*a) + 7 * sizeof(a->p[0])); // 8 slots, must be 2^k
7636  memcpy(a->p, b, sizeof(*b));
7637  a->p[4] = value;
7638  a->count = 5;
7639  stb_bucket_free(b);
7640  return EncodeArray(a);
7641  }
7642 
7643  case STB_ps_array: {
7644  stb_ps_array *a = GetArray(ps);
7645  if (a->count == stb_ps_array_max) {
7646  // promote from array to hash
7647  stb_ps_hash *h = stb_ps_makehash(2 << stb_log2_ceil(a->count), a->count, a->p);
7648  free(a);
7649  return stb_ps_add(EncodeHash(h), value);
7650  }
7651  // do we need to resize the array? the array doubles in size when it
7652  // crosses a power-of-two
7653  if ((a->count & (a->count-1))==0) {
7654  int newsize = a->count*2;
7655  // clamp newsize to max if:
7656  // 1. it's larger than max
7657  // 2. newsize*1.5 is larger than max (to avoid extra resizing)
7658  if (newsize + a->count > stb_ps_array_max)
7659  newsize = stb_ps_array_max;
7660  a = (stb_ps_array *) realloc(a, sizeof(*a) + (newsize-1) * sizeof(a->p[0]));
7661  }
7662  a->p[a->count++] = value;
7663  return EncodeArray(a);
7664  }
7665  case STB_ps_hash: {
7666  stb_ps_hash *h = GetHash(ps);
7667  stb_uint32 hash = stb_hashptr(value);
7668  stb_uint32 n = hash & h->mask;
7669  void **t = h->table;
7670  // find first NULL or STB_DEL entry
7671  if (!stb_ps_empty(t[n])) {
7672  stb_uint32 s = stb_rehash(hash) | 1;
7673  do {
7674  n = (n + s) & h->mask;
7675  } while (!stb_ps_empty(t[n]));
7676  }
7677  if (t[n] == STB_DEL)
7678  -- h->count_deletes;
7679  t[n] = value;
7680  ++ h->count;
7681  if (h->count == h->grow_threshhold) {
7682  stb_ps_hash *h2 = stb_ps_makehash(h->size*2, h->size, t);
7683  free(h);
7684  return EncodeHash(h2);
7685  }
7686  if (h->count + h->count_deletes == h->rehash_threshhold) {
7687  stb_ps_hash *h2 = stb_ps_makehash(h->size, h->size, t);
7688  free(h);
7689  return EncodeHash(h2);
7690  }
7691  return ps;
7692  }
7693  }
7694  return NULL; /* NOTREACHED */
7695 }
7696 
7697 stb_ps *stb_ps_remove(stb_ps *ps, void *value)
7698 {
7699  #ifdef STB_DEBUG
7700  assert(stb_ps_find(ps, value));
7701  #endif
7702  assert((3 & (int) value) == STB_ps_direct);
7703  if (value == NULL) return ps; // ignore NULL removes to avoid bad breakage
7704  switch (3 & (int) ps) {
7705  case STB_ps_direct:
7706  return ps == value ? NULL : ps;
7707  case STB_ps_bucket: {
7708  stb_ps_bucket *b = GetBucket(ps);
7709  int count=0;
7710  assert(STB_BUCKET_SIZE == 4);
7711  if (b->p[0] == value) b->p[0] = NULL; else count += (b->p[0] != NULL);
7712  if (b->p[1] == value) b->p[1] = NULL; else count += (b->p[1] != NULL);
7713  if (b->p[2] == value) b->p[2] = NULL; else count += (b->p[2] != NULL);
7714  if (b->p[3] == value) b->p[3] = NULL; else count += (b->p[3] != NULL);
7715  if (count == 1) { // shrink bucket at size 1
7716  value = b->p[0];
7717  if (value == NULL) value = b->p[1];
7718  if (value == NULL) value = b->p[2];
7719  if (value == NULL) value = b->p[3];
7720  assert(value != NULL);
7721  stb_bucket_free(b);
7722  return (stb_ps *) value; // return STB_ps_direct of value
7723  }
7724  return ps;
7725  }
7726  case STB_ps_array: {
7727  stb_ps_array *a = GetArray(ps);
7728  int i;
7729  for (i=0; i < a->count; ++i) {
7730  if (a->p[i] == value) {
7731  a->p[i] = a->p[--a->count];
7732  if (a->count == 3) { // shrink to bucket!
7733  stb_ps_bucket *b = stb_bucket_create3(a->p);
7734  free(a);
7735  return EncodeBucket(b);
7736  }
7737  return ps;
7738  }
7739  }
7740  return ps;
7741  }
7742  case STB_ps_hash: {
7743  stb_ps_hash *h = GetHash(ps);
7744  stb_uint32 hash = stb_hashptr(value);
7745  stb_uint32 s, n = hash & h->mask;
7746  void **t = h->table;
7747  if (t[n] != value) {
7748  s = stb_rehash(hash) | 1;
7749  do {
7750  n = (n + s) & h->mask;
7751  } while (t[n] != value);
7752  }
7753  t[n] = STB_DEL;
7754  -- h->count;
7755  ++ h->count_deletes;
7756  // should we shrink down to an array?
7757  if (h->count < stb_ps_array_max) {
7758  int n = 1 << stb_log2_floor(stb_ps_array_max);
7759  if (h->count < n) {
7760  stb_ps_array *a = (stb_ps_array *) malloc(sizeof(*a) + (n-1) * sizeof(a->p[0]));
7761  int i,j=0;
7762  for (i=0; i < h->size; ++i)
7763  if (!stb_ps_empty(t[i]))
7764  a->p[j++] = t[i];
7765  assert(j == h->count);
7766  a->count = j;
7767  free(h);
7768  return EncodeArray(a);
7769  }
7770  }
7771  if (h->count == h->shrink_threshhold) {
7772  stb_ps_hash *h2 = stb_ps_makehash(h->size >> 1, h->size, t);
7773  free(h);
7774  return EncodeHash(h2);
7775  }
7776  return ps;
7777  }
7778  }
7779  return ps; /* NOTREACHED */
7780 }
7781 
7782 stb_ps *stb_ps_remove_any(stb_ps *ps, void **value)
7783 {
7784  assert(ps != NULL);
7785  switch (3 & (int) ps) {
7786  case STB_ps_direct:
7787  *value = ps;
7788  return NULL;
7789  case STB_ps_bucket: {
7790  stb_ps_bucket *b = GetBucket(ps);
7791  int count=0, slast=0, last=0;
7792  assert(STB_BUCKET_SIZE == 4);
7793  if (b->p[0]) { ++count; last = 0; }
7794  if (b->p[1]) { ++count; slast = last; last = 1; }
7795  if (b->p[2]) { ++count; slast = last; last = 2; }
7796  if (b->p[3]) { ++count; slast = last; last = 3; }
7797  *value = b->p[last];
7798  b->p[last] = 0;
7799  if (count == 2) {
7800  void *leftover = b->p[slast]; // second to last
7801  stb_bucket_free(b);
7802  return (stb_ps *) leftover;
7803  }
7804  return ps;
7805  }
7806  case STB_ps_array: {
7807  stb_ps_array *a = GetArray(ps);
7808  *value = a->p[a->count-1];
7809  if (a->count == 4)
7810  return stb_ps_remove(ps, *value);
7811  --a->count;
7812  return ps;
7813  }
7814  case STB_ps_hash: {
7815  stb_ps_hash *h = GetHash(ps);
7816  void **t = h->table;
7817  stb_uint32 n = h->any_offset;
7818  while (stb_ps_empty(t[n]))
7819  n = (n + 1) & h->mask;
7820  *value = t[n];
7821  h->any_offset = (n+1) & h->mask;
7822  // check if we need to skip down to the previous type
7823  if (h->count-1 < stb_ps_array_max || h->count-1 == h->shrink_threshhold)
7824  return stb_ps_remove(ps, *value);
7825  t[n] = STB_DEL;
7826  -- h->count;
7827  ++ h->count_deletes;
7828  return ps;
7829  }
7830  }
7831  return ps; /* NOTREACHED */
7832 }
7833 
7834 
7835 void ** stb_ps_getlist(stb_ps *ps, int *count)
7836 {
7837  int i,n=0;
7838  void **p = NULL;
7839  switch (3 & (int) ps) {
7840  case STB_ps_direct:
7841  if (ps == NULL) { *count = 0; return NULL; }
7842  p = (void **) malloc(sizeof(*p) * 1);
7843  p[0] = ps;
7844  *count = 1;
7845  return p;
7846  case STB_ps_bucket: {
7847  stb_ps_bucket *b = GetBucket(ps);
7848  p = (void **) malloc(sizeof(*p) * STB_BUCKET_SIZE);
7849  for (i=0; i < STB_BUCKET_SIZE; ++i)
7850  if (b->p[i] != NULL)
7851  p[n++] = b->p[i];
7852  break;
7853  }
7854  case STB_ps_array: {
7855  stb_ps_array *a = GetArray(ps);
7856  p = (void **) malloc(sizeof(*p) * a->count);
7857  memcpy(p, a->p, sizeof(*p) * a->count);
7858  *count = a->count;
7859  return p;
7860  }
7861  case STB_ps_hash: {
7862  stb_ps_hash *h = GetHash(ps);
7863  p = (void **) malloc(sizeof(*p) * h->count);
7864  for (i=0; i < h->size; ++i)
7865  if (!stb_ps_empty(h->table[i]))
7866  p[n++] = h->table[i];
7867  break;
7868  }
7869  }
7870  *count = n;
7871  return p;
7872 }
7873 
7874 int stb_ps_writelist(stb_ps *ps, void **list, int size )
7875 {
7876  int i,n=0;
7877  switch (3 & (int) ps) {
7878  case STB_ps_direct:
7879  if (ps == NULL || size <= 0) return 0;
7880  list[0] = ps;
7881  return 1;
7882  case STB_ps_bucket: {
7883  stb_ps_bucket *b = GetBucket(ps);
7884  for (i=0; i < STB_BUCKET_SIZE; ++i)
7885  if (b->p[i] != NULL && n < size)
7886  list[n++] = b->p[i];
7887  return n;
7888  }
7889  case STB_ps_array: {
7890  stb_ps_array *a = GetArray(ps);
7891  n = stb_min(size, a->count);
7892  memcpy(list, a->p, sizeof(*list) * n);
7893  return n;
7894  }
7895  case STB_ps_hash: {
7896  stb_ps_hash *h = GetHash(ps);
7897  if (size <= 0) return 0;
7898  for (i=0; i < h->count; ++i) {
7899  if (!stb_ps_empty(h->table[i])) {
7900  list[n++] = h->table[i];
7901  if (n == size) break;
7902  }
7903  }
7904  return n;
7905  }
7906  }
7907  return 0; /* NOTREACHED */
7908 }
7909 
7910 int stb_ps_enum(stb_ps *ps, void *data, int (*func)(void *value, void *data))
7911 {
7912  int i;
7913  switch (3 & (int) ps) {
7914  case STB_ps_direct:
7915  if (ps == NULL) return STB_TRUE;
7916  return func(ps, data);
7917  case STB_ps_bucket: {
7918  stb_ps_bucket *b = GetBucket(ps);
7919  for (i=0; i < STB_BUCKET_SIZE; ++i)
7920  if (b->p[i] != NULL)
7921  if (!func(b->p[i], data))
7922  return STB_FALSE;
7923  return STB_TRUE;
7924  }
7925  case STB_ps_array: {
7926  stb_ps_array *a = GetArray(ps);
7927  for (i=0; i < a->count; ++i)
7928  if (!func(a->p[i], data))
7929  return STB_FALSE;
7930  return STB_TRUE;
7931  }
7932  case STB_ps_hash: {
7933  stb_ps_hash *h = GetHash(ps);
7934  for (i=0; i < h->count; ++i)
7935  if (!stb_ps_empty(h->table[i]))
7936  if (!func(h->table[i], data))
7937  return STB_FALSE;
7938  return STB_TRUE;
7939  }
7940  }
7941  return STB_TRUE; /* NOTREACHED */
7942 }
7943 
7944 int stb_ps_count (stb_ps *ps)
7945 {
7946  switch (3 & (int) ps) {
7947  case STB_ps_direct:
7948  return ps != NULL;
7949  case STB_ps_bucket: {
7950  stb_ps_bucket *b = GetBucket(ps);
7951  return (b->p[0] != NULL) + (b->p[1] != NULL) +
7952  (b->p[2] != NULL) + (b->p[3] != NULL);
7953  }
7954  case STB_ps_array: {
7955  stb_ps_array *a = GetArray(ps);
7956  return a->count;
7957  }
7958  case STB_ps_hash: {
7959  stb_ps_hash *h = GetHash(ps);
7960  return h->count;
7961  }
7962  }
7963  return 0;
7964 }
7965 
7966 void ** stb_ps_fastlist(stb_ps *ps, int *count)
7967 {
7968  static void *storage;
7969 
7970  switch (3 & (int) ps) {
7971  case STB_ps_direct:
7972  if (ps == NULL) { *count = 0; return NULL; }
7973  storage = ps;
7974  *count = 1;
7975  return &storage;
7976  case STB_ps_bucket: {
7977  stb_ps_bucket *b = GetBucket(ps);
7978  *count = STB_BUCKET_SIZE;
7979  return b->p;
7980  }
7981  case STB_ps_array: {
7982  stb_ps_array *a = GetArray(ps);
7983  *count = a->count;
7984  return a->p;
7985  }
7986  case STB_ps_hash: {
7987  stb_ps_hash *h = GetHash(ps);
7988  *count = h->size;
7989  return h->table;
7990  }
7991  }
7992  return NULL; /* NOTREACHED */
7993 }
7994 
7995 int stb_ps_subset(stb_ps *bigger, stb_ps *smaller)
7996 {
7997  int i, listlen;
7998  void **list = stb_ps_fastlist(smaller, &listlen);
7999  for(i=0; i < listlen; ++i)
8000  if (stb_ps_fastlist_valid(list[i]))
8001  if (!stb_ps_find(bigger, list[i]))
8002  return 0;
8003  return 1;
8004 }
8005 
8006 int stb_ps_eq(stb_ps *p0, stb_ps *p1)
8007 {
8008  if (stb_ps_count(p0) != stb_ps_count(p1))
8009  return 0;
8010  return stb_ps_subset(p0, p1);
8011 }
8012 
8013 #undef GetBucket
8014 #undef GetArray
8015 #undef GetHash
8016 
8017 #undef EncodeBucket
8018 #undef EncodeArray
8019 #undef EncodeHash
8020 
8021 #endif
8022 
8023 
8025 //
8026 // Random Numbers via Meresenne Twister or LCG
8027 //
8028 
8029 STB_EXTERN unsigned long stb_srandLCG(unsigned long seed);
8030 STB_EXTERN unsigned long stb_randLCG(void);
8031 STB_EXTERN double stb_frandLCG(void);
8032
