10737 STB_EXTERN unsigned int stb_putdata(stbfile *f, void *buffer, unsigned int len); // write
10738 STB_EXTERN unsigned int stb_tell(stbfile *f); // read
10739 STB_EXTERN unsigned int stb_size(stbfile *f); // read/write
10740 STB_EXTERN void stb_backpatch(stbfile *f, unsigned int tell, void *buffer, unsigned int len); // write
10741 
10742 #ifdef STB_DEFINE
10743 
10744 unsigned int stb_getc(stbfile *f) { return f->getbyte(f); }
10745 int stb_putc(stbfile *f, int ch) { return f->putbyte(f, ch); }
10746 
10747 unsigned int stb_getdata(stbfile *f, void *buffer, unsigned int len)
10748 {
10749  return f->getdata(f, buffer, len);
10750 }
10751 unsigned int stb_putdata(stbfile *f, void *buffer, unsigned int len)
10752 {
10753  return f->putdata(f, buffer, len);
10754 }
10755 void stb_close(stbfile *f)
10756 {
10757  f->close(f);
10758  free(f);
10759 }
10760 unsigned int stb_tell(stbfile *f) { return f->tell(f); }
10761 unsigned int stb_size(stbfile *f) { return f->size(f); }
10762 void stb_backpatch(stbfile *f, unsigned int tell, void *buffer, unsigned int len)
10763 {
10764  f->backpatch(f,tell,buffer,len);
10765 }
10766 
10767 // FILE * implementation
10768 static int stb__fgetbyte(stbfile *f) { return fgetc(f->f); }
10769 static int stb__fputbyte(stbfile *f, int ch) { return fputc(ch, f->f)==0; }
10770 static unsigned int stb__fgetdata(stbfile *f, void *buffer, unsigned int len) { return fread(buffer,1,len,f->f); }
10771 static unsigned int stb__fputdata(stbfile *f, void *buffer, unsigned int len) { return fwrite(buffer,1,len,f->f); }
10772 static unsigned int stb__fsize(stbfile *f) { return stb_filelen(f->f); }
10773 static unsigned int stb__ftell(stbfile *f) { return ftell(f->f); }
10774 static void stb__fbackpatch(stbfile *f, unsigned int where, void *buffer, unsigned int len)
10775 {
10776  fseek(f->f, where, SEEK_SET);
10777  fwrite(buffer, 1, len, f->f);
10778  fseek(f->f, 0, SEEK_END);
10779 }
10780 static void stb__fclose(stbfile *f) { fclose(f->f); }
10781 
10782 stbfile *stb_openf(FILE *f)
10783 {
10784  stbfile m = { stb__fgetbyte, stb__fgetdata,
10785  stb__fputbyte, stb__fputdata,
10786  stb__fsize, stb__ftell, stb__fbackpatch, stb__fclose,
10787  0,0,0, };
10788  stbfile *z = (stbfile *) malloc(sizeof(*z));
10789  if (z) {
10790  *z = m;
10791  z->f = f;
10792  }
10793  return z;
10794 }
10795 
10796 static int stb__nogetbyte(stbfile *f) { assert(0); return -1; }
10797 static unsigned int stb__nogetdata(stbfile *f, void *buffer, unsigned int len) { assert(0); return 0; }
10798 static int stb__noputbyte(stbfile *f, int ch) { assert(0); return 0; }
10799 static unsigned int stb__noputdata(stbfile *f, void *buffer, unsigned int len) { assert(0); return 0; }
10800 static void stb__nobackpatch(stbfile *f, unsigned int where, void *buffer, unsigned int len) { assert(0); }
10801 
10802 static int stb__bgetbyte(stbfile *s)
10803 {
10804  if (s->indata < s->inend)
10805  return *s->indata++;
10806  else
10807  return -1;
10808 }
10809 
10810 static unsigned int stb__bgetdata(stbfile *s, void *buffer, unsigned int len)
10811 {
10812  if (s->indata + len > s->inend)
10813  len = s->inend - s->indata;
10814  memcpy(buffer, s->indata, len);
10815  s->indata += len;
10816  return len;
10817 }
10818 static unsigned int stb__bsize(stbfile *s) { return s->inend - s->buffer; }
10819 static unsigned int stb__btell(stbfile *s) { return s->indata - s->buffer; }
10820 
10821 static void stb__bclose(stbfile *s)
10822 {
10823  if (s->various)
10824  free(s->buffer);
10825 }
10826 
10827 stbfile *stb_open_inbuffer(void *buffer, unsigned int len)
10828 {
10829  stbfile m = { stb__bgetbyte, stb__bgetdata,
10830  stb__noputbyte, stb__noputdata,
10831  stb__bsize, stb__btell, stb__nobackpatch, stb__bclose };
10832  stbfile *z = (stbfile *) malloc(sizeof(*z));
10833  if (z) {
10834  *z = m;
10835  z->buffer = (unsigned char *) buffer;
10836  z->indata = z->buffer;
10837  z->inend = z->indata + len;
10838  }
10839  return z;
10840 }
10841 
10842 stbfile *stb_open_inbuffer_free(void *buffer, unsigned int len)
10843 {
10844  stbfile *z = stb_open_inbuffer(buffer, len);
10845  if (z)
10846  z->various = 1; // free
10847  return z;
10848 }
10849 
10850 #ifndef STB_VERSION
10851 // if we've been cut-and-pasted elsewhere, you get a limited
10852 // version of stb_open, without the 'k' flag and utf8 support
10853 static void stb__fclose2(stbfile *f)
10854 {
10855  fclose(f->f);
10856 }
10857 
10858 stbfile *stb_open(char *filename, char *mode)
10859 {
10860  FILE *f = fopen(filename, mode);
10861  stbfile *s;
10862  if (f == NULL) return NULL;
10863  s = stb_openf(f);
10864  if (s)
10865  s->close = stb__fclose2;
10866  return s;
10867 }
10868 #else
10869 // the full version depends on some code in stb.h; this
10870 // also includes the memory buffer output format implemented with stb_arr
10871 static void stb__fclose2(stbfile *f)
10872 {
10873  stb_fclose(f->f, f->various);
10874 }
10875 
10876 stbfile *stb_open(char *filename, char *mode)
10877 {
10878  FILE *f = stb_fopen(filename, mode[0] == 'k' ? mode+1 : mode);
10879  stbfile *s;
10880  if (f == NULL) return NULL;
10881  s = stb_openf(f);
10882  if (s) {
10883  s->close = stb__fclose2;
10884  s->various = mode[0] == 'k' ? stb_keep_if_different : stb_keep_yes;
10885  }
10886  return s;
10887 }
10888 
10889 static int stb__aputbyte(stbfile *f, int ch)
10890 {
10891  stb_arr_push(f->buffer, ch);
10892  return 1;
10893 }
10894 static unsigned int stb__aputdata(stbfile *f, void *data, unsigned int len)
10895 {
10896  memcpy(stb_arr_addn(f->buffer, (int) len), data, len);
10897  return len;
10898 }
10899 static unsigned int stb__asize(stbfile *f) { return stb_arr_len(f->buffer); }
10900 static void stb__abackpatch(stbfile *f, unsigned int where, void *data, unsigned int len)
10901 {
10902  memcpy(f->buffer+where, data, len);
10903 }
10904 static void stb__aclose(stbfile *f)
10905 {
10906  *(unsigned char **) f->ptr = f->buffer;
10907 }
10908 
10909 stbfile *stb_open_outbuffer(unsigned char **update_on_close)
10910 {
10911  stbfile m = { stb__nogetbyte, stb__nogetdata,
10912  stb__aputbyte, stb__aputdata,
10913  stb__asize, stb__asize, stb__abackpatch, stb__aclose };
10914  stbfile *z = (stbfile *) malloc(sizeof(*z));
10915  if (z) {
10916  z->ptr = update_on_close;
10917  *z = m;
10918  }
10919  return z;
10920 }
10921 #endif
10922 #endif
10923 
10924 
10926 //
10927 // Arithmetic coder... based on cbloom's notes on the subject, should be
10928 // less code than a huffman code.
10929 
10930 typedef struct
10931 {
10932  unsigned int range_low;
10933  unsigned int range_high;
10934  unsigned int code, range; // decode
10935  int buffered_u8;
10936  int pending_ffs;
10937  stbfile *output;
10938 } stb_arith;
10939 
10940 STB_EXTERN void stb_arith_init_encode(stb_arith *a, stbfile *out);
10941 STB_EXTERN void stb_arith_init_decode(stb_arith *a, stbfile *in);
10942 STB_EXTERN stbfile *stb_arith_encode_close(stb_arith *a);
10943 STB_EXTERN stbfile *stb_arith_decode_close(stb_arith *a);
10944 
10945 STB_EXTERN void stb_arith_encode(stb_arith *a, unsigned int totalfreq, unsigned int freq, unsigned int cumfreq);
10946 STB_EXTERN void stb_arith_encode_log2(stb_arith *a, unsigned int totalfreq2, unsigned int freq, unsigned int cumfreq);
10947 STB_EXTERN unsigned int stb_arith_decode_value(stb_arith *a, unsigned int totalfreq);
10948 STB_EXTERN void stb_arith_decode_advance(stb_arith *a, unsigned int totalfreq, unsigned int freq, unsigned int cumfreq);
10949 STB_EXTERN unsigned int stb_arith_decode_value_log2(stb_arith *a, unsigned int totalfreq2);
10950 STB_EXTERN void stb_arith_decode_advance_log2(stb_arith *a, unsigned int totalfreq2, unsigned int freq, unsigned int cumfreq);
10951 
10952 STB_EXTERN void stb_arith_encode_byte(stb_arith *a, int byte);
10953 STB_EXTERN int stb_arith_decode_byte(stb_arith *a);
10954 
10955 // this is a memory-inefficient way of doing things, but it's
10956 // fast(?) and simple
10957 typedef struct
10958 {
10959  unsigned short cumfreq;
10960  unsigned short samples;
10961 } stb_arith_symstate_item;
10962 
10963 typedef struct
10964 {
10965  int num_sym;
10966  unsigned int pow2;
10967  int countdown;
10968  stb_arith_symstate_item data[1];
10969 } stb_arith_symstate;
10970 
10971 #ifdef STB_DEFINE
10972 void stb_arith_init_encode(stb_arith *a, stbfile *out)
10973 {
10974  a->range_low = 0;
10975  a->range_high = 0xffffffff;
10976  a->pending_ffs = -1; // means no buffered character currently, to speed up normal case
10977  a->output = out;
10978 }
10979 
10980 static void stb__arith_carry(stb_arith *a)
10981 {
10982  int i;
10983  assert(a->pending_ffs != -1); // can't carry with no data
10984  stb_putc(a->output, a->buffered_u8);
10985  for (i=0; i < a->pending_ffs; ++i)
10986  stb_putc(a->output, 0);
10987 }
10988 
10989 static void stb__arith_putbyte(stb_arith *a, int byte)
10990 {
10991  if (a->pending_ffs) {
10992  if (a->pending_ffs == -1) { // means no buffered data; encoded for fast path efficiency
10993  if (byte == 0xff)
10994  stb_putc(a->output, byte); // just write it immediately
10995  else {
10996  a->buffered_u8 = byte;
10997  a->pending_ffs = 0;
10998  }
10999  } else if (byte == 0xff) {
11000  ++a->pending_ffs;
11001  } else {
11002  int i;
11003  stb_putc(a->output, a->buffered_u8);
11004  for (i=0; i < a->pending_ffs; ++i)
11005  stb_putc(a->output, 0xff);
11006  }
11007  } else if (byte == 0xff) {
11008  ++a->pending_ffs;
11009  } else {
11010  // fast path
11011  stb_putc(a->output, a->buffered_u8);
11012  a->buffered_u8 = byte;
11013  }
11014 }
11015 
11016 static void stb__arith_flush(stb_arith *a)
11017 {
11018  if (a->pending_ffs >= 0) {
11019  int i;
11020  stb_putc(a->output, a->buffered_u8);
11021  for (i=0; i < a->pending_ffs; ++i)
11022  stb_putc(a->output, 0xff);
11023  }
11024 }
11025 
11026 static void stb__renorm_encoder(stb_arith *a)
11027 {
11028  stb__arith_putbyte(a, a->range_low >> 24);
11029  a->range_low <<= 8;
11030  a->range_high = (a->range_high << 8) | 0xff;
11031 }
11032 
11033 static void stb__renorm_decoder(stb_arith *a)
11034 {
11035  int c = stb_getc(a->output);
11036  a->code = (a->code << 8) + (c >= 0 ? c : 0); // if EOF, insert 0
11037 }
11038 
11039 void stb_arith_encode(stb_arith *a, unsigned int totalfreq, unsigned int freq, unsigned int cumfreq)
11040 {
11041  unsigned int range = a->range_high - a->range_low;
11042  unsigned int old = a->range_low;
11043  range /= totalfreq;
11044  a->range_low += range * cumfreq;
11045  a->range_high = a->range_low + range*freq;
11046  if (a->range_low < old)
11047  stb__arith_carry(a);
11048  while (a->range_high - a->range_low < 0x1000000)
11049  stb__renorm_encoder(a);
11050 }
11051 
11052 void stb_arith_encode_log2(stb_arith *a, unsigned int totalfreq2, unsigned int freq, unsigned int cumfreq)
11053 {
11054  unsigned int range = a->range_high - a->range_low;
11055  unsigned int old = a->range_low;
11056  range >>= totalfreq2;
11057  a->range_low += range * cumfreq;
11058  a->range_high = a->range_low + range*freq;
11059  if (a->range_low < old)
11060  stb__arith_carry(a);
11061  while (a->range_high - a->range_low < 0x1000000)
11062  stb__renorm_encoder(a);
11063 }
11064 
11065 unsigned int stb_arith_decode_value(stb_arith *a, unsigned int totalfreq)
11066 {
11067  unsigned int freqsize = a->range / totalfreq;
11068  unsigned int z = a->code / freqsize;
11069  return z >= totalfreq ? totalfreq-1 : z;
11070 }
11071 
11072 void stb_arith_decode_advance(stb_arith *a, unsigned int totalfreq, unsigned int freq, unsigned int cumfreq)
11073 {
11074  unsigned int freqsize = a->range / totalfreq; // @OPTIMIZE, share with above divide somehow?
11075  a->code -= freqsize * cumfreq;
11076  a->range = freqsize * freq;
11077  while (a->range < 0x1000000)
11078  stb__renorm_decoder(a);
11079 }
11080 
11081 unsigned int stb_arith_decode_value_log2(stb_arith *a, unsigned int totalfreq2)
11082 {
11083  unsigned int freqsize = a->range >> totalfreq2;
11084  unsigned int z = a->code / freqsize;
11085  return z >= (1U<<totalfreq2) ? (1U<<totalfreq2)-1 : z;
11086 }
11087 
11088 void stb_arith_decode_advance_log2(stb_arith *a, unsigned int totalfreq2, unsigned int freq, unsigned int cumfreq)
11089 {
11090  unsigned int freqsize = a->range >> totalfreq2;
11091  a->code -= freqsize * cumfreq;
11092  a->range = freqsize * freq;
11093  while (a->range < 0x1000000)
11094  stb__renorm_decoder(a);
11095 }
11096 
11097 stbfile *stb_arith_encode_close(stb_arith *a)
11098 {
11099  // put exactly as many bytes as we'll read, so we can turn on/off arithmetic coding in a stream
11100  stb__arith_putbyte(a, a->range_low >> 24);
11101  stb__arith_putbyte(a, a->range_low >> 16);
11102  stb__arith_putbyte(a, a->range_low >> 8);
11103  stb__arith_putbyte(a, a->range_low >> 0);
11104  stb__arith_flush(a);
11105  return a->output;
11106 }
11107 
11108 stbfile *stb_arith_decode_close(stb_arith *a)
11109 {
11110  return a->output;
11111 }
11112 
11113 // this is a simple power-of-two based model -- using
11114 // power of two means we need one divide per decode,
11115 // not two.
11116 #define POW2_LIMIT 12
11117 stb_arith_symstate *stb_arith_state_create(int num_sym)
11118 {
11119  stb_arith_symstate *s = (stb_arith_symstate *) malloc(sizeof(*s) + (num_sym-1) * sizeof(s->data[0]));
11120  if (s) {
11121  int i, cf, cf_next, next;
11122  int start_freq, extra;
11123  s->num_sym = num_sym;
11124  s->pow2 = 4;
11125  while (s->pow2 < 15 && (1 << s->pow2) < 3*num_sym) {
11126  ++s->pow2;
11127  }
11128  start_freq = (1 << s->pow2) / num_sym;
11129  assert(start_freq >= 1);
11130  extra = (1 << s->pow2) % num_sym;
11131  // now set up the initial stats
11132 
11133  if (s->pow2 < POW2_LIMIT)
11134  next = 0;
11135  else
11136  next = 1;
11137 
11138  cf = cf_next = 0;
11139  for (i=0; i < extra; ++i) {
11140  s->data[i].cumfreq = cf;
11141  s->data[i].samples = next;
11142  cf += start_freq+1;
11143  cf_next += next;
11144  }
11145  for (; i < num_sym; ++i) {
11146  s->data[i].cumfreq = cf;
11147  s->data[i].samples = next;
11148  cf += start_freq;
11149  cf_next += next;
11150  }
11151  assert(cf == (1 << s->pow2));
11152  // now, how long should we go until we have 2 << s->pow2 samples?
11153  s->countdown = (2 << s->pow2) - cf - cf_next;
11154  }
11155  return s;
11156 }
11157 
11158 static void stb_arith_state_rescale(stb_arith_symstate *s)
11159 {
11160  if (s->pow2 < POW2_LIMIT) {
11161  int pcf, cf, cf_next, next, i;
11162  ++s->pow2;
11163  if (s->pow2 < POW2_LIMIT)
11164  next = 0;
11165  else
11166  next = 1;
11167  cf = cf_next = 0;
11168  pcf = 0;
11169  for (i=0; i < s->num_sym; ++i) {
11170  int sample = s->data[i].cumfreq - pcf + s->data[i].samples;
11171  s->data[i].cumfreq = cf;
11172  cf += sample;
11173  s->data[i].samples = next;
11174  cf_next += next;
11175  }
11176  assert(cf == (1 << s->pow2));
11177  s->countdown = (2 << s->pow2) - cf - cf_next;
11178  } else {
11179  int pcf, cf, cf_next, i;
11180  cf = cf_next = 0;
11181  pcf = 0;
11182  for (i=0; i < s->num_sym; ++i) {
11183  int sample = (s->data[i].cumfreq - pcf + s->data[i].samples) >> 1;
11184  s->data[i].cumfreq = cf;
11185  cf += sample;
11186  s->data[i].samples = 1;
11187  cf_next += 1;
11188  }
11189  assert(cf == (1 << s->pow2)); // this isn't necessarily true, due to rounding down!
11190  s->countdown = (2 << s->pow2) - cf - cf_next;
11191  }
11192 }
11193 
11194 void stb_arith_encode_byte(stb_arith *a, int byte)
11195 {
11196 }
11197 
11198 int stb_arith_decode_byte(stb_arith *a)
11199 {
11200  return -1;
11201 }
11202 #endif
11203 
11205 //
11206 // Threads
11207 //
11208 
11209 #ifndef _WIN32
11210 #ifdef STB_THREADS
11211 #error "threads not implemented except for Windows"
11212 #endif
11213 #endif
11214 
11215 // call this function to free any global variables for memory testing
11216 STB_EXTERN void stb_thread_cleanup(void);
11217 
11218 typedef void * (*stb_thread_func)(void *);
11219 
11220 // do not rely on these types, this is an implementation detail.
11221 // compare against STB_THREAD_NULL and ST_SEMAPHORE_NULL
11222 typedef void *stb_thread;
11223 typedef void *stb_semaphore;
11224 typedef void *stb_mutex;
11225 typedef struct stb__sync *stb_sync;
11226 
11227 #define STB_SEMAPHORE_NULL NULL
11228 #define STB_THREAD_NULL NULL
11229 #define STB_MUTEX_NULL NULL
11230 #define STB_SYNC_NULL NULL
11231 
11232 // get the number of processors (limited to those in the affinity mask for this process).
11233 STB_EXTERN int stb_processor_count(void);
11234 // force to run on a single core -- needed for RDTSC to work, e.g. for iprof
11235 STB_EXTERN void stb_force_uniprocessor(void);
11236 
11237 // stb_work functions: queue up work to be done by some worker threads
11238 
11239 // set number of threads to serve the queue; you can change this on the fly,
11240 // but if you decrease it, it won't decrease until things currently on the
11241 // queue are finished
11242 STB_EXTERN void stb_work_numthreads(int n);
11243 // set maximum number of units in the queue; you can only set this BEFORE running any work functions
11244 STB_EXTERN int stb_work_maxunits(int n);
11245 // enqueue some work to be done (can do this from any thread, or even from a piece of work);
11246 // return value of f is stored in *return_code if non-NULL
11247 STB_EXTERN int stb_work(stb_thread_func f, void *d, volatile void **return_code);
11248 // as above, but stb_sync_reach is called on 'rel' after work is complete
11249 STB_EXTERN int stb_work_reach(stb_thread_func f, void *d, volatile void **return_code, stb_sync rel);
11250 
11251 
11252 // necessary to call this when using volatile to order writes/reads
11253 STB_EXTERN void stb_barrier(void);
11254 
11255 // support for independent queues with their own threads
11256 
11257 typedef struct stb__workqueue stb_workqueue;
11258 
11259 STB_EXTERN stb_workqueue*stb_workq_new(int numthreads, int max_units);
11260 STB_EXTERN stb_workqueue*stb_workq_new_flags(int numthreads, int max_units, int no_add_mutex, int no_remove_mutex);
11261 STB_EXTERN void stb_workq_delete(stb_workqueue *q);
11262 STB_EXTERN void stb_workq_numthreads(stb_workqueue *q, int n);
11263 STB_EXTERN int stb_workq(stb_workqueue *q, stb_thread_func f, void *d, volatile void **return_code);
11264 STB_EXTERN int stb_workq_reach(stb_workqueue *q, stb_thread_func f, void *d, volatile void **return_code, stb_sync rel);
11265 STB_EXTERN int stb_workq_length(stb_workqueue *q);
11266 
11267 STB_EXTERN stb_thread stb_create_thread (stb_thread_func f, void *d);
11268 STB_EXTERN stb_thread stb_create_thread2(stb_thread_func f, void *d, volatile void **return_code, stb_semaphore rel);
11269 STB_EXTERN void stb_destroy_thread(stb_thread t);
11270 
11271 STB_EXTERN stb_semaphore stb_sem_new(int max_val);
11272 STB_EXTERN stb_semaphore stb_sem_new_extra(int max_val, int start_val);
11273 STB_EXTERN void stb_sem_delete (stb_semaphore s);
11274 STB_EXTERN void stb_sem_waitfor(stb_semaphore s);
11275 STB_EXTERN void stb_sem_release(stb_semaphore s);
11276 
11277 STB_EXTERN stb_mutex stb_mutex_new(void);
11278 STB_EXTERN void stb_mutex_delete(stb_mutex m);
11279 STB_EXTERN void stb_mutex_begin(stb_mutex m);
11280 STB_EXTERN void stb_mutex_end(stb_mutex m);
11281 
11282 STB_EXTERN stb_sync stb_sync_new(void);
11283 STB_EXTERN void stb_sync_delete(stb_sync s);
11284 STB_EXTERN int stb_sync_set_target(stb_sync s, int count);
11285 STB_EXTERN void stb_sync_reach_and_wait(stb_sync s); // wait for 'target' reachers
11286 STB_EXTERN int stb_sync_reach(stb_sync s);
11287 
11288 typedef struct stb__threadqueue stb_threadqueue;
11289 #define STB_THREADQ_DYNAMIC 0
11290 STB_EXTERN stb_threadqueue *stb_threadq_new(int item_size, int num_items, int many_add, int many_remove);
11291 STB_EXTERN void stb_threadq_delete(stb_threadqueue *tq);
11292 STB_EXTERN int stb_threadq_get(stb_threadqueue *tq, void *output);
11293 STB_EXTERN void stb_threadq_get_block(stb_threadqueue *tq, void *output);
11294 STB_EXTERN int stb_threadq_add(stb_threadqueue *tq, void *input);
11295 // can return FALSE if STB_THREADQ_DYNAMIC and attempt to grow fails
11296 STB_EXTERN int stb_threadq_add_block(stb_threadqueue *tq, void *input);
11297 
11298 #ifdef STB_THREADS
11299 #ifdef STB_DEFINE
11300 
11301 typedef struct
11302 {
11303  stb_thread_func f;
11304  void *d;
11305  volatile void **return_val;
11306  stb_semaphore sem;
11307 } stb__thread;
11308 
11309 // this is initialized along all possible paths to create threads, therefore
11310 // it's always initialized before any other threads are create, therefore
11311 // it's free of races AS LONG AS you only create threads through stb_*
11312 static stb_mutex stb__threadmutex, stb__workmutex;
11313 
11314 static void stb__threadmutex_init(void)
11315 {
11316  if (stb__threadmutex == STB_SEMAPHORE_NULL) {
11317  stb__threadmutex = stb_mutex_new();
11318  stb__workmutex = stb_mutex_new();
11319  }
11320 }
11321 
11322 #ifdef STB_THREAD_TEST
11323 volatile float stb__t1=1, stb__t2;
11324 
11325 static void stb__wait(int n)
11326 {
11327  float z = 0;
11328  int i;
11329  for (i=0; i < n; ++i)
11330  z += 1 / (stb__t1+i);
11331  stb__t2 = z;
11332 }
11333 #else
11334 #define stb__wait(x)
11335 #endif
11336 
11337 #ifdef _WIN32
11338 
11339 // avoid including windows.h -- note that our definitions aren't
11340 // exactly the same (we don't define the security descriptor struct)
11341 // so if you want to include windows.h, make sure you do it first.
11342 #include <process.h>
11343 
11344 #ifndef _WINDOWS_ // check windows.h guard
11345 #define STB__IMPORT STB_EXTERN __declspec(dllimport)
11346 #define STB__DW unsigned long
11347 
11348 STB__IMPORT int __stdcall TerminateThread(void *, STB__DW);
11349 STB__IMPORT void * __stdcall CreateSemaphoreA(void *sec, long,long,char*);
11350 STB__IMPORT int __stdcall CloseHandle(void *);
11351 STB__IMPORT STB__DW __stdcall WaitForSingleObject(void *, STB__DW);
11352 STB__IMPORT int __stdcall ReleaseSemaphore(void *, long, long *);
11353 STB__IMPORT void __stdcall Sleep(STB__DW);
11354 #endif
11355 
11356 // necessary to call this when using volatile to order writes/reads
11357 void stb_barrier(void)
11358 {
11359  #ifdef MemoryBarrier
11360  MemoryBarrier();
11361  #else
11362  long temp;
11363  __asm xchg temp,eax;
11364  #endif
11365 }
11366 
11367 static void stb__thread_run(void *t)
11368 {
11369  void *res;
11370  stb__thread info = * (stb__thread *) t;
11371  free(t);
11372  res = info.f(info.d);
11373  if (info.return_val)
11374  *info.return_val = res;
11375  if (info.sem != STB_SEMAPHORE_NULL)
11376  stb_sem_release(info.sem);
11377 }
11378 
11379 static stb_thread stb_create_thread_raw(stb_thread_func f, void *d, volatile void **return_code, stb_semaphore rel)
11380 {
11381 #ifdef _MT
11382 #if defined(STB_FASTMALLOC) && !defined(STB_FASTMALLOC_ITS_OKAY_I_ONLY_MALLOC_IN_ONE_THREAD)
11383  stb_fatal("Error! Cannot use STB_FASTMALLOC with threads.\n");
11384  return STB_THREAD_NULL;
11385 #else
11386  unsigned long id;
11387  stb__thread *data = (stb__thread *) malloc(sizeof(*data));
11388  if (!data) return NULL;
11389  stb__threadmutex_init();
11390  data->f = f;
11391  data->d = d;
11392  data->return_val = return_code;
11393  data->sem = rel;
11394  id = _beginthread(stb__thread_run, 0, data);
11395  if (id == -1) return NULL;
11396  return (void *) id;
11397 #endif
11398 #else
11399 #ifdef STB_NO_STB_STRINGS
11400  stb_fatal("Invalid compilation");
11401 #else
11402  stb_fatal("Must compile mult-threaded to use stb_thread/stb_work.");
11403 #endif
11404  return NULL;
11405 #endif
11406 }
11407 
11408 // trivial win32 wrappers
11409 void stb_destroy_thread(stb_thread t) { TerminateThread(t,0); }
11410 stb_semaphore stb_sem_new(int maxv) {return CreateSemaphoreA(NULL,0,maxv,NULL); }
11411 stb_semaphore stb_sem_new_extra(int maxv,int start){return CreateSemaphoreA(NULL,start,maxv,NULL); }
11412 void stb_sem_delete(stb_semaphore s) { if (s != NULL) CloseHandle(s); }
11413 void stb_sem_waitfor(stb_semaphore s) { WaitForSingleObject(s, 0xffffffff); } // INFINITE
11414 void stb_sem_release(stb_semaphore s) { ReleaseSemaphore(s,1,NULL); }
11415 static void stb__thread_sleep(int ms) { Sleep(ms); }
11416 
11417 #ifndef _WINDOWS_
11418 STB__IMPORT int __stdcall GetProcessAffinityMask(void *, STB__DW *, STB__DW *);
11419 STB__IMPORT void * __stdcall GetCurrentProcess(void);
11420 STB__IMPORT int __stdcall SetProcessAffinityMask(void *, STB__DW);
11421 #endif
11422 
11423 int stb_processor_count(void)
11424 {
11425  unsigned long proc,sys;
11426  GetProcessAffinityMask(GetCurrentProcess(), &proc, &sys);
11427  return stb_bitcount(proc);
11428 }
11429 
11430 void stb_force_uniprocessor(void)
11431 {
11432  unsigned long proc,sys;
11433  GetProcessAffinityMask(GetCurrentProcess(), &proc, &sys);
11434  if (stb_bitcount(proc) > 1) {
11435  int z;
11436  for (z=0; z < 32; ++z)
11437  if (proc & (1 << z))
11438  break;
11439  if (z < 32) {
11440  proc = 1 << z;
11441  SetProcessAffinityMask(GetCurrentProcess(), proc);
11442  }
11443  }
11444 }
11445 
11446 #ifdef _WINDOWS_
11447 #define STB_MUTEX_NATIVE
11448 void *stb_mutex_new(void)
11449 {
11450  CRITICAL_SECTION *p = (CRITICAL_SECTION *) malloc(sizeof(*p));
11451  if (p)
11452 #if _WIN32_WINNT >= 0x0500
11453  InitializeCriticalSectionAndSpinCount(p, 500);
11454 #else
11455  InitializeCriticalSection(p);
11456 #endif
11457  return p;
11458 }
11459 
11460 void stb_mutex_delete(void *p)
11461 {
11462  if (p) {
11463  DeleteCriticalSection((CRITICAL_SECTION *) p);
11464  free(p);
11465  }
11466 }
11467 
11468 void stb_mutex_begin(void *p)
11469 {
11470  stb__wait(500);
11471  if (p)
11472  EnterCriticalSection((CRITICAL_SECTION *) p);
11473 }
11474 
11475 void stb_mutex_end(void *p)
11476 {
11477  if (p)
11478  LeaveCriticalSection((CRITICAL_SECTION *) p);
11479  stb__wait(500);
11480 }
11481 #endif // _WINDOWS_
11482 
11483 #if 0
11484 // for future reference,
11485 // InterlockedCompareExchange for x86:
11486  int cas64_mp(void * dest, void * xcmp, void * xxchg) {
11487  __asm
11488  {
11489  mov esi, [xxchg] ; exchange
11490  mov ebx, [esi + 0]
11491  mov ecx, [esi + 4]
11492 
11493  mov esi, [xcmp] ; comparand
11494  mov eax, [esi + 0]
11495  mov edx, [esi + 4]
11496 
11497  mov edi, [dest] ; destination
11498  lock cmpxchg8b [edi]
11499  jz yyyy;
11500 
11501  mov [esi + 0], eax;
11502  mov [esi + 4], edx;
11503 
11504 yyyy:
11505  xor eax, eax;
11506  setz al;
11507  };
11508 
11509 inline unsigned __int64 _InterlockedCompareExchange64(volatile unsigned __int64 *dest
11510  ,unsigned __int64 exchange
11511  ,unsigned __int64 comperand)
11512 {
11513  //value returned in eax::edx
11514  __asm {
11515  lea esi,comperand;
11516  lea edi,exchange;
11517 
11518  mov eax,[esi];
11519  mov edx,4[esi];
11520  mov ebx,[edi];
11521  mov ecx,4[edi];
11522  mov esi,dest;
11523  lock CMPXCHG8B [esi];
11524  }
11525 #endif // #if 0
11526 
11527 #endif // _WIN32
11528 
11529 stb_thread stb_create_thread2(stb_thread_func f, void *d, volatile void **return_code, stb_semaphore rel)
11530 {
11531  return stb_create_thread_raw(f,d,return_code,rel);
11532 }
11533 
11534 stb_thread stb_create_thread(stb_thread_func f, void *d)
11535 {
11536  return stb_create_thread2(f,d,NULL,STB_SEMAPHORE_NULL);
11537 }
11538 
11539 // mutex implemented by wrapping semaphore
11540 #ifndef STB_MUTEX_NATIVE
11541 stb_mutex stb_mutex_new(void) { return stb_sem_new_extra(1,1); }
11542 void stb_mutex_delete(stb_mutex m) { stb_sem_delete (m); }
11543 void stb_mutex_begin(stb_mutex m) { stb__wait(500); if (m) stb_sem_waitfor(m); }
11544 void stb_mutex_end(stb_mutex m) { if (m) stb_sem_release(m); stb__wait(500); }
11545 #endif
11546 
11547 // thread merge operation
11548 struct stb__sync
11549 {
11550  int target; // target number of threads to hit it
11551  int sofar; // total threads that hit it
11552  int waiting; // total threads waiting
11553 
11554  stb_mutex start; // mutex to prevent starting again before finishing previous
11555  stb_mutex mutex; // mutex while tweaking state
11556  stb_semaphore release; // semaphore wake up waiting threads
11557  // we have to wake them up one at a time, rather than using a single release
11558  // call, because win32 semaphores don't let you dynamically change the max count!
11559 };
11560 
11561 stb_sync stb_sync_new(void)
11562 {
11563  stb_sync s = (stb_sync) malloc(sizeof(*s));
11564  if (!s) return s;
11565 
11566  s->target = s->sofar = s->waiting = 0;
11567  s->mutex = stb_mutex_new();
11568  s->start = stb_mutex_new();
11569  s->release = stb_sem_new(1);
11570  if (s->mutex == STB_MUTEX_NULL || s->release == STB_SEMAPHORE_NULL || s->start == STB_MUTEX_NULL) {
11571  stb_mutex_delete(s->mutex);
11572  stb_mutex_delete(s->mutex);
11573  stb_sem_delete(s->release);
11574  free(s);
11575  return NULL;
11576  }
11577  return s;
11578 }
11579 
11580 void stb_sync_delete(stb_sync s)
11581 {
11582  if (s->waiting) {
11583  // it's bad to delete while there are threads waiting!
11584  // shall we wait for them to reach, or just bail? just bail
11585  assert(0);
11586  }
11587  stb_mutex_delete(s->mutex);
11588  stb_mutex_delete(s->release);
11589  free(s);
11590 }
11591 
11592 int stb_sync_set_target(stb_sync s, int count)
11593 {
11594  // don't allow setting a target until the last one is fully released;
11595  // note that this can lead to inefficient pipelining, and maybe we'd
11596  // be better off ping-ponging between two internal syncs?
11597  // I tried seeing how often this happened using TryEnterCriticalSection
11598  // and could _never_ get it to happen in imv(stb), even with more threads
11599  // than processors. So who knows!
11600  stb_mutex_begin(s->start);
11601 
11602  // this mutex is pointless, since it's not valid for threads
11603  // to call reach() before anyone calls set_target() anyway
11604  stb_mutex_begin(s->mutex);
11605 
11606  assert(s->target == 0); // enforced by start mutex
11607  s->target = count;
11608  s->sofar = 0;
11609  s->waiting = 0;
11610  stb_mutex_end(s->mutex);
11611  return STB_TRUE;
11612 }
11613 
11614 void stb__sync_release(stb_sync s)
11615 {
11616  if (s->waiting)
11617  stb_sem_release(s->release);
11618  else {
11619  s->target = 0;
11620  stb_mutex_end(s->start);
11621  }
11622 }
11623 
11624 int stb_sync_reach(stb_sync s)
11625 {
11626  int n;
11627  stb_mutex_begin(s->mutex);
11628  assert(s->sofar < s->target);
11629  n = ++s->sofar; // record this value to avoid possible race if we did 'return s->sofar';
11630  if (s->sofar == s->target)
11631  stb__sync_release(s);
11632  stb_mutex_end(s->mutex);
11633  return n;
11634 }
11635 
11636 void stb_sync_reach_and_wait(stb_sync s)
11637 {
11638  stb_mutex_begin(s->mutex);
11639  assert(s->sofar < s->target);
11640  ++s->sofar;
11641  if (s->sofar == s->target) {
11642  stb__sync_release(s);
11643  stb_mutex_end(s->mutex);
11644  } else {
11645  ++s->waiting; // we're waiting, so one more waiter
11646  stb_mutex_end(s->mutex); // release the mutex to other threads
11647 
11648  stb_sem_waitfor(s->release); // wait for merge completion
11649 
11650  stb_mutex_begin(s->mutex); // on merge completion, grab the mutex
11651  --s->waiting; // we're done waiting
11652  stb__sync_release(s); // restart the next waiter
11653  stb_mutex_end(s->mutex); // and now we're done
11654  // this ends the same as the first case, but it's a lot
11655  // clearer to understand without sharing the code
11656  }
11657 }
11658 
11659 struct stb__threadqueue
11660 {
11661  stb_mutex add, remove;
11662  stb_semaphore nonempty, nonfull;
11663  int head_blockers; // number of threads blocking--used to know whether to release(avail)
11664  int tail_blockers;
11665  int head, tail, array_size, growable;
11666  int item_size;
11667  char *data;
11668 };
11669 
11670 static int stb__tq_wrap(volatile stb_threadqueue *z, int p)
11671 {
11672  if (p == z->array_size)
11673  return p - z->array_size;
11674  else
11675  return p;
11676 }
11677 
11678 int stb__threadq_get_raw(stb_threadqueue *tq2, void *output, int block)
11679 {
11680  volatile stb_threadqueue *tq = (volatile stb_threadqueue *) tq2;
11681  if (tq->head == tq->tail && !block) return 0;
11682 
11683  stb_mutex_begin(tq->remove);
11684 
11685  while (tq->head == tq->tail) {
11686  if (!block) {
11687  stb_mutex_end(tq->remove);
11688  return 0;
11689  }
11690  ++tq->head_blockers;
11691  stb_mutex_end(tq->remove);
11692 
11693  stb_sem_waitfor(tq->nonempty);
11694 
11695  stb_mutex_begin(tq->remove);
11696  --tq->head_blockers;
11697  }
11698 
11699  memcpy(output, tq->data + tq->head*tq->item_size, tq->item_size);
11700  stb_barrier();
11701  tq->head = stb__tq_wrap(tq, tq->head+1);
11702 
11703  stb_sem_release(tq->nonfull);
11704  if (tq->head_blockers) // can't check if actually non-empty due to race?
11705  stb_sem_release(tq->nonempty); // if there are other blockers, wake one
11706 
11707  stb_mutex_end(tq->remove);
11708  return STB_TRUE;
11709 }
11710 
11711 int stb__threadq_grow(volatile stb_threadqueue *tq)
11712 {
11713  int n;
11714  char *p;
11715  assert(tq->remove != STB_MUTEX_NULL); // must have this to allow growth!
11716  stb_mutex_begin(tq->remove);
11717 
11718  n = tq->array_size * 2;
11719  p = (char *) realloc(tq->data, n * tq->item_size);
11720  if (p == NULL) {
11721  stb_mutex_end(tq->remove);
11722  stb_mutex_end(tq->add);
11723  return STB_FALSE;
11724  }
11725  if (tq->tail < tq->head) {
11726  memcpy(p + tq->array_size * tq->item_size, p, tq->tail * tq->item_size);
11727  tq->tail += tq->array_size;
11728  }
11729  tq->data = p;
11730  tq->array_size = n;
11731 
11732  stb_mutex_end(tq->remove);
11733  return STB_TRUE;
11734 }
11735 
11736 int stb__threadq_add_raw(stb_threadqueue *tq2, void *input, int block)
11737 {
11738  int tail,pos;
11739  volatile stb_threadqueue *tq = (volatile stb_threadqueue *) tq2;
11740  stb_mutex_begin(tq->add);
11741  for(;;) {
11742  pos = tq->tail;
11743  tail = stb__tq_wrap(tq, pos+1);
11744  if (tail != tq->head) break;
11745 
11746  // full
11747  if (tq->growable) {
11748  if (!stb__threadq_grow(tq)) {
11749  stb_mutex_end(tq->add);
11750  return STB_FALSE; // out of memory
11751  }
11752  } else if (!block) {
11753  stb_mutex_end(tq->add);
11754  return STB_FALSE;
11755  } else {
11756  ++tq->tail_blockers;
11757  stb_mutex_end(tq->add);
11758 
11759  stb_sem_waitfor(tq->nonfull);
11760 
11761  stb_mutex_begin(tq->add);
11762  --tq->tail_blockers;
11763  }
11764  }
11765  memcpy(tq->data + tq->item_size * pos, input, tq->item_size);
11766  stb_barrier();
11767  tq->tail = tail;
11768  stb_sem_release(tq->nonempty);
11769  if (tq->tail_blockers) // can't check if actually non-full due to race?
11770  stb_sem_release(tq->nonfull);
11771  stb_mutex_end(tq->add);
11772  return STB_TRUE;
11773 }
11774 
11775 int stb_threadq_length(stb_threadqueue *tq2)
11776 {
11777  int a,b,n;
11778  volatile stb_threadqueue *tq = (volatile stb_threadqueue *) tq2;
11779  stb_mutex_begin(tq->add);
11780  a = tq->head;
11781  b = tq->tail;
11782  n = tq->array_size;
11783  stb_mutex_end(tq->add);
11784  if (a > b) b += n;
11785  return b-a;
11786 }
11787 
11788 int stb_threadq_get(stb_threadqueue *tq, void *output)
11789 {
11790  return stb__threadq_get_raw(tq, output, STB_FALSE);
11791 }
11792 
11793 void stb_threadq_get_block(stb_threadqueue *tq, void *output)
11794 {
11795  stb__threadq_get_raw(tq, output, STB_TRUE);
11796 }
11797 
11798 int stb_threadq_add(stb_threadqueue *tq, void *input)
11799 {
11800  return stb__threadq_add_raw(tq, input, STB_FALSE);
11801 }
11802 
11803 int stb_threadq_add_block(stb_threadqueue *tq, void *input)
11804 {
11805  return stb__threadq_add_raw(tq, input, STB_TRUE);
11806 }
11807 
11808 void stb_threadq_delete(stb_threadqueue *tq)
11809 {
11810  if (tq) {
11811  free(tq->data);
11812  stb_mutex_delete(tq->add);
11813  stb_mutex_delete(tq->remove);
11814  stb_sem_delete(tq->nonempty);
11815  stb_sem_delete(tq->nonfull);
11816  free(tq);
11817  }
11818 }
11819 
11820 #define STB_THREADQUEUE_DYNAMIC 0
11821 stb_threadqueue *stb_threadq_new(int item_size, int num_items, int many_add, int many_remove)
11822 {
11823  int error=0;
11824  stb_threadqueue *tq = (stb_threadqueue *) malloc(sizeof(*tq));
11825  if (tq == NULL) return NULL;
11826 
11827  if (num_items == STB_THREADQUEUE_DYNAMIC) {
11828  tq->growable = STB_TRUE;
11829  num_items = 32;
11830  } else
11831  tq->growable = STB_FALSE;
11832 
11833  tq->item_size = item_size;
11834  tq->array_size = num_items+1;
11835 
11836  tq->add = tq->remove = STB_MUTEX_NULL;
11837  tq->nonempty = tq->nonfull = STB_SEMAPHORE_NULL;
11838  tq->data = NULL;
11839  if (many_add)
11840  { tq->add = stb_mutex_new(); if (tq->add == STB_MUTEX_NULL) goto error; }
11841  if (many_remove || tq->growable)
11842  { tq->remove = stb_mutex_new(); if (tq->remove == STB_MUTEX_NULL) goto error; }
11843  tq->nonempty = stb_sem_new(1); if (tq->nonempty == STB_SEMAPHORE_NULL) goto error;
11844  tq->nonfull = stb_sem_new(1); if (tq->nonfull == STB_SEMAPHORE_NULL) goto error;
11845  tq->data = (char *) malloc(tq->item_size * tq->array_size);
11846  if (tq->data == NULL) goto error;
11847 
11848  tq->head = tq->tail = 0;
11849  tq->head_blockers = tq->tail_blockers = 0;
11850 
11851  return tq;
11852 
11853 error:
11854  stb_threadq_delete(tq);
11855  return NULL;
11856 }
11857 
11858 typedef struct
11859 {
11860  stb_thread_func f;
11861  void *d;
11862  volatile void **retval;
11863  stb_sync sync;
11864 } stb__workinfo;
11865 
11866 //static volatile stb__workinfo *stb__work;
11867 
11868 struct stb__workqueue
11869 {
11870  int numthreads;
11871  stb_threadqueue *tq;
11872 };
11873 
11874 static stb_workqueue *stb__work_global;
11875 
11876 static void *stb__thread_workloop(void *p)
11877 {
11878  volatile stb_workqueue *q = (volatile stb_workqueue *) p;
11879  for(;;) {
11880  void *z;
11881  stb__workinfo w;
11882  stb_threadq_get_block(q->tq, &w);
11883  if (w.f == NULL) // null work is a signal to end the thread
11884  return NULL;
11885  z = w.f(w.d);
11886  if (w.retval) { stb_barrier(); *w.retval = z; }
11887  if (w.sync != STB_SYNC_NULL) stb_sync_reach(w.sync);
11888  }
11889 }
11890 
11891 stb_workqueue *stb_workq_new(int num_threads, int max_units)
11892 {
11893  return stb_workq_new_flags(num_threads, max_units, 0,0);
11894 }
11895 
11896 stb_workqueue *stb_workq_new_flags(int numthreads, int max_units, int no_add_mutex, int no_remove_mutex)
11897 {
11898  stb_workqueue *q = (stb_workqueue *) malloc(sizeof(*q));
11899  if (q == NULL) return NULL;
11900  q->tq = stb_threadq_new(sizeof(stb__workinfo), max_units, !no_add_mutex, !no_remove_mutex);
11901  if (q->tq == NULL) { free(q); return NULL; }
11902  q->numthreads = 0;
11903  stb_workq_numthreads(q, numthreads);
11904  return q;
11905 }
11906 
11907 void stb_workq_delete(stb_workqueue *q)
11908 {
11909  while (stb_workq_length(q) != 0)
11910  stb__thread_sleep(1);
11911  stb_threadq_delete(q->tq);
11912  free(q);
11913 }
11914 
11915 static int stb__work_maxitems = STB_THREADQUEUE_DYNAMIC;
11916 
11917 static void stb_work_init(int num_threads)
11918 {
11919  if (stb__work_global == NULL) {
11920  stb__threadmutex_init();
11921  stb_mutex_begin(stb__workmutex);
11922  stb_barrier();
11923  if (*(stb_workqueue * volatile *) &stb__work_global == NULL)
11924  stb__work_global = stb_workq_new(num_threads, stb__work_maxitems);
11925  stb_mutex_end(stb__workmutex);
11926  }
11927 }
11928 
11929 static int stb__work_raw(stb_workqueue *q, stb_thread_func f, void *d, volatile void **return_code, stb_sync rel)
11930 {
11931  stb__workinfo w;
11932  if (q == NULL) {
11933  stb_work_init(1);
11934  q = stb__work_global;
11935  }
11936  w.f = f;
11937  w.d = d;
11938  w.retval = return_code;
11939  w.sync = rel;
11940  return stb_threadq_add(q->tq, &w);
11941 }
11942 
11943 int stb_workq_length(stb_workqueue *q)
11944 {
11945  return stb_threadq_length(q->tq);
11946 }
11947 
11948 int stb_workq(stb_workqueue *q, stb_thread_func f, void *d, volatile void **return_code)
11949 {
11950  if (f == NULL) return 0;
11951  return stb_workq_reach(q, f, d, return_code, NULL);
11952 }
11953 
11954 int stb_workq_reach(stb_workqueue *q, stb_thread_func f, void *d, volatile void **return_code, stb_sync rel)
11955 {
11956  if (f == NULL) return 0;
11957  return stb__work_raw(q, f, d, return_code, rel);
11958 }
11959 
11960 static void stb__workq_numthreads(stb_workqueue *q, int n)
11961 {
11962  while (q->numthreads < n) {
11963  stb_create_thread(stb__thread_workloop, q);
11964  ++q->numthreads;
11965  }
11966  while (q->numthreads > n) {
11967  stb__work_raw(q, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL);
11968  --q->numthreads;
11969  }
11970 }
11971 
11972 void stb_workq_numthreads(stb_workqueue *q, int n)
11973 {
11974  stb_mutex_begin(stb__threadmutex);
11975  stb__workq_numthreads(q,n);
11976  stb_mutex_end(stb__threadmutex);
11977 }
11978 
11979 int stb_work_maxunits(int n)
11980 {
11981  if (stb__work_global == NULL) {
11982  stb__work_maxitems = n;
11983  stb_work_init(1);
11984  }
11985  return stb__work_maxitems;
11986 }
11987 
11988 int stb_work(stb_thread_func f, void *d, volatile void **return_code)
11989 {
11990  return stb_workq(stb__work_global, f,d,return_code);
11991 }
11992 
11993 int stb_work_reach(stb_thread_func f, void *d, volatile void **return_code, stb_sync rel)
11994 {
11995  return stb_workq_reach(stb__work_global, f,d,return_code,rel);
11996 }
11997 
11998 void stb_work_numthreads(int n)
11999 {
12000  if (stb__work_global == NULL)
12001  stb_work_init(n);
12002  else
12003  stb_workq_numthreads(stb__work_global, n);
12004 }
12005 #endif // STB_DEFINE
12006 
12007 
12009 //
12010 // Background disk I/O
12011 //
12012 //
12013 
12014 #define STB_BGIO_READ_ALL (-1)
12015 STB_EXTERN int stb_bgio_read (char *filename, int offset, int len, stb_uchar **result, int *olen);
12016 STB_EXTERN int stb_bgio_readf (FILE *f , int offset, int len, stb_uchar **result, int *olen);
12017 STB_EXTERN int stb_bgio_read_to (char *filename, int offset, int len, stb_uchar *buffer, int *olen);
12018 STB_EXTERN int stb_bgio_readf_to(FILE *f , int offset, int len, stb_uchar *buffer, int *olen);
12019 
12020 typedef struct
12021 {
12022  int have_data;
12023  int is_valid;
12024  int is_dir;
12025  time_t filetime;
12026  stb_int64 filesize;
12027 } stb_bgstat;
12028 
12029 STB_EXTERN int stb_bgio_stat (char *filename, stb_bgstat *result);
12030 
12031 #ifdef STB_DEFINE
12032 
12033 static stb_workqueue *stb__diskio;
12034 static stb_mutex stb__diskio_mutex;
12035 
12036 void stb_thread_cleanup(void)
12037 {
12038  if (stb__work_global) stb_workq_delete(stb__work_global); stb__work_global = NULL;
12039  if (stb__threadmutex) stb_mutex_delete(stb__threadmutex); stb__threadmutex = NULL;
12040  if (stb__workmutex) stb_mutex_delete(stb__workmutex); stb__workmutex = NULL;
12041  if (stb__diskio) stb_workq_delete(stb__diskio); stb__diskio = NULL;
12042  if (stb__diskio_mutex)stb_mutex_delete(stb__diskio_mutex);stb__diskio_mutex= NULL;
12043 }
12044 
12045 
12046 typedef struct
12047 {
12048  char *filename;
12049  FILE *f;
12050  int offset;
12051  int len;
12052 
12053  stb_bgstat *stat_out;
12054  stb_uchar *output;
12055  stb_uchar **result;
12056  int *len_output;
12057  int *flag;
12058 } stb__disk_command;
12059 
12060 #define STB__MAX_DISK_COMMAND 100
12061 static stb__disk_command stb__dc_queue[STB__MAX_DISK_COMMAND];
12062 static int stb__dc_offset;
12063 
12064 void stb__io_init(void)
12065 {
12066  if (!stb__diskio) {
12067  stb__threadmutex_init();
12068  stb_mutex_begin(stb__threadmutex);
12069  stb_barrier();
12070  if (*(stb_thread * volatile *) &stb__diskio == NULL) {
12071  stb__diskio_mutex = stb_mutex_new();
12072  // use many threads so OS can try to schedule seeks
12073  stb__diskio = stb_workq_new_flags(16,STB__MAX_DISK_COMMAND,STB_FALSE,STB_FALSE);
12074  }
12075  stb_mutex_end(stb__threadmutex);
12076  }
12077 }
12078 
12079 static void * stb__io_error(stb__disk_command *dc)
12080 {
12081  if (dc->len_output) *dc->len_output = 0;
12082  if (dc->result) *dc->result = NULL;
12083  if (dc->flag) *dc->flag = -1;
12084  return NULL;
12085 }
12086 
12087 static void * stb__io_task(void *p)
12088 {
12089  stb__disk_command *dc = (stb__disk_command *) p;
12090  int len;
12091  FILE *f;
12092  stb_uchar *buf;
12093 
12094  if (dc->stat_out) {
12095  struct _stati64 s;
12096  if (!_stati64(dc->filename, &s)) {
12097  dc->stat_out->filesize = s.st_size;
12098  dc->stat_out->filetime = s.st_mtime;
12099  dc->stat_out->is_dir = s.st_mode & _S_IFDIR;
12100  dc->stat_out->is_valid = (s.st_mode & _S_IFREG) || dc->stat_out->is_dir;
12101  } else
12102  dc->stat_out->is_valid = 0;
12103  stb_barrier();
12104  dc->stat_out->have_data = 1;
12105  free(dc->filename);
12106  return 0;
12107  }
12108  if (dc->f) {
12109  #ifdef WIN32
12110  f = _fdopen(_dup(_fileno(dc->f)), "rb");
12111  #else
12112  f = fdopen(dup(fileno(dc->f)), "rb");
12113  #endif
12114  if (!f)
12115  return stb__io_error(dc);
12116  } else {
12117  f = fopen(dc->filename, "rb");
12118  free(dc->filename);
12119  if (!f)
12120  return stb__io_error(dc);
12121  }
12122 
12123  len = dc->len;
12124  if (len < 0) {
12125  fseek(f, 0, SEEK_END);
12126  len = ftell(f) - dc->offset;
12127  }
12128 
12129  if (fseek(f, dc->offset, SEEK_SET)) {
12130  fclose(f);
12131  return stb__io_error(dc);
12132  }
12133 
12134  if (dc->output)
12135  buf = dc->output;
12136  else {
12137  buf = (stb_uchar *) malloc(len);
12138  if (buf == NULL) {
12139  fclose(f);
12140  return stb__io_error(dc);
12141  }
12142  }
12143 
12144  len = fread(buf, 1, len, f);
12145  fclose(f);
12146  if (dc->len_output) *dc->len_output = len;
12147  if (dc->result) *dc->result = buf;
12148  if (dc->flag) *dc->flag = 1;
12149 
12150  return NULL;
12151 }
12152 
12153 int stb__io_add(char *fname, FILE *f, int off, int len, stb_uchar *out, stb_uchar **result, int *olen, int *flag, stb_bgstat *stat)
12154 {
12155  int res;
12156  stb__io_init();
12157  // do memory allocation outside of mutex
12158  if (fname) fname = _strdup(fname);
12159  stb_mutex_begin(stb__diskio_mutex);
12160  {
12161  stb__disk_command *dc = &stb__dc_queue[stb__dc_offset];
12162  dc->filename = fname;
12163  dc->f = f;
12164  dc->offset = off;
12165  dc->len = len;
12166  dc->output = out;
12167  dc->result = result;
12168  dc->len_output = olen;
12169  dc->flag = flag;
12170  dc->stat_out = stat;
12171  res = stb_workq(stb__diskio, stb__io_task, dc, NULL);
12172  if (res)
12173  stb__dc_offset = (stb__dc_offset + 1 == STB__MAX_DISK_COMMAND ? 0 : stb__dc_offset+1);
12174  }
12175  stb_mutex_end(stb__diskio_mutex);
12176  return res;
12177 }
12178 
12179 int stb_bgio_read(char *filename, int offset, int len, stb_uchar **result, int *olen)
12180 {
12181  return stb__io_add(filename,NULL,offset,len,NULL,result,olen,NULL,NULL);
12182 }
12183 
12184 int stb_bgio_readf(FILE *f, int offset, int len, stb_uchar **result, int *olen)
12185 {
12186  return stb__io_add(NULL,f,offset,len,NULL,result,olen,NULL,NULL);
12187 }
12188 
12189 int stb_bgio_read_to(char *filename, int offset, int len, stb_uchar *buffer, int *olen)
12190 {
12191  return stb__io_add(filename,NULL,offset,len,buffer,NULL,olen,NULL,NULL);
12192 }
12193 
12194 int stb_bgio_readf_to(FILE *f, int offset, int len, stb_uchar *buffer, int *olen)
12195 {
12196  return stb__io_add(NULL,f,offset,len,buffer,NULL,olen,NULL,NULL);
12197 }
12198 
12199 STB_EXTERN int stb_bgio_stat (char *filename, stb_bgstat *result)
12200 {
12201  result->have_data = 0;
12202  return stb__io_add(filename,NULL,0,0,0,NULL,0,NULL, result);
12203 }
12204 #endif
12205 #endif
12206 
12207 
12208 
12210 //
12211 // Fast malloc implementation
12212 //
12213 // This is a clone of TCMalloc, but without the thread support.
12214 // 1. large objects are allocated directly, page-aligned
12215 // 2. small objects are allocated in homogeonous heaps, 0 overhead
12216 //
12217 // We keep an allocation table for pages a la TCMalloc. This would
12218 // require 4MB for the entire address space, but we only allocate
12219 // the parts that are in use. The overhead from using homogenous heaps
12220 // everywhere is 3MB. (That is, if you allocate 1 object of each size,
12221 // you'll use 3MB.)
12222 
12223 #if defined(STB_DEFINE) && (defined(_WIN32) || defined(STB_FASTMALLOC))
12224 
12225 #ifdef _WIN32
12226  #ifndef _WINDOWS_
12227  #ifndef STB__IMPORT
12228  #define STB__IMPORT STB_EXTERN __declspec(dllimport)
12229  #define STB__DW unsigned long
12230  #endif
12231  STB__IMPORT void * __stdcall VirtualAlloc(void *p, unsigned long size, unsigned long type, unsigned long protect);
12232  STB__IMPORT int __stdcall VirtualFree(void *p, unsigned long size, unsigned long freetype);
12233  #endif
12234  #define stb__alloc_pages_raw(x) (stb_uint32) VirtualAlloc(NULL, (x), 0x3000, 0x04)
12235  #define stb__dealloc_pages_raw(p) VirtualFree((void *) p, 0, 0x8000)
12236 #else
12237  #error "Platform not currently supported"
12238 #endif
12239 
12240 typedef struct stb__span
12241 {
12242  int start, len;
12243  struct stb__span *next, *prev;
12244  void *first_free;
12245  unsigned short list; // 1..256 free; 257..511 sizeclass; 0=large block
12246  short allocations; // # outstanding allocations for sizeclass
12247 } stb__span; // 24
12248 
12249 static stb__span **stb__span_for_page;
12250 static int stb__firstpage, stb__lastpage;
12251 static void stb__update_page_range(int first, int last)
12252 {
12253  stb__span **sfp;
12254  int i, f,l;
12255  if (first >= stb__firstpage && last <= stb__lastpage) return;
12256  if (stb__span_for_page == NULL) {
12257  f = first;
12258  l = f+stb_max(last-f, 16384);
12259  l = stb_min(l, 1<<20);
12260  } else if (last > stb__lastpage) {
12261  f = stb__firstpage;
12262  l = f + (stb__lastpage - f) * 2;
12263  l = stb_clamp(last, l,1<<20);
12264  } else {
12265  l = stb__lastpage;
12266  f = l - (l - stb__firstpage) * 2;
12267  f = stb_clamp(f, 0,first);
12268  }
12269  sfp = (stb__span **) stb__alloc_pages_raw(sizeof(void *) * (l-f));
12270  for (i=f; i < stb__firstpage; ++i) sfp[i - f] = NULL;
12271  for ( ; i < stb__lastpage ; ++i) sfp[i - f] = stb__span_for_page[i - stb__firstpage];
12272  for ( ; i < l ; ++i) sfp[i - f] = NULL;
12273  if (stb__span_for_page) stb__dealloc_pages_raw(stb__span_for_page);
12274  stb__firstpage = f;
12275  stb__lastpage = l;
12276  stb__span_for_page = sfp;
12277 }
12278 
12279 static stb__span *stb__span_free=NULL;
12280 static stb__span *stb__span_first, *stb__span_end;
12281 static stb__span *stb__span_alloc(void)
12282 {
12283  stb__span *s = stb__span_free;
12284  if (s)
12285  stb__span_free = s->next;
12286  else {
12287  if (!stb__span_first) {
12288  stb__span_first = (stb__span *) stb__alloc_pages_raw(65536);
12289  if (stb__span_first == NULL) return NULL;
12290  stb__span_end = stb__span_first + (65536 / sizeof(stb__span));
12291  }
12292  s = stb__span_first++;
12293  if (stb__span_first == stb__span_end) stb__span_first = NULL;
12294  }
12295  return s;
12296 }
12297 
12298 static stb__span *stb__spanlist[512];
12299 
12300 static void stb__spanlist_unlink(stb__span *s)
12301 {
12302  if (s->prev)
12303  s->prev->next = s->next;
12304  else {
12305  int n = s->list;
12306  assert(stb__spanlist[n] == s);
12307  stb__spanlist[n] = s->next;
12308  }
12309  if (s->next)
12310  s->next->prev = s->prev;
12311  s->next = s->prev = NULL;
12312  s->list = 0;
12313 }
12314 
12315 static void stb__spanlist_add(int n, stb__span *s)
12316 {
12317  s->list = n;
12318  s->next = stb__spanlist[n];
12319  s->prev = NULL;
12320  stb__spanlist[n] = s;
12321  if (s->next) s->next->prev = s;
12322 }
12323 
12324 #define stb__page_shift 12
12325 #define stb__page_size (1 << stb__page_shift)
12326 #define stb__page_number(x) ((x) >> stb__page_shift)
12327 #define stb__page_address(x) ((x) << stb__page_shift)
12328 
12329 static void stb__set_span_for_page(stb__span *s)
12330 {
12331  int i;
12332  for (i=0; i < s->len; ++i)
12333  stb__span_for_page[s->start + i - stb__firstpage] = s;
12334 }
12335 
12336 static stb__span *stb__coalesce(stb__span *a, stb__span *b)
12337 {
12338  assert(a->start + a->len == b->start);
12339  if (a->list) stb__spanlist_unlink(a);
12340  if (b->list) stb__spanlist_unlink(b);
12341  a->len += b->len;
12342  b->len = 0;
12343  b->next = stb__span_free;
12344  stb__span_free = b;
12345  stb__set_span_for_page(a);
12346  return a;
12347 }
12348 
12349 static void stb__free_span(stb__span *s)
12350 {
12351  stb__span *n = NULL;
12352  if (s->start > stb__firstpage) {
12353  n = stb__span_for_page[s->start-1 - stb__firstpage];
12354  if (n && n->allocations == -2 && n->start + n->len == s->start) s = stb__coalesce(n,s);
12355  }
12356  if (s->start + s->len < stb__lastpage) {
12357  n = stb__span_for_page[s->start + s->len - stb__firstpage];
12358  if (n && n->allocations == -2 && s->start + s->len == n->start) s = stb__coalesce(s,n);
12359  }
12360  s->allocations = -2;
12361  stb__spanlist_add(s->len > 256 ? 256 : s->len, s);
12362 }
12363 
12364 static stb__span *stb__alloc_pages(int num)
12365 {
12366  stb__span *s = stb__span_alloc();
12367  int p;
12368  if (!s) return NULL;
12369  p = stb__alloc_pages_raw(num << stb__page_shift);
12370  if (p == 0) { s->next = stb__span_free; stb__span_free = s; return 0; }
12371  assert(stb__page_address(stb__page_number(p)) == p);
12372  p = stb__page_number(p);
12373  stb__update_page_range(p, p+num);
12374  s->start = p;
12375  s->len = num;
12376  s->next = NULL;
12377  s->prev = NULL;
12378  stb__set_span_for_page(s);
12379  return s;
12380 }
12381 
12382 static stb__span *stb__alloc_span(int pagecount)
12383 {
12384  int i;
12385  stb__span *p = NULL;
12386  for(i=pagecount; i < 256; ++i)
12387  if (stb__spanlist[i]) {
12388  p = stb__spanlist[i];
12389  break;
12390  }
12391  if (!p) {
12392  p = stb__spanlist[256];
12393  while (p && p->len < pagecount)
12394  p = p->next;
12395  }
12396  if (!p) {
12397  p = stb__alloc_pages(pagecount < 16 ? 16 : pagecount);
12398  if (p == NULL) return 0;
12399  } else
12400  stb__spanlist_unlink(p);
12401 
12402  if (p->len > pagecount) {
12403  stb__span *q = stb__span_alloc();
12404  if (q) {
12405  q->start = p->start + pagecount;
12406  q->len = p->len - pagecount;
12407  p->len = pagecount;
12408  for (i=0; i < q->len; ++i)
12409  stb__span_for_page[q->start+i - stb__firstpage] = q;
12410  stb__spanlist_add(q->len > 256 ? 256 : q->len, q);
12411  }
12412  }
12413  return p;
12414 }
12415 
12416 #define STB__MAX_SMALL_SIZE 32768
12417 #define STB__MAX_SIZE_CLASSES 256
12418 
12419 static unsigned char stb__class_base[32];
12420 static unsigned char stb__class_shift[32];
12421 static unsigned char stb__pages_for_class[STB__MAX_SIZE_CLASSES];
12422 static int stb__size_for_class[STB__MAX_SIZE_CLASSES];
12423 
12424 stb__span *stb__get_nonempty_sizeclass(int c)
12425 {
12426  int s = c + 256, i, size, tsize; // remap to span-list index
12427  char *z;
12428  void *q;
12429  stb__span *p = stb__spanlist[s];
12430  if (p) {
12431  if (p->first_free) return p; // fast path: it's in the first one in list
12432  for (p=p->next; p; p=p->next)
12433  if (p->first_free) {
12434  // move to front for future queries
12435  stb__spanlist_unlink(p);
12436  stb__spanlist_add(s, p);
12437  return p;
12438  }
12439  }
12440  // no non-empty ones, so allocate a new one
12441  p = stb__alloc_span(stb__pages_for_class[c]);
12442  if (!p) return NULL;
12443  // create the free list up front
12444  size = stb__size_for_class[c];
12445  tsize = stb__pages_for_class[c] << stb__page_shift;
12446  i = 0;
12447  z = (char *) stb__page_address(p->start);
12448  q = NULL;
12449  while (i + size <= tsize) {
12450  * (void **) z = q; q = z;
12451  z += size;
12452  i += size;
12453  }
12454  p->first_free = q;
12455  p->allocations = 0;
12456  stb__spanlist_add(s,p);
12457  return p;
12458 }
12459 
12460 static int stb__sizeclass(size_t sz)
12461 {
12462  int z = stb_log2_floor(sz); // -1 below to group e.g. 13,14,15,16 correctly
12463  return stb__class_base[z] + ((sz-1) >> stb__class_shift[z]);
12464 }
12465 
12466 static void stb__init_sizeclass(void)
12467 {
12468  int i, size, overhead;
12469  int align_shift = 2; // allow 4-byte and 12-byte blocks as well, vs. TCMalloc
12470  int next_class = 1;
12471  int last_log = 0;
12472 
12473  for (i = 0; i < align_shift; i++) {
12474  stb__class_base [i] = next_class;
12475  stb__class_shift[i] = align_shift;
12476  }
12477 
12478  for (size = 1 << align_shift; size <= STB__MAX_SMALL_SIZE; size += 1 << align_shift) {
12479  i = stb_log2_floor(size);
12480  if (i > last_log) {
12481  if (size == 16) ++align_shift; // switch from 4-byte to 8-byte alignment
12482  else if (size >= 128 && align_shift < 8) ++align_shift;
12483  stb__class_base[i] = next_class - ((size-1) >> align_shift);
12484  stb__class_shift[i] = align_shift;
12485  last_log = i;
12486  }
12487  stb__size_for_class[next_class++] = size;
12488  }
12489 
12490  for (i=1; i <= STB__MAX_SMALL_SIZE; ++i)
12491  assert(i <= stb__size_for_class[stb__sizeclass(i)]);
12492 
12493  overhead = 0;
12494  for (i = 1; i < next_class; i++) {
12495  int s = stb__size_for_class[i];
12496  size = stb__page_size;
12497  while (size % s > size >> 3)
12498  size += stb__page_size;
12499  stb__pages_for_class[i] = (unsigned char) (size >> stb__page_shift);
12500  overhead += size;
12501  }
12502  assert(overhead < (4 << 20)); // make sure it's under 4MB of overhead
12503 }
12504 
12505 #ifdef STB_DEBUG
12506 #define stb__smemset(a,b,c) memset((void *) a, b, c)
12507 #elif defined(STB_FASTMALLOC_INIT)
12508 #define stb__smemset(a,b,c) memset((void *) a, b, c)
12509 #else
12510 #define stb__smemset(a,b,c)
12511 #endif
12512 void *stb_smalloc(size_t sz)
12513 {
12514  stb__span *s;
12515  if (sz == 0) return NULL;
12516  if (stb__size_for_class[1] == 0) stb__init_sizeclass();
12517  if (sz > STB__MAX_SMALL_SIZE) {
12518  s = stb__alloc_span((sz + stb__page_size - 1) >> stb__page_shift);
12519  if (s == NULL) return NULL;
12520  s->list = 0;
12521  s->next = s->prev = NULL;
12522  s->allocations = -32767;
12523  stb__smemset(stb__page_address(s->start), 0xcd, (sz+3)&~3);
12524  return (void *) stb__page_address(s->start);
12525  } else {
12526  void *p;
12527  int c = stb__sizeclass(sz);
12528  s = stb__spanlist[256+c];
12529  if (!s || !s->first_free)
12530  s = stb__get_nonempty_sizeclass(c);
12531  if (s == NULL) return NULL;
12532  p = s->first_free;
12533  s->first_free = * (void **) p;
12534  ++s->allocations;
12535  stb__smemset(p,0xcd, sz);
12536  return p;
12537  }
12538 }
12539 
12540 int stb_ssize(void *p)
12541 {
12542  stb__span *s;
12543  if (p == NULL) return 0;
12544  s = stb__span_for_page[stb__page_number((stb_uint) p) - stb__firstpage];
12545  if (s->list >= 256) {
12546  return stb__size_for_class[s->list - 256];
12547  } else {
12548  assert(s->list == 0);
12549  return s->len << stb__page_shift;
12550  }
12551 }
12552 
12553 void stb_sfree(void *p)
12554 {
12555  stb__span *s;
12556  if (p == NULL) return;
12557  s = stb__span_for_page[stb__page_number((stb_uint) p) - stb__firstpage];
12558  if (s->list >= 256) {
12559  stb__smemset(p, 0xfe, stb__size_for_class[s->list-256]);
12560  * (void **) p = s->first_free;
12561  s->first_free = p;
12562  if (--s->allocations == 0) {
12563  stb__spanlist_unlink(s);
12564  stb__free_span(s);
12565  }
12566  } else {
12567  assert(s->list == 0);
12568  stb__smemset(p, 0xfe, stb_ssize(p));
12569  stb__free_span(s);
12570  }
12571 }
12572 
12573 void *stb_srealloc(void *p, size_t sz)
12574 {
12575  size_t cur_size;
12576  if (p == NULL) return stb_smalloc(sz);
12577  if (sz == 0) { stb_sfree(p); return NULL; }
12578  cur_size = stb_ssize(p);
12579  if (sz > cur_size || sz <= (cur_size >> 1)) {
12580  void *q;
12581  if (sz > cur_size && sz < (cur_size << 1)) sz = cur_size << 1;
12582  q = stb_smalloc(sz); if (q == NULL) return NULL;
12583  memcpy(q, p, sz < cur_size ? sz : cur_size);
12584  stb_sfree(p);
12585  return q;
12586  }
12587  return p;
12588 }
12589 
12590 void *stb_scalloc(size_t n, size_t sz)
12591 {
12592  void *p;
12593  if (n == 0 || sz == 0) return NULL;
12594  if (stb_log2_ceil(n) + stb_log2_ceil(n) >= 32) return NULL;
12595  p = stb_smalloc(n*sz);
12596  if (p) memset(p, 0, n*sz);
12597  return p;
12598 }
12599 
12600 char *stb_s_strdup(char *s)
12601 {
12602  int n = strlen(s);
12603  char *p = (char *) stb_smalloc(n+1);
12604  if (p) strcpy(p,s);
12605  return p;
12606 }
12607 #endif // STB_DEFINE
12608 
12609 
12610 
12612 //
12613 // Source code constants
12614 //
12615 // This is a trivial system to let you specify constants in source code,
12616 // then while running you can change the constants.
12617 //
12618 // Note that you can't wrap the #defines, because we need to know their
12619 // names. So we provide a pre-wrapped version without 'STB_' for convenience;
12620 // to request it, #define STB_CONVENIENT_H, yielding:
12621 // KI -- integer
12622 // KU -- unsigned integer
12623 // KF -- float
12624 // KD -- double
12625 // KS -- string constant
12626 //
12627 // Defaults to functioning in debug build, not in release builds.
12628 // To force on, define STB_ALWAYS_H
12629 
12630 #ifdef STB_CONVENIENT_H
12631 #define KI(x) STB_I(x)
12632 #define KU(x) STB_UI(x)
12633 #define KF(x) STB_F(x)
12634 #define KD(x) STB_D(x)
12635 #define KS(x) STB_S(x)
12636 #endif
12637 
12638 STB_EXTERN void stb_source_path(char *str);
12639 #ifdef STB_DEFINE
12640 char *stb__source_path;
12641 void stb_source_path(char *path)
12642 {
12643  stb__source_path = path;
12644 }
12645 
12646 char *stb__get_sourcefile_path(char *file)
12647 {
12648  static char filebuf[512];
12649  if (stb__source_path) {
12650  sprintf(filebuf, "%s/%s", stb__source_path, file);
12651  if (stb_fexists(filebuf)) return filebuf;
12652  }
12653 
12654  if (stb_fexists(file)) return file;
12655 
12656  sprintf(filebuf, "../%s", file);
12657  if (!stb_fexists(filebuf)) return filebuf;
12658 
12659  return file;
12660 }
12661 #endif
12662 
12663 #define STB_F(x) ((float) STB_H(x))
12664 #define STB_UI(x) ((unsigned int) STB_I(x))
12665 
12666 #if !defined(STB_DEBUG) && !defined(STB_ALWAYS_H)
12667 #define STB_D(x) ((double) (x))
12668 #define STB_I(x) ((int) (x))
12669 #define STB_S(x) ((char *) (x))
12670 #else
12671 #define STB_D(x) stb__double_constant(__FILE__, __LINE__-1, (x))
12672 #define STB_I(x) stb__int_constant(__FILE__, __LINE__-1, (x))
12673 #define STB_S(x) stb__string_constant(__FILE__, __LINE__-1, (x))
12674 
12675 STB_EXTERN double stb__double_constant(char *file, int line, double x);
12676 STB_EXTERN int stb__int_constant(char *file, int line, int x);
12677 STB_EXTERN char * stb__string_constant(char *file, int line, char *str);
12678 
12679 #ifdef STB_DEFINE
12680 
12681 enum
12682 {
12683  STB__CTYPE_int,
12684  STB__CTYPE_uint,
12685  STB__CTYPE_float,
12686  STB__CTYPE_double,
12687  STB__CTYPE_string,
12688 };
12689 
12690 typedef struct
12691 {
12692  int line;
12693  int type;
12694  union {
12695  int ival;
12696  double dval;
12697  char *sval;
12698  };
12699 } stb__Entry;
12700 
12701 typedef struct
12702 {
12703  stb__Entry *entries;
12704  char *filename;
12705  time_t timestamp;
12706  char **file_data;
12707  int file_len;
12708  unsigned short *line_index;
12709 } stb__FileEntry;
12710 
12711 static void stb__constant_parse(stb__FileEntry *f, int i)
12712 {
12713  char *s;
12714  int n;
12715  if (!stb_arr_valid(f->entries, i)) return;
12716  n = f->entries[i].line;
12717  if (n >= f->file_len) return;
12718  s = f->file_data[n];
12719  switch (f->entries[i].type) {
12720  case STB__CTYPE_float:
12721  while (*s) {
12722  if (!strncmp(s, "STB_D(", 6)) { s+=6; goto matched_float; }
12723  if (!strncmp(s, "STB_F(", 6)) { s+=6; goto matched_float; }
12724  if (!strncmp(s, "KD(", 3)) { s+=3; goto matched_float; }
12725  if (!strncmp(s, "KF(", 3)) { s+=3; goto matched_float; }
12726  ++s;
12727  }
12728  break;
12729  matched_float:
12730  f->entries[i].dval = strtod(s, NULL);
12731  break;
12732  case STB__CTYPE_int:
12733  while (*s) {
12734  if (!strncmp(s, "STB_I(", 6)) { s+=6; goto matched_int; }
12735  if (!strncmp(s, "STB_UI(", 7)) { s+=7; goto matched_int; }
12736  if (!strncmp(s, "KI(", 3)) { s+=3; goto matched_int; }
12737  if (!strncmp(s, "KU(", 3)) { s+=3; goto matched_int; }
12738  ++s;
12739  }
12740  break;
12741  matched_int: {
12742  int neg=0;
12743  s = stb_skipwhite(s);
12744  while (*s == '-') { neg = !neg; s = stb_skipwhite(s+1); } // handle '- - 5', pointlessly
12745  if (s[0] == '0' && tolower(s[1]) == 'x')
12746  f->entries[i].ival = strtol(s, NULL, 16);
12747  else if (s[0] == '0')
12748  f->entries[i].ival = strtol(s, NULL, 8);
12749  else
12750  f->entries[i].ival = strtol(s, NULL, 10);
12751  if (neg) f->entries[i].ival = -f->entries[i].ival;
12752  break;
12753  }
12754  case STB__CTYPE_string:
12755  // @TODO
12756  break;
12757  }
12758 }
12759 
12760 static stb_sdict *stb__constant_file_hash;
12761 
12762 stb__Entry *stb__constant_get_entry(char *filename, int line, int type)
12763 {
12764  int i;
12765  stb__FileEntry *f;
12766  if (stb__constant_file_hash == NULL)
12767  stb__constant_file_hash = stb_sdict_new(STB_TRUE);
12768  f = (stb__FileEntry*) stb_sdict_get(stb__constant_file_hash, filename);
12769  if (f == NULL) {
12770  char *s = stb__get_sourcefile_path(filename);
12771  if (s == NULL || !stb_fexists(s)) return 0;
12772  f = (stb__FileEntry *) malloc(sizeof(*f));
12773  f->timestamp = stb_ftimestamp(s);
12774  f->file_data = stb_stringfile(s, &f->file_len);
12775  f->filename = _strdup(s); // cache the full path
12776  f->entries = NULL;
12777  f->line_index = 0;
12778  stb_arr_setlen(f->line_index, f->file_len);
12779  memset(f->line_index, 0xff, stb_arr_storage(f->line_index));
12780  } else {
12781  time_t t = stb_ftimestamp(f->filename);
12782  if (f->timestamp != t) {
12783  f->timestamp = t;
12784  free(f->file_data);
12785  f->file_data = stb_stringfile(f->filename, &f->file_len);
12786  stb_arr_setlen(f->line_index, f->file_len);
12787  for (i=0; i < stb_arr_len(f->entries); ++i)
12788  stb__constant_parse(f, i);
12789  }
12790  }
12791 
12792  if (line >= f->file_len) return 0;
12793 
12794  if (f->line_index[line] >= stb_arr_len(f->entries)) {
12795  // need a new entry
12796  int n = stb_arr_len(f->entries);
12797  stb__Entry e;
12798  e.line = line;
12799  if (line < f->file_len)
12800  f->line_index[line] = n;
12801  e.type = type;
12802  stb_arr_push(f->entries, e);
12803  stb__constant_parse(f, n);
12804  }
12805  return f->entries + f->line_index[line];
12806 }
12807 
12808 double stb__double_constant(char *file, int line, double x)
12809 {
12810  stb__Entry *e = stb__constant_get_entry(file, line, STB__CTYPE_float);
12811  if (!e) return x;
12812  return e->dval;
12813 }
12814 
12815 int stb__int_constant(char *file, int line, int x)
12816 {
12817  stb__Entry *e = stb__constant_get_entry(file, line, STB__CTYPE_int);
12818  if (!e) return x;
12819  return e->ival;
12820 }
12821 
12822 char * stb__string_constant(char *file, int line, char *x)
12823 {
12824  stb__Entry *e = stb__constant_get_entry(file, line, STB__CTYPE_string);
12825  if (!e) return x;
12826  return e->sval;
12827 }
12828 
12829 #endif // STB_DEFINE
12830 #endif // !STB_DEBUG && !STB_ALWAYS_H
12831 
12832 
12833 #ifdef STB_STUA
12834 //
12836 // stua: little scripting language
12837 //
12838 // define STB_STUA to compile it
12839 //
12840 // see http://nothings.org/stb/stb_stua.html for documentation
12841 //
12842 // basic parsing model:
12843 //
12844 // lexical analysis
12845 // use stb_lex() to parse tokens; keywords get their own tokens
12846 //
12847 // parsing:
12848 // recursive descent parser. too much of a hassle to make an unambiguous
12849 // LR(1) grammar, and one-pass generation is clumsier (recursive descent
12850 // makes it easier to e.g. compile nested functions). on the other hand,
12851 // dictionary syntax required hackery to get extra lookahead.
12852 //
12853 // codegen:
12854 // output into an evaluation tree, using array indices as 'pointers'
12855 //
12856 // run:
12857 // traverse the tree; support for 'break/continue/return' is tricky
12858 //
12859 // garbage collection:
12860 // stu__mark and sweep; explicit stack with non-stu__compile_global_scope roots
12861 
12862 typedef stb_int32 stua_obj;
12863 
12864 typedef stb_idict stua_dict;
12865 
12866 STB_EXTERN void stua_run_script(char *s);
12867 STB_EXTERN void stua_uninit(void);
12868 
12869 extern stua_obj stua_globals;
12870 
12871 STB_EXTERN double stua_number(stua_obj z);
12872 
12873 STB_EXTERN stua_obj stua_getnil(void);
12874 STB_EXTERN stua_obj stua_getfalse(void);
12875 STB_EXTERN stua_obj stua_gettrue(void);
12876 STB_EXTERN stua_obj stua_string(char *z);
12877 STB_EXTERN stua_obj stua_make_number(double d);
12878 STB_EXTERN stua_obj stua_box(int type, void *data, int size);
12879 
12880 enum
12881 {
12882  STUA_op_negate=129,
12883  STUA_op_shl, STUA_op_ge,
12884  STUA_op_shr, STUA_op_le,
12885  STUA_op_shru,
12886  STUA_op_last
12887 };
12888 
12889 #define STUA_NO_VALUE 2 // equivalent to a tagged NULL
12890 STB_EXTERN stua_obj (*stua_overload)(int op, stua_obj a, stua_obj b, stua_obj c);
12891 
12892 STB_EXTERN stua_obj stua_error(char *err, ...);
12893 
12894 STB_EXTERN stua_obj stua_pushroot(stua_obj o);
12895 STB_EXTERN void stua_poproot ( void );
12896 
12897 
12898 #ifdef STB_DEFINE
12899 // INTERPRETER
12900 
12901 // 31-bit floating point implementation
12902 // force the (1 << 30) bit (2nd highest bit) to be zero by re-biasing the exponent;
12903 // then shift and set the bottom bit
12904 
12905 static stua_obj stu__floatp(float *f)
12906 {
12907  unsigned int n = *(unsigned int *) f;
12908  unsigned int e = n & (0xff << 23);
12909 
12910  assert(sizeof(int) == 4 && sizeof(float) == 4);
12911 
12912  if (!e) // zero?
12913  n = n; // no change
12914  else if (e < (64 << 23)) // underflow of the packed encoding?
12915  n = (n & 0x80000000); // signed 0
12916  else if (e > (190 << 23)) // overflow of the encoding? (or INF or NAN)
12917  n = (n & 0x80000000) + (127 << 23); // new INF encoding
12918  else
12919  n -= 0x20000000;
12920 
12921  // now we need to shuffle the bits so that the spare bit is at the bottom
12922  assert((n & 0x40000000) == 0);
12923  return (n & 0x80000000) + (n << 1) + 1;
12924 }
12925 
12926 static unsigned char stu__getfloat_addend[256];
12927 static float stu__getfloat(stua_obj v)
12928 {
12929  unsigned int n;
12930  unsigned int e = ((unsigned int) v) >> 24;
12931 
12932  n = (int) v >> 1; // preserve high bit
12933  n += stu__getfloat_addend[e] << 24;
12934  return *(float *) &n;
12935 }
12936 
12937 stua_obj stua_float(float f)
12938 {
12939  return stu__floatp(&f);
12940 }
12941 
12942 static void stu__float_init(void)
12943 {
12944  int i;
12945  stu__getfloat_addend[0] = 0; // do nothing to biased exponent of 0
12946  for (i=1; i < 127; ++i)
12947  stu__getfloat_addend[i] = 32; // undo the -0x20000000
12948  stu__getfloat_addend[127] = 64; // convert packed INF to INF (0x3f -> 0x7f)
12949 
12950  for (i=0; i < 128; ++i) // for signed floats, remove the bit we just shifted down
12951  stu__getfloat_addend[128+i] = stu__getfloat_addend[i] - 64;
12952 }
12953 
12954 // Tagged data type implementation
12955 
12956  // TAGS:
12957 #define stu__int_tag 0 // of 2 bits // 00 int
12958 #define stu__float_tag 1 // of 1 bit // 01 float
12959 #define stu__ptr_tag 2 // of 2 bits // 10 boxed
12960  // 11 float
12961 
12962 #define stu__tag(x) ((x) & 3)
12963 #define stu__number(x) (stu__tag(x) != stu__ptr_tag)
12964 #define stu__isint(x) (stu__tag(x) == stu__int_tag)
12965 
12966 #define stu__int(x) ((x) >> 2)
12967 #define stu__float(x) (stu__getfloat(x))
12968 
12969 #define stu__makeint(v) ((v)*4+stu__int_tag)
12970 
12971 // boxed data, and tag support for boxed data
12972 
12973 enum
12974 {
12975  STU___float = 1, STU___int = 2,
12976  STU___number = 3, STU___string = 4,
12977  STU___function = 5, STU___dict = 6,
12978  STU___boolean = 7, STU___error = 8,
12979 };
12980 
12981 // boxed data
12982 #define STU__BOX short type, stua_gc
12983 typedef struct stu__box { STU__BOX; } stu__box;
12984 
12985 stu__box stu__nil = { 0, 1 };
12986 stu__box stu__true = { STU___boolean, 1, };
12987 stu__box stu__false = { STU___boolean, 1, };
12988 
12989 #define stu__makeptr(v) ((stua_obj) (v) + stu__ptr_tag)
12990 
12991 #define stua_nil stu__makeptr(&stu__nil)
12992 #define stua_true stu__makeptr(&stu__true)
12993 #define stua_false stu__makeptr(&stu__false)
12994 
12995 stua_obj stua_getnil(void) { return stua_nil; }
12996 stua_obj stua_getfalse(void) { return stua_false; }
12997 stua_obj stua_gettrue(void) { return stua_true; }
12998 
12999 #define stu__ptr(x) ((stu__box *) ((x) - stu__ptr_tag))
13000 
13001 #define stu__checkt(t,x) ((t) == STU___float ? ((x) & 1) == stu__float_tag : \
13002  (t) == STU___int ? stu__isint(x) : \
13003  (t) == STU___number ? stu__number(x) : \
13004  stu__tag(x) == stu__ptr_tag && stu__ptr(x)->type == (t))
13005 
13006 typedef struct
13007 {
13008  STU__BOX;
13009  void *ptr;
13010 } stu__wrapper;
13011 
13012 // implementation of a 'function' or function + closure
13013 
13014 typedef struct stu__func
13015 {
13016  STU__BOX;
13017  stua_obj closure_source; // 0 - regular function; 4 - C function
13018  // if closure, pointer to source function
13019  union {
13020  stua_obj closure_data; // partial-application data
13021  void *store; // pointer to free that holds 'code'
13022  stua_obj (*func)(stua_dict *context);
13023  } f;
13024  // closure ends here
13025  short *code;
13026  int num_param;
13027  stua_obj *param; // list of parameter strings
13028 } stu__func;
13029 
13030 // apply this to 'short *code' to get at data
13031 #define stu__const(f) ((stua_obj *) (f))
13032 
13033 static void stu__free_func(stu__func *f)
13034 {
13035  if (f->closure_source == 0) free(f->f.store);
13036  if ((stb_uint) f->closure_source <= 4) free(f->param);
13037  free(f);
13038 }
13039 
13040 #define stu__pd(x) ((stua_dict *) stu__ptr(x))
13041 #define stu__pw(x) ((stu__wrapper *) stu__ptr(x))
13042 #define stu__pf(x) ((stu__func *) stu__ptr(x))
13043 
13044 
13045 // garbage-collection
13046 
13047 
13048 static stu__box ** stu__gc_ptrlist;
13049 static stua_obj * stu__gc_root_stack;
13050 
13051 stua_obj stua_pushroot(stua_obj o) { stb_arr_push(stu__gc_root_stack, o); return o; }
13052 void stua_poproot ( void ) { stb_arr_pop(stu__gc_root_stack); }
13053 
13054 static stb_sdict *stu__strings;
13055 static void stu__mark(stua_obj z)
13056 {
13057  int i;
13058  stu__box *p = stu__ptr(z);
13059  if (p->stua_gc == 1) return; // already marked
13060  assert(p->stua_gc == 0);
13061  p->stua_gc = 1;
13062  switch(p->type) {
13063  case STU___function: {
13064  stu__func *f = (stu__func *) p;
13065  if ((stb_uint) f->closure_source <= 4) {
13066  if (f->closure_source == 0) {
13067  for (i=1; i <= f->code[0]; ++i)
13068  if (!stu__number(((stua_obj *) f->code)[-i]))
13069  stu__mark(((stua_obj *) f->code)[-i]);
13070  }
13071  for (i=0; i < f->num_param; ++i)
13072  stu__mark(f->param[i]);
13073  } else {
13074  stu__mark(f->closure_source);
13075  stu__mark(f->f.closure_data);
13076  }
13077  break;
13078  }
13079  case STU___dict: {
13080  stua_dict *e = (stua_dict *) p;
13081  for (i=0; i < e->limit; ++i)
13082  if (e->table[i].k != STB_IEMPTY && e->table[i].k != STB_IDEL) {
13083  if (!stu__number(e->table[i].k)) stu__mark((int) e->table[i].k);
13084  if (!stu__number(e->table[i].v)) stu__mark((int) e->table[i].v);
13085  }
13086  break;
13087  }
13088  }
13089 }
13090 
13091 static int stu__num_allocs, stu__size_allocs;
13092 static stua_obj stu__flow_val = stua_nil; // used for break & return
13093 
13094 static void stua_gc(int force)
13095 {
13096  int i;
13097  if (!force && stu__num_allocs == 0 && stu__size_allocs == 0) return;
13098  stu__num_allocs = stu__size_allocs = 0;
13099  //printf("[gc]\n");
13100 
13101  // clear marks
13102  for (i=0; i < stb_arr_len(stu__gc_ptrlist); ++i)
13103  stu__gc_ptrlist[i]->stua_gc = 0;
13104 
13105  // stu__mark everything reachable
13106  stu__nil.stua_gc = stu__true.stua_gc = stu__false.stua_gc = 1;
13107  stu__mark(stua_globals);
13108  if (!stu__number(stu__flow_val))
13109  stu__mark(stu__flow_val);
13110  for (i=0; i < stb_arr_len(stu__gc_root_stack); ++i)
13111  if (!stu__number(stu__gc_root_stack[i]))
13112  stu__mark(stu__gc_root_stack[i]);
13113 
13114  // sweep unreachables
13115  for (i=0; i < stb_arr_len(stu__gc_ptrlist);) {
13116  stu__box *z = stu__gc_ptrlist[i];
13117  if (!z->stua_gc) {
13118  switch (z->type) {
13119  case STU___dict: stb_idict_destroy((stua_dict *) z); break;
13120  case STU___error: free(((stu__wrapper *) z)->ptr); break;
13121  case STU___string: stb_sdict_remove(stu__strings, (char*) ((stu__wrapper *) z)->ptr, NULL); free(z); break;
13122  case STU___function: stu__free_func((stu__func *) z); break;
13123  }
13124  // swap in the last item over this, and repeat
13125  z = stb_arr_pop(stu__gc_ptrlist);
13126  stu__gc_ptrlist[i] = z;
13127  } else
13128  ++i;
13129  }
13130 }
13131 
13132 static void stu__consider_gc(stua_obj x)
13133 {
13134  if (stu__size_allocs < 100000) return;
13135  if (stu__num_allocs < 10 && stu__size_allocs < 1000000) return;
13136  stb_arr_push(stu__gc_root_stack, x);
13137  stua_gc(0);
13138  stb_arr_pop(stu__gc_root_stack);
13139 }
13140 
13141 static stua_obj stu__makeobj(int type, void *data, int size, int safe_to_gc)
13142 {
13143  stua_obj x = stu__makeptr(data);
13144  ((stu__box *) data)->type = type;
13145  stb_arr_push(stu__gc_ptrlist, (stu__box *) data);
13146  stu__num_allocs += 1;
13147  stu__size_allocs += size;
13148  if (safe_to_gc) stu__consider_gc(x);
13149  return x;
13150 }
13151 
13152 stua_obj stua_box(int type, void *data, int size)
13153 {
13154  stu__wrapper *p = (stu__wrapper *) malloc(sizeof(*p));
13155  p->ptr = data;
13156  return stu__makeobj(type, p, size, 0);
13157 }
13158 
13159 // a stu string can be directly compared for equality, because
13160 // they go into a hash table
13161 stua_obj stua_string(char *z)
13162 {
13163  stu__wrapper *b = (stu__wrapper *) stb_sdict_get(stu__strings, z);
13164  if (b == NULL) {
13165  int o = stua_box(STU___string, NULL, strlen(z) + sizeof(*b));
13166  b = stu__pw(o);
13167  stb_sdict_add(stu__strings, z, b);
13168  stb_sdict_getkey(stu__strings, z, (char **) &b->ptr);
13169  }
13170  return stu__makeptr(b);
13171 }
13172 
13173 // stb_obj dictionary is just an stb_idict
13174 static void stu__set(stua_dict *d, stua_obj k, stua_obj v)
13175 { if (stb_idict_set(d, k, v)) stu__size_allocs += 8; }
13176 
13177 static stua_obj stu__get(stua_dict *d, stua_obj k, stua_obj res)
13178 {
13179  stb_idict_get_flag(d, k, &res);
13180  return res;
13181 }
13182 
13183 static stua_obj make_string(char *z, int len)
13184 {
13185  stua_obj s;
13186  char temp[256], *q = (char *) stb_temp(temp, len+1), *p = q;
13187  while (len > 0) {
13188  if (*z == '\\') {
13189  if (z[1] == 'n') *p = '\n';
13190  else if (z[1] == 'r') *p = '\r';
13191  else if (z[1] == 't') *p = '\t';
13192  else *p = z[1];
13193  p += 1; z += 2; len -= 2;
13194  } else {
13195  *p++ = *z++; len -= 1;
13196  }
13197  }
13198  *p = 0;
13199  s = stua_string(q);
13200  stb_tempfree(temp, q);
13201  return s;
13202 }
13203 
13204 enum token_names
13205 {
13206  T__none=128,
13207  ST_shl = STUA_op_shl, ST_ge = STUA_op_ge,
13208  ST_shr = STUA_op_shr, ST_le = STUA_op_le,
13209  ST_shru = STUA_op_shru, STU__negate = STUA_op_negate,
